The client did not forget about it and asked for an update today. keely: Vijesh has a call tomorrow with Fabian and OpenShift people. @Fabian-Stephan please comment here after the call. Fabian-Stephan: FYI: @keely So, unfortunately, the RedHat contact did not join although having accepted the invite. Nevertheless we were able to agree to the following customer reuqirements. 1. More transperancy in our usage of third party software Customer expects that for - especially third party software - which we include in our product, it is made transparent why we do that / what it is used for. 2. A legal statement for the question: "Is every software component which is included in the watsonx.ai product covered by the software subscription contract by IBM" (I asked the customer to provide a reference to this contract) AND are the BSI Grundschutz (Geman Federal Office for Information Security) specific Container Security Requirements addressed, and, if so, provide details how this is done by IBM. (also asked the client for specific requirement. **For 1.)** that should be homework for Product Management together with Development to provide the information if they find it to be a good idea doing so. @vijesh-bhaktha is taking this with him. **For 2.)** We are waiting for the customer's specific requirements and then ask CISO/legal to provide a statement. @vijesh-bhaktha is trying to find the right contact for that specifially for watsonx.ai - if this role exist. Fabian-Stephan: Update: - Requested SBOM via [form ](https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/supply-chain-security/request-an-sbom )here: https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/forms-review/1455f7dccc81a542036ae3e251dc49cb/32fcdb70-f28c-11ef-8b3a-bf661266f501 - any direct contact we can utilize @vijesh-bhaktha ? Fabian-Stephan: ### Udated requirements from customer specific to watsonx.ai. `Not providing an answer / not matching the requirments might lead to loss of deployments for all german federl customers using containerized IBM software as these requirements need to be matched by all federal institutions.` - **IBM must assure overall responsibility for its â€œproductâ€ being compliant with SYS.1.6.A6 and .A12 requirements from the "[Basic IT Security](https://www.bsi.bund.de/EN/Themen/Unternehmen-und-Organisationen/Standards-und-Zertifizierung/IT-Grundschutz/it-grundschutz_node.html)" catalouge by the german federal office for information security.** (see specific requirements below). This applies to all individual software modules (pods/containers/contained individual software packages) installed directly or as a technical dependency. This means that if â€œexternalâ€ sources are integrated, IBM must ensure that the respective providers fulfill the requirements of SYS.1.6.A6. - **Container Bill of Material:** - The provider must provide something in the form of a â€œContainer Bill of Materialâ€, i.e. a list of all containers required for the overall functionality of the product with their respective providers (i.e. which company or organization created the container) and technical provisioning path (â€œdownloadâ€ via which repository) and additional documentation for each software componof the individual requirements contained in SYS.1.6.A12. - **SBOM:** In addition, SBOMs should be provided for all containers or for the overall product. - @Fabian-Stephan already requested this via this [form](https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/supply-chain-security/request-an-sbom). Any way to push this from your end @keely, @FRANKO? Requirements SYS.1.6.A6 - **"Usage of secure images"** > The source MUST be selected on the basis that the software contained in the image is regularly checked for security problems and that these are rectified and documented. The source MUST guarantee and comply with this handling of security problems mentioned above. The version of base images used MUST NOT be deprecated. Unique version numbers MUST be specified. If an image with a newer version number is available, patch and change management MUST check whether and how it can be rolled out. Requirements SYS.1.6.A12 - **"Distribution of secure images"** > It SHOULD be adequately documented which sources for images have been classified as trustworthy and why. In addition, the process of how images or the software components contained in the image are obtained from trusted sources and ultimately made available for productive operation SHOULD be adequately documented. The images used SHOULD have metadata that makes the function and history of the image traceable. Digital signatures SHOULD protect each image against modification. ### --> As we need these requirements fulfilled for each software component in our software, we need a statement from Software Development stating their position towards these requirements and how they address them currently for each software component, especially for third party dependencies. FRANKO: Hi @Fabian-Stephan Let's discuss this later today and agree how we get the required attention from PM;. @keely, happy to escalate ie to Ritika etc but let's align also today. On yesterdays review with Janine, Kim, Robin etc we showed the momentum we are building establishing these platforms, but this topic can as @Fabian-Stephan rightly state stall our major cases in Germany and EMEA within Federal etc. Fabian-Stephan: update: Send an email to [Suzanne Sheridan](https://w3.ibm.com/#/people/profile?email=SSheridan@ie.ibm.com), [Melba Lopez](https://w3.ibm.com/#/people/profile?email=Melba.Lopez@ibm.com), [Zadia Alden](https://w3.ibm.com/#/people/profile?email=8WARTNZ@uk.ibm.com), [Justin Stahl](https://w3.ibm.com/#/people/profile?email=Justin.Stahl@ibm.com), and [John Bergland](https://w3.ibm.com/#/people/profile?email=john_bergland@us.ibm.com) from the supply chain security team requesting support. Pending an answer. Fabian-Stephan: **Update**: FYI: @FRANKO , @keely Nicoel O'Connor (Director, CISO Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC)) referred me the german legal team responsible for the matter as the worldwide team "removed German IT Grundschutz from our IRC list a few years ago because its a set of standards and recommendations, not a mandatory law" which might be correct, but if it is treated like one by the german public customers and competitors fulfil the requirements instead of us, then we are not in a good position. Waiting for comment from the german legal team to proceed. FRANKO: Thanks @Fabian-Stephan Please keep us posted. In case this become an major critical item for our success in Germany we should be ready to raise this issue. Fabian-Stephan: **Update:** @vijesh-bhaktha @FRANKO @keely I ended with the DACH market compliance officer Claes Horsmann. He instructed me to approach the watsonx.ai security&privacy focal with the reuirements. --> Who is this person/team? @vijesh-bhaktha did you find any one responsible in the watsonx.ai team who can answer the questions? Finalized customer requirements: > 1. IBM must confirm it is taking over responsibility for all third party software integrated in our watsonx.ai software fulfilling the following requirements. Provide statements if and if yes, how we fulfil the following requirements 1.1 It MUST be ensured that all images used originate from trusted sources. The creator of each image MUST be clearly identifiable. 2.1 Sources MUST be selected on the basis of whether the creator of a given image regularly checks the included software for security problems, fixes and documents them, and provides corresponding guarantees to customers. 3.1 The utilised version of base images MUST NOT be deprecated. Unique version numbers MUST be provided. If an image with a newer version number is available, a patch and change management process MUST check whether and how it can be rolled out. > 2. Container Bill of Material 1.1 List for all Containers (especially the ones from third parties / containing third party software) their origin, provisioning path. 2.1 Additionally: A statement that our documentation for each container fulfils the following: 1.1 The sources of images that have been classified as trusted a adequately documented along with the corresponding reasons. 2.1 The process of how images or the software components contained in an image are obtained from trusted sources and eventually deployed to a productive environment are be adequately documented. 3.1 Images used have metadata that makes their function and history traceable. 4.1 Digital signatures secure each image against modification. > 3. Software Bill of Material for all software components (primarily third party) used in watsonx.ai The third might be a bit tricky to get if IBM at all commits to it. But customer success tries it best to serve the customer ;) Fabian-Stephan: @mehboob as security&privacy focal. Can you please provide statements for the requirements in the comment above: https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/data-watsonx/issues/282#issuecomment-105782953 keely: @mehboob Have you had a chance to look at this? mehboob: @Fabian-Stephan @keely (1) Unless there is a true business justification ($$$) that separate German account from the rest of software/cloud pak business, it is unlikely that IBM provide the assurances that you are asking for, outside existing standard terms. But please work with Offering Management. This is not a security delivery that I can help with. (2) Currently thre are no process/mechism for delivering a separate container bill of material. (3) You can make a request for an sbom of watsonx.ai (or any other software). Here is the url - https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/supply-chain-security/request-an-sbom keely: Thank you @mehboob for the information. I believe there is a true business justification since it could impact our major cases in Germany and EMEA within Federal, but I will let @Fabian-Stephan and @FRANKO provide a quantifiable potential impact. @vijesh-bhaktha Who in product management should Fabian reach out to? keely: Also @Fabian-Stephan , if you can get an Aha Idea opened for this (quickly), I can help get it prioritized within Product Scout, and ensure we escalate to our executives. @peter-bradford-ibm FYI Fabian-Stephan: Hey @keely , @mehboob, I am having a hard time believing there is not a single person in the watsonx.ai team beeing responsible for the software we deliver to the customer and having the authority to confirm basic third party software integration best practices like our supply chain team describe here: https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/supply-chain-security/getting-started - our "standards"; **--> so a confirmation from the watsonx.ai team that they adhere to these standards and with which specific measures the requirements are implemented - with focus on the ["BSI Grundschutz" requirements mentioned in my comment](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/data-watsonx/issues/282#issuecomment-105782953) - should not be impossible to get, shouldn't it?** **--> Who is responsible for the watsonx.ai software release and the security/safety of third party software integrations?** Fabian-Stephan: @keely : Idea submitted here: https://ibm-data-and-ai.ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-294 We really need to get hands on someone able to provide the information asked for. Please let me know the next steps you will take and whether you need support from the DACH market. DACH market executives (e.g. Hardy GrÃ¶ger, Andreas Walter are informed about this and will support if necessary. Fabian-Stephan: FYI: @mehboob , @keely: VP Public Sector DACH - Florian Breger - contributed the following: _"BSI Grundschutz: For German federal agencies, BSI Grundschutz is de facto mandatory due to administrative regulations and IT security laws. For critical infrastructure (KRITIS) companies and regulated industries (e.g., financial sector/BaFin), it serves as a key framework for meeting legal requirements. In many public tenders and security frameworks, BSI Grundschutz is considered best practiceâ€”**failure to comply may lead to missed market opportunities**"_ keely: @Fabian-Stephan - @vijesh-bhaktha is looking into this and has reached out to you. Please document the information in this issue once we have answers to each of the requests. vijesh-bhaktha: CISO team is working on creating a SBOM for BaFin // Update from Mehboob, has Fabian looped in an email thread. Title: We need details on upcoming supported GPUs

Title: Improve Llama 3.1 70B Response Time in On-Premises Environment (Case #TS017849880)
Comments: keely: @Gwangsu-Kim good that you have a support ticket open. Please provide any updates you receive here. Gwangsu-Kim: @keely we've got as following in support > First, let me explain the difference between on-prem and SaaS. > > In general, the performance difference between on-prem and SaaS watsonx.ai deployments can be attributed to the underlying infrastructure, resource constraints, and network latency. The on-prem cluster of watsonx.ai installed and run on the customer's own infrastructure. While this approach provides more control over the environment, data, and security, there are some potential performance bottlenecks such as: > > Hardware and Infrastructure: The performance of on-prem watsonx.ai is heavily dependent on the underlying hardware and infrastructure. If the customer's infrastructure is not optimized for AI workloads, it can lead to slower performance. > Resource Constraints: on-prem environments often have limited resources (e.g., CPU, memory, and storage) compared to cloud-based SaaS environments, which can result in slower processing times. > Network Latency: on-prem environments may experience higher network latency due to internal network infrastructure, firewalls, and security policies, which can slow down data transfer and processing. > > In a SaaS, watsonx.ai is hosted and managed by the provider in a cloud-based environment. This approach offers scalability, flexibility, and reduced maintenance efforts. > > Performance Advantages: Scalable Infrastructure: SaaS environments can scale up or down to meet changing workload demands, ensuring consistent performance. > Optimized Resources: Cloud providers typically offer optimized resources for AI workloads, resulting in faster processing times. > Low Latency: SaaS environments often have lower network latency due to optimized network infrastructure and proximity to the cloud provider's data centers. > > [REFERENCES] > [Why we built an AI supercomputer in the cloud](https://w3.ibm.com/%22https://research.ibm.com/blog/AI-supercomputer-Vela-GPU-cluster/%22) > > Second, the number of GPU you used for Llama 3.1 70B Instruct is 4GPU and this is not enough. It certainly works with 4GPU, but as describe in [this document](https://w3.ibm.com/%22https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/5.0.x?topic=install-foundation-models\\%22), 8GPU is required to make good performance. > > As you know, there are 3 options to install foundation models ([link](https://w3.ibm.com/%22https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/5.0.x?topic=setup-adding-foundation-models\\%22)). Which option did you select when installing? > > Install with default configuration > Shard the foundation models during installation > Install foundation models on preconfigured GPU partitions and despite selecting the installation option for sharding according to the guide, the speed remains slow and there is no difference compared to before. I informed the customer that when using llama 3.1 70b according to the official documentation, 8 A100 or H100 80GB GPUs on a single node are required. While they somewhat accept this, they still seem unsatisfied.

Title: WatsonX.ai Installation Blocked
Comments: keely: Support ticket has been opened. TEL is involved. Quantized models are an option where GPUs are insufficient. Dan is looking for guidance. Solution Engineers within Expert Labs may be able to help. @keely to get a name. dan-scheuch: Support ticket opened 10/18 but unable to resolve. Prompt tuning continues to fail. - Please advise on techniques for quantized model option The AWS nodes are p4d.24xlarge instance with 40GB each. They are the largest available aside from AWS commercial and special use applications. Special permission from AWS is required to deploy p4d24xlE which has 80 GB. **These are not yet available to our customers.** - Need a product-level workaround. Environment has 8 x 40 GB GPUs - Can we bridge multiple GPUs to achieve workable capacity? For some models, we document configuration and parameter adjustments to enable use on 40 GB environments. Can same be done for desired models: - google-flan-t5-xl - ibm-granite-13b-chat-v2 - ibm-granite-13b-instruct-v1 - meta-llama-llama-2-13b-chat - mpt-7b-instruct2 - mixtral-8x7b-instruct-v01-q Per IBM documentation https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/4.8.x?topic=setup-adding-foundation-models 1. If you want to use the flan-ul2-20b foundation model with L40S GPUs only: Run the following patch command to make adjustments to the model configuration that optimize the model for use with L40S GPUs `oc patch -n ${PROJECT_CPD_INST_OPERANDS} watsonxaiifm watsonxaiifm-cr \\ --type merge -p '{"spec": {\\ "google_flan_ul2": \\ { "cuda_visible_devices": "0,1", "deployment_framework": "hf_custom_tp" ,\\ "deployment_yaml_name": "flan-ul2-deployment.yaml.j2" ,\\ "dir_name": "models--google--flan-ul2" ,"dtype_str": "float16" ,\\ "force_apply": "false" ,"hf_modules_cache": "/tmp/huggingface/modules" ,\\ "max_batch_size": "128" ,"max_batch_weight": "34543200" ,\\ "max_concurrent_requests": "150" ,"max_new_tokens": "4096" ,\\ "max_sequence_length": "4096" ,"model_name": "google/flan-ul2" ,\\ "model_root_dir": "/watsonxaiifm-models" ,"num_gpus": "2" ,"num_shards": "2" ,\\ "pt2_compile": "false" ,"pvc_name": "google-flan-ul2-pvc-rev2" ,\\ "pvc_size": "85Gi" ,"svc_name": "flan-ul2" },\\ "google_flan_ul2_resources": \\ { "limits": {"cpu": "3" ,"ephemeral-storage": "1Gi", "memory": "128Gi", \\ "[nvidia.com/gpu](https://nvidia.com/gpu)": "2" }, \\ "requests": {"cpu": "2", "ephemeral-storage": "10Mi", "memory": "4Gi", \\ "[nvidia.com/gpu](https://nvidia.com/gpu)": "2" }}}}'` cir: Resources working issue. cir: 40 GB GPU? 8 to be mult-threaded Validate via Docs https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/w-and-w/2.0.x?topic=model-supported-hardware-architectures-performance-settings Supported hardware, model architectures, and performance settings Review the foundation model architectures, and performance-boosting settings and features available for deploying a custom foundation model with watsonx.ai. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/w-and-w/2.0.x?topic=model-creating-custom-hardware-specifications Creating custom hardware specifications Some foundation model types and hardware configurations might require a custom hardware specification. Learn about the requirements for creating a custom hardware specification. cir: Support ticket: TS017831040 Installed: google-flan-t5-xl ibm-granite-13b-chat-v2 ibm-granite-13b-instruct-v1 meta-llama-llama-2-13b-chat mpt-7b-instruct2 keely: Support closed the ticket due to inactivity and they are not interested in helping with a non-certified installation. Working with AWS. On site time gave a thumbs up that they got it working, but no details yet. @dan-scheuch to updated after a call with the team today. vijesh-bhaktha: Epic tracker for AWS AI Chips - https://bigblue.aha.io/features/WAI-850 keely: @cir will reach out to Jeffrey Frick. vijesh-bhaktha: Customer requirement: certification of watsonx.ai on-prem service on the Inferentia chips Objective: watsonx.ai to claim certification on both AWS AI Chips: Inferentia2 - high performance inference (learn more: [blog](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/aws-inferentia2-builds-on-aws-inferentia1-by-delivering-4x-higher-throughput-and-10x-lower-latency/)) Trainium2 - high performance training (learn more: [product page](https://aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/trainium/)) Note: Redhat Openshift AI stack has to support this hardware as well, which requires coordination between AWS and RH. This support claim will unblock customers seeking to install watsonx.ai as a managed software service on AWS because these chips are avaliable on EC2 and are highly abundant (supercluster) and competitively priced compared to other GPU's. June, 2024: partnership goal to announce IBM support of AWS Chips at the ReInvent conference (Dec. 2, 2024). Testing and certification have to be complete by September. Aug, 2024: Executive decision was made to defer wxai certification on AWS Chips until Q1, 2025. Instead, we will focus on offering granite on Bedrock in time for ReInvent. In the interim, we are attempting to test granite inference with newly developed AWS drivers for vLLM (OSAI) -- Research will conduct the test which should help clear the path for application testing in Q1. Investigation GIT Issue - https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm/issues/1866 keely: AWS provided an experimental AWS 80GB card, so closing this, but this could be an issue for other on-prem installs until we officially certify in 1Q25.

Title: Ensuring Optimal GPU Performance in Multi-Node and Single-Node Setups for Large Models: Infrastructure and Communication Considerations
Comments: keely: @Gwangsu-Kim Will you please open an Aha Idea for this? Gwangsu-Kim: @keely Oh, this isn't an idea, but rather a question. I was asking if it's possible to get an answer to something that isn't covered in the official documentation Gwangsu-Kim: @keely any updates on this? keely: @robert-stanich can you answer the question: Is there a way to guarantee performance at the software level, such as with CUDA, or at the watsonx platform level? Additionally, how can we effectively communicate this information to the customer? Gwangsu-Kim: and additionally, watsonx.ai currently supports only single-node GPUs. When can we expect support for multi-node GPUs? keely: @Gwangsu-Kim regarding multi-node GPU this is what Robert said: We already do. We initially ran the 405b like that. Itâ€™s too slow in SaaS right now to be practical but weâ€™re getting a network upgrade in a couple of weeks which will fix RDMAoE is the technology we're getting in IBM Cloud next week keely: Additional information @Gwangsu-Kim from Robert: To be absolutely correct it's ONE node of 8xH100-80GB for the fp8 and TWO nodes (multi-node) of 8xH100-80GB for the fp16. Can we guarantee (which is a word we are never supposed to use ever) performance in somebody else's environment we know nothing about? No. Gwangsu-Kim: @keely @robert-stanich However, the official guide recommends using a single node, and it seems that multi-node GPUs are not recognized during model onboarding. Is there a guide available for setting this up? keely: @Gwangsu-Kim Do you have an architectural example of what you are talking about? Is this about load balancing? Gwangsu-Kim: @keely sort of? but tactically I not talking about load balancing. GPU must be recognized when we onboard foundation models into watsonx.ai. currently official documents said only single node support this. so my question is how can we recognize GPUs in multi node when we trying to onboard big foundation models? To help with the understanding, if you refer to page 37 of the attached [seismic document](https://ibm.seismic.com/app?ContentId=2cf02bec-8fe6-49fb-be7f-c8051ab45117#/doccenter/861ea1fd-99e0-44d7-9135-85412e5c28d1/doc/%252Fdd3359e5f7-a856-a91b-7688-41024b2ac637%252FdfNTY4NmVhOWItY2RkNS04ZWY3LTZkNzItZTQwZjczMWUyMjk1%252CPT0%253D%252CRGF0YSBhbmQgQUk%253D%252FdfNDRmODBlMzMtY2ViMC0zMDI1LTVhNDEtNzg2OTg4MWVmZDBl%252COthers%252FdfOTRiYmU4NTQtNWY4NC03Y2QyLWZjYWUtOGIxYmFmZjkyZThk%252CPT0%253D%252CUHJpY2luZy9TaXppbmcvUGFydHMvQ2FsY3VsYXRvcg%253D%253D%252Flfd6410f57-471f-49cd-865a-c27c31848328/grid/), you'll see that, as shown in the left image, when using the llama-2-70b-chat model, GPUs on different worker nodes cannot be utilized. Instead, as shown in the right image, only the GPUs within a single worker node can be allocated and used. ![image](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/assets/348015/aa473c6d-985b-4115-aa29-047c3e334dd4) keely: @Mekki-MacAulay is looking for an email thread on this Mekki-MacAulay: I've looked through the documentation and discussion histories and @Gwangsu-Kim is correct that it currently says that multi-node GPUs are NOT supported. However, @robert-stanich's comment above seems to suggest that are or will be supported. @robert-stanich: What is the timeline for multi-node GPU official support, and, thereby, the update of the documentation with instructions on how to configure it? keely: @robert-stanich Please see question above. @vijesh-bhaktha will follow up. keely: @Gwangsu-Kim will you also please raise an Aha Idea? https://ideas.ibm.com Gwangsu-Kim: @keely I was just curious, but since this feature isn't working, should it be considered for improvement as an idea? keely: @Gwangsu-Kim Yes, please open an Idea for this. keely: @Gwangsu-Kim Please add a link to the Idea here in this issue,, and I will move this to Product Scout. Gwangsu-Kim: @keely https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-277 keely: Hi @Gwangsu-Kim , thank you! Will you please also add revenue or other impact information? That will make it much more likely to get prioritized. Meanwhile, I will move this to Product Scout. keely: @Gwangsu-Kim please see my comment above Gwangsu-Kim: @keely sorry for late reply. Iâ€™m not able to provide the related oppty or revenue details at this time. It was just a suggestion I wanted to share

Title: Frankfurt Datacenter multiple Problems serving LLMs
Comments: cir: These problems can stem from various factors. Here are some potential causes and ways to diagnose and address them: 1. Inconsistent results: - This is likely due to the temperature setting. Higher temperatures introduce more randomness, leading to varied outputs. - To diagnose: Try setting the temperature to 0 to get deterministic results. If the outputs are still inconsistent, there may be an issue with the model loading or context handling. 2. Varying response times: - This could be due to model loading/unloading, system resource constraints, or varying prompt lengths. - To diagnose: - Check if the first query after a period of inactivity is always slower (indicating model loading). - Monitor system resources (CPU, RAM, GPU if applicable) during inference. - Log the input token count for each query to see if longer inputs correlate with slower responses. 3. Timeouts: - These may occur due to resource constraints or issues with the inference setup. - To diagnose: - Check system logs for any error messages. - Monitor system resources to see if you're hitting memory or CPU limits. - Try increasing the timeout limit in your code or API calls. 4. Hallucinations: - This is an inherent challenge with large language models, but can be exacerbated by certain factors. - To diagnose: - Review your prompts to ensure they're clear and well-structured. - Try different sampling strategies (e.g., adjusting top_p, top_k values). - Consider using techniques like few-shot prompting or chain-of-thought to improve accuracy. General diagnostic steps: 1. Version check: Ensure you're using the latest versions of the models and any libraries or frameworks you're using to run them. 2. Model loading: Verify that the models are loading correctly. Look for any warning messages during initialization. 3. Context window: Make sure you're not exceeding the maximum context length for these models. 4. Resource monitoring: Use tools like `htop`, `nvidia-smi` (for GPU), or system monitoring scripts to track resource usage during inference. 5. Logging: Implement detailed logging in your application to track input lengths, processing times, and any errors or warnings. 6. Reproducibility: Try to create a minimal reproducible example that consistently shows the issues you're experiencing. 7. API vs. local inference: If you're using an API, try running the models locally (or vice versa) to isolate whether the issue is with your local setup or the API service. 8. Quantization: If you're using quantized versions of the models, try the full-precision versions to see if the issues persist. 9. Batch size: If applicable, experiment with different batch sizes to see if it affects performance and consistency. 10. Prompt engineering: Review and refine your prompts to see if certain phrasings or structures lead to more consistent results. ck-rao: per @wassif Muhammad , some customers are experiencing a shortage of GPUs. Track this using a support ticket and escalate there directly. Please don't use the GPU shortage word outside as it is very sensitive. We can use Capacity issues if needed in the context. @Mekki-MacAulay can help further as needed. keely: @daniel-lsainz will you please open a support ticket and put a link to it here. keely: @FRANKO is documenting forecasting needs for deploying cases for EMEA and will also add NA cir: @FRANKO Any progress on documenting needs? FRANKO: Yes @cir these are documented and tracked in the new Monday Dashboard - https://ibm.monday.com/boards/7940794631 Over New Year it have been relatively silent on any issues which is good sign of the focused work done by the SRE team. We will follow up on this as 2025 cases develop... keely: @daniel-lsainz what is the latest status on this? daniel-lsainz: This issue was raised by the end of last year. Not sure how much you know about it, but suffice to say we were having some serious performance issues, The performance (response times of LLMs) was really bad and we had several customers complaining about it. Our IBM bosses did an amazing work and in a few weeks they managed to add more GPU capacity to the German datacenter I was not aware this case was still active, lets close it FRANKO: Agree @daniel-lsainz we worked extensively with the SRE team etc. We are continuing to monitor but suggest this case is closed.

Title: IDEA - lightweight entry point to AI Governance not called Governance
Labels: EMEA, watsonx.gov, Product: Compatiblity, watsonx products
Comments: keely: @keely will review keely: @FRANKO Let's discuss this idea. What specific features and functionalities would this lightweight offering include? Would this need to be a separate offering, or could it be some light weight governance features added to watsonx.ai? FRANKO: Hi @keely, the idea is loose and based on some discussions with EMEA team and reflection from customers. I would suggest an ideation workshop to form this idea. I would exclude GRC elements and focus on customer initial sage and trusted work with ai models and the extending the governance. The trick is to avoid the governance topic as customer is still not ready to jump on this and see it much later as they experiment with Gen AI etc. keely: We need a brainstorming session. @vijesh-bhaktha will connect @FRANKO with a new wx.ai PM focused on evaluations. Once we have a clearer vision we will open an AHA Idea. Nikhita-Bagga:  @keely @FRANKO Could the 'Analyze' section that was just added to watsonx assistant (in screenshot - added in 22/11/24 release) be a good place to include some 'lite' governance? - perhaps just with HAP/PII/ROUGE metrics for conversational search alongside the existing average conversational search scores for citations, response length, confidence etc? Wondering if this could be a simple way to provide a taster into governance monitoring but branded under 'analytics' Nikhita-Bagga: @simon-kronfeld cir: January 7th call to discuss keely: ## Meeting Jan 7, 2025 Attendees: Frank, Simon, Nikhita, Vindyha, Evan Rivera, Keely The CSMs team expressed the need for a more accessible and affordable governance solution, either as a separate product or (better yet) by integrating governance capabilities into existing products like watsonx.ai, watsonx Assistant, and watsonx Orchestrate. Evan, the Watsonx.ai Product Manager, shared his initial proposal to bring some governance capabilities into the watsonx.ai platform which he will be reviewing with the watsonx.governance team today. Evan will reach out to us soon to let us know the outcome. FRANKO: Thanks @keely, let me add that we look an offering that allow .ai, .assistants and agent customer to have a natural path to evolve into the governance. Entry need to be much more simple vs todays significant complex implementation and cost to start this journey, plus increase complexity of lining up sponsors for our solution vs competition. This push away customers to competition like MS and Google who have a highly consumable offering and smooth path. Three key factors must be addressed: - **Better Consumability** - **Simplicity vs complexity** - **Lower entry cost**, that give a more smooth path into the governance value prop (even when mindset is still not ready for governance as customers experiment) As @simon-kronfeld mentioned we need to win the minds of the stakeholders and grow from this. FRANKO: Btw, did you listen to Arvin's CEO Office Hours yesterday. Above is fully aligned with his POV of we doing a poor job of making our AI Models/Wx ACCESSIBLE and EASY to use hence creating the excitement on our platform. Watch section on Challenges for 2025 (10th minute and forward) keely: Yes, I saw it, and I thought of this conversation too. :) keely: @keely Follow up with Evan Rivera keely: @vijesh-bhaktha said work is progressing on this, i.e. tracing. keely: @FRANKO will open an Aha Idea to get this tracked officially FRANKO: Idea is now submitted in IBM Ideas - https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WGOV-I-122 @keely @vijesh-bhaktha - Product Scout is in doubt how to bring this forward, as this is generic market input. So, need your guidance on how we can make sure this get the proper attention as idea is already forming within PM team. As said our suggestion is still a workshop to form the idea further. @martin-keller keely: There is nothing in the roadmap at this time.

Title: AI factsheet monitoring capability, for 3rd party vendors
Comments: keely: @ocardenas Let me look into this and get back to you. keely: Update provided by Paul Hake in Slack: Q1) client appears to have requirement for run time metrics with genAI for external models - this will be available in the Dec release Q2) model changes could be captured if driven by code, ie developer updating notebook, we could capture those metadata changes today. If they are full CI/CD pipelines I don't think we can grab that with Factsheets but lets also clarify with @Siddhi-Gowaikar - it really depends on the specific architecture and model ops processes they have. @ocardenas will be meeting with the customer soon to provide this information, and gather more specific information about their requirements. Vindhya-K: Olga (CSM) said she will do an objection handling session with the customer soon, and she'll highlight that it is not necessary to update the details of the prompt template asset, because the OpenScale Factsheet automatically captures those metrics after the detached integration is done. ocardenas: I had the meeting with the customer on November 13th, and the customer asked me if I know the date, when the run time metrics with genAI for external models will be ready, within this Q4. Vindhya-K: Reached out to Siddhi about this ask - will update here when I get a response. Siddhi-Gowaikar: > Q2) model changes could be captured if driven by code, ie developer updating notebook, we could capture those metadata changes today. If they are full CI/CD pipelines I don't think we can grab that with Factsheets but lets also clarify with @Siddhi-Gowaikar - it really depends on the specific architecture and model ops processes they have. For Factsheets, please check with @Snehal-Gawas . cir: @Vindhya-K to follow up with Snehal keely: @ajay will follow up Snehal-Gawas: > > Q2) model changes could be captured if driven by code, ie developer updating notebook, we could capture those metadata changes today. If they are full CI/CD pipelines I don't think we can grab that with Factsheets but let's also clarify with > > @Siddhi-Gowaikar - it really depends on the specific architecture and model ops processes they have. > > For Factsheets, please check with @Snehal-Gawas . AI Factsheet feature is focused on capturing AI assets (like ML model and Prompt Templates) related metadata and evaluation metrics. Here are the details - https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/xgov-factsheet-viewing.html?context=wx&audience=wdp. Users can also add custom facts as per their use case. In addition to this with the help of AI use Case users can track AI assets moving through differnt phases of lifecycle - https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/xgov-tracking-overview.html?context=wx&audience=wdp keely: Olga working with customer to implement. The desired feature is possible. Currently the customer does not have CI/CD pipelines.

Planning is still WIP. jbtang: @vijesh-bhaktha @keely @cir @srerngler https://techcrunch.com/2024/11/12/red-hat-acquires-ai-optimization-startup-neural-magic/ "Red Hat, the IBM-owned open source software firm, is [acquiring](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20241112030832/en/Red-Hat-Announces-Definitive-Agreement-to-Acquire-Neural-Magic) [Neural Magic](https://techcrunch.com/2019/11/06/neural-magic-gets-15m-seed-to-run-machine-learning-models-on-commodity-cpus/), a startup that optimizes AI models to run faster on commodity processors and GPUs." Enabling SLM on CPU is so obviously doable, I am certain not only RH, but also other companies are looking at that. I hope IBM can do faster to be a leader but not a follower.... SInce IBM is only hybrid cloud/on-prem vendor among hyperscalers and lots of on-prem cluster doesn't have GPU, so it can be our unique differentiator to win. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Any status change on these items? jbtang: Where is IBM's differeniator? This could be one... Where we're? I raised this back in Sep last year... Hope we are not too late since SLM is such a trend.

Title: Watsonx.AI RAG complete offering
Comments: keely: wx.ai and wx.data are integrated as of end of Sep. There are no plans to merge the offerings. daniel-lsainz: Hi Keely , just to clarify, Im requesting to get the VectorDB component out of Data so customers interested in RAG dont need to get watsonx.data when they only need the DB keely: @daniel-lsainz Thank you for the clarification. Will you please open an Idea in the Ideas portal for this and include a link to it here? daniel-lsainz: Hi Keely, this is the idea link: https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-190 vijesh-bhaktha: Comment from Anthony Casaletto -> Currently we use ChromaDB as the out of the box Vector DB for development in watsox.ai - with the ability for the user to connect to watsonx.data for Milvus (or Milvus and Elastic Search that users already have access to) for production use. Typically in a production use there is a lifecycle around the database which is supported through watsonx.data. daniel-lsainz: HI tony thanks for the feedback, my proposal is to offer some vector database , anyone. The client will be free from using our offer or using the one of their choice. Watsonx Data is not related to my suggestion, but given that we already have experience serving it I suppose it would be easier to offer a package with it. The idea is to offer a complete suite of tools to perform the development and deployment of a. complete AI solution, that includes the database and the Application Servers that can be deployed on containers, etc (that would be the subject of another IDEA) . cir: Marked as candidate @martin-keller FYI cir: @daniel-lsainz We need revenue impact. Number of clients and rev per client for this to be a blocker to deploy or sell?

"Policies":{"Quota":{"CPU":{"Maximum":1, "Warning":1, "Unit":"m" }, "Memory":{"Maximum":2, "Warning":2, "Unit":"Gi" }, "PolicyType":"request" } }, "workloadID":"d0881735-a44c-4833-a445-5bfe0a09a47e", "workloadType":"projects" } test = requests.post(url_cpd + '/zen-watchdog/v3/resources/workloads/policies/projects/', auth=BearerAuth(access_token), json=json_test, verify=False) print (test.status_code) #3) Then we have, events = requests.get(url_cpd + '/zen-watchdog/v1/monitoring/events', auth=BearerAuth(access_token), headers=headers, verify=False) events_alerted = undocumented APIs above and let us know if they can be formally documented and supported? Malcolm-Singh: Is there an associated RFE (AHA Idea?) Let's review the use case before identifying the undocumented APIs. Hasan-Oezdemir: @Malcolm-Singh Sure. What information can we provide to you? The customer is very engaged with CP4D, trying to have a detailed resource management overview for IT Operations using APIs, by using CP4D's out-of-the-box possibilities. keely: @Malcolm-Singh Please open an Idea from the portal [here](https://ideas.ibm.com/) with details of the request, and then add a link to it in this issue. elke-kunde: Customer specified request and use case for immediate needs/phase 1: Client wants to limit resources (CPU, RAM) for projects and deployment spaces and differentiate user groups. According to the doc, this is only possible via UI: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/5.0.x?topic=2-monitoring-platform#platform_management__title__8 This is not feasible for the number of projects the client has, so they want to automate this limitations. They found and basically tested an undocumented API endpoint /zen-watchdog/v3/ressources which was quite successful. So their ask is to put this endpoint into the list of available APIs to secure the efforts of automation: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/5.1.x?topic=tutorials-available-apis and document the same way available APIs are handled like e.g.: https://cloud.ibm.com/apidocs/data-ai-common-core-cpd/data-ai-common-core-cpd-5.1.0 Hope this helps. cir: @Malcolm-Singh Can you review this please elke-kunde: any updates here or steps to proceed? Title: Support for IBM Storage Scale CES S3 for CP4D - for data lake tables in Db2 DWH in CP4D
Comments: elke-kunde: We raised a Deal Support request for BaFin's Q4 storage extension to get Client Engineering Storage support with testing onsite CES S3 with CP4D/wx - will update once we get feedback. elke-kunde: Client Engineering Storage EMA is involved now with testing CP4D Db2 DWH and Storage Scale CES S3. We need customer success criterias for the test (Webex next Tuesday) and success criteria from CP4D product management for the support statement (open). BaFin needs to order in November, so we need speed here.... elke-kunde: We need details for the matrix Db2 DWH in CP4D and containerized standalone with data lake features (platform PPC, x86, versions of CP4D/Db2 and data lake support) - with licensing parts required for an evaluation if it is not CP4D or Db2 Modernization package. cir: @cir to co-ordinate PMs on CP4D and Db2. @Malcolm-Singh keely: @cir any updates? elke-kunde: While the licensing part is still unclear to me, the technical part made progress: Harald Seipp CE Storage was able with support from Olivier Bernin to install a Db2 DWH standalone containerized in IBM test lab and conduct some basic successful tests. From his documentation : Db2 Data Warehouse Data Lake Tables https://github.ibm.com/SEIPP/scale-ces-s3/blob/main/db2wh-dlt.md elke-kunde: For Db2 DWH as standalone containerized offering there is a support statement with version 12.1 in the docs: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/db2/12.1?topic=storage-remote-requirements Supported remote storage providers The following remote storage providers are supported: - The IBM CloudÂ® Object Storage and Amazon S3 providers are supported for all commands that are enabled for remote storage. - **Other object storage providers that can be access using the S3 protocol are supported for all commands that are enabled for remote storage.** - The Microsoft Azure object storage provider is only supported for the CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command, including the ability to query the data. elke-kunde: next step: checking if this would also apply to CP4D Db2 DWH with version 5.1.1 which would incorporate version 12.1 for Db2 according to roadmap: https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCMhTfCWRbQHqGWXPMJ3ggBq93pB ![image](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/assets/20248/d66b79b9-c01a-48fc-845a-fd01ee5f623b) ck-rao: Nikolas Neubacher and @Hasan-Oezdemir will help on this one. elke-kunde: reached out to PM Shripad Sonavnay on Dec 3rd to clarify 2 alternatives from a licensing point of view: 1) CP4D Enterprise Edition entitlements - prereq: CP4D 5.1.1 will have Db2 V12.1 data lake table support as planned in the roadmap 2) Db2 Advanced Edition Modernization as from 12.1 on the bundled programs contain Db2 Advanced Edition via the Db2 AE cartridge for CP4D 12.1 as I read the license information. As this was not the case with 11.5 we need confirmation. cir: @elke-kunde Can this be closed or moved out? elke-kunde: got an update from product management today: - CP4D Enterprise 5.1.1 will not contain Db2 datalake tables, slipped to 5.2 (hopefully) - IBM Db2 Advanced Edition Modernization 12.1. works https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/?id=L-KDMK-6M25SM&lc=en Bundled Programs: IBM Cloud Pak for Data Enterprise Edition IBM Db2 Advanced Edition Cartridge for IBM Cloud Pak for Data 12.1 IBM Db2 Advanced Edition Cartridge for IBM Cloud Pak for Data 11.5 where IBM Db2 Advanced Edition Cartridge for IBM Cloud Pak for Data 12.1 https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/?id=L-UQHK-LU9JFT&lc=en Has Bundled Programs: IBM Db2 Advanced Edition IBM Db2 Advanced Enterprise Server Edition IBM Db2 Enterprise Server Edition Which contain Db2 DWH with data lake feature And OCP according to the LI: 3. Red Hat Product Detail: â€¦â€¦. If Licensee's Program entitlement is designated "Reserved", the below entitlements to the Red Hat Products are not included and do not apply. Red Hat Product: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Additional Entitlement Ratio: - 1 VPC/ 1 VPC Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform Additional Entitlement Ratio: - 3 VPC/ 1 VPC informed customer and closing issue elke-kunde: please close issue, thanks

Title: Support for IBM Storage Scale CES S3 for CP4D and watsonx.ai - as â€œgeneric S3 data connectionâ€
Comments: cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Can you review please elke-kunde: We raised a Deal Support request for BaFin's Q4 storage extension to get Client Engineering Storage support with testing onsite CES S3 with CP4D/wx - will update once we get feedback. elke-kunde: Client Engineering Storage EMA is involved now with testing CP4D and Storage Scale CES S3. We need customer success criterias for the test (Webex next Tuesday) and success criteria from CP4D product management for the support statement (open). BaFin needs to order in November, so we need speed here.... keely: The protocol is not tested. @Sachin-Prasad1 @Malcolm-Singh Please look into this. elke-kunde: We are about to set up a test at IBM test lab CE Storage EMEA with CP4D V5.0.2 and CES S3 for generic S3 data connection and in BaFin on prem air gapped environment during November. Malcolm-Singh: This has been discussed with the BaFin team. Generic S3 is an open framework, which is supported in Common Connectivity. The testing was performed using the standard framework for generic S3, however, the testing can not contain all storages that support generic S3 for certification. The assumption is that the storage vendor uses the standard that offers S3, so any deviations would need to be addressed separately. We'll work on making this clear in the documentation. The good news is that Harald has ran tests without any issue. keely: @Hasan-Oezdemir this one seems to be resolved, can we close this issue? elke-kunde: @keely while we made progress on the technical side and had successful tests, the client asked for a support statement from IBM stating that IBM Support will accept support tickets asking for investigation of problems in context CP4D/wx with IBM Storage Scale CES S3 as they plan to make a massive storage HW investment. Haralds test results are here: https://github.ibm.com/SEIPP/scale-ces-s3/blob/main/cp4dintegration.md https://github.ibm.com/SEIPP/scale-ces-s3/blob/main/Connection-Test.ipynb We are preparing a communication to product management asking for a client-specific or generic support statement with all test results being provided for review. elke-kunde: Support statement (IBM Support will accept and handle problem tickets) has been requested (Scott Brocaw, Sachin Prasad, Malcolm Singh) with providing positive test results elke-kunde: We received a support statement for BaFin from Sachin and team and sent it to the client. elke-kunde: Client is happy with support statement and ordered additional storage for Scale S3. You can close the issue - thanks for your support!

Title: Questions on gpu requirements and llm pod capacity for concurrent users
Comments: cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Can you review. @TALS FYI TALS: I refer you to AI Infrastructure/GPUaaS - https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCqJfVRq8VcCTGhQg6C2FQccTGqB Gwangsu-Kim: @TALS Thank you for sharing. Even after reviewing the provided materials, I still don't understand why llama 3.1 70B requires 8 GPUs. Is this simply how the offering is structured for enterprise customers? TALS: @robert-stanich ? keely: @Mekki-MacAulay will comment Mekki-MacAulay: I've spoken with watsonx.ai PM and they've confirmed that the "8 GPUs" requirement listed in the documentation was an overly-cautious higher-than-necessary system requirement that was put in place to ensure that version CP4D watsonx.ai 5.0.3 with Llama 3.1 70b was able to handle the load so that it could be released before full testing was completed (as the team did not get access to Llama 3.1 ahead of time to test). Now that the testing is completed, they're updating the requirement to say "4 GPUs," just like Llama 3.0 70b. Worth noting also that the number of GPUs is actually arbitrary and the watsonx.ai team is using "8 GPUs" and "4 GPUs" as shorthand for the total GBs of memory collectively amongst the GPUs. You're absolutely correct that 2-4 GPUs with higher memory would be just fine. It appears they're just nervous about putting hardware requirements too low "just in case" and therefore over-specifying; they're also nervous about "officially supporting" any configuration they haven't explicitly tested, even if theoretically it makes no difference, hence the GPU count specification.

Title: Customer facing material for CSM (and others) that can prepare customers on IBMs FM deprercations
Comments: cir: @FRANKO Who has the pen on this? FRANKO: @cir as I understand @robert-stanich will make a first draft robert-stanich: It's in the docs Foundation model lifecycle - Docs | IBM watsonx Best, Rob Stanich (917) 226-1772 From: Frank ?stergaard ***@***.***> Sent: Tuesday, October 8, 2024 5:27 AM To: noreply ***@***.***> Cc: Robert Stanich ***@***.***>; mention ***@***.***> Subject: Re: [customer-success-management/watsonx] Customer facing material for CSM (and others) that can prepare customers on IBMs FM deepercations (Issue #235) @cir as I understand @robert-stanich will make a first draft - Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub Enterprise, or unsubscribe. You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID: ***@***.******@***.***>> FRANKO: Hi @robert-stanich and @cir as I said in our Office Hours call. I'm not asking for the base information but a customer facing material (ppt) that share our deprecation policies, how customer should plan for model deprecation and implement new version of models. We need to enable the CSMs to have this conversation with customers. In my book this should be covered in an enablement session and with material (I envision ppt) CSMs can then use to have this preparation conversation with the customers. This way we proactively prepare customers for the lifecycles of models. cir: @FRANKO Adhoc is the current approach, Mekki looking into a formal process. Current policy is 90 days for IBM models and 30 days for external models. dmulley: @robert-stanich we discussed the need to "educate" our customers and CSMs on the best practices here. We used the example of how everyone now knows how to manage their Windows upgrades, but it took them many years to learn whether they needed to take every version and recompile their applications or whether they could stay put for 1, 2, 3 years. Our customers don't know whether to upgrade whenever a new model is released. Our CSMs and TEL consultants don't know what to tell them. We are looking for guidance and best practices - in an internal format - that we can use to build this experience to be able to correctly guide the clients. cir: @robert-stanich What is the plan to address external comms for model deprecation? robert-stanich: They get announced here: IBM Cloud Status | Announcements and appear in a cloud user's notifications (click bell icon). They also appear in the what's new? Of the documentation: What's new - IBM Documentation The entire FM lifecycle policy including deprecation is outlined here in the docs: https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/fm-model-lifecycle.html?context=wx&audience=wdp&trk=public_post_comment-text And it's also described in the Service Description (terms): IBM Terms I've also asked for deprecations to be added to the model roadmap in Seismic: https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCVfj4mQD7jGT8qTC7gW3qJHWmHP So I'm questioning what the gap here is at this point! Best, Rob Stanich (917) 226-1772 cir: Single source of information. consolidate into external comm - Mekki to work on draft and collab with Frank keely: In progress, @Mekki-MacAulay will post an update when he has more. FRANKO: Hi @Mekki-MacAulay any progress with this material ? Mekki-MacAulay: Work in progress. keely: @Mekki-MacAulay hopes to move forward on this next week Mekki-MacAulay: @Vindhya-K & Ajay have graciously offered to help chip away at this. cir: @Mekki-MacAulay in progress. Mekki-MacAulay: Update: I have compiled the necessary information as well as cross-links to the various sources of documentation in Seismic and our help files and met with the Principal of Learning Content Development for AI and Data whose team built all of the current watsonx.ai L1-L4 client and seller enablement, Felix Lee. He confirmed that model deprecation best practices were a known gap and he has reviewed the compiled content I provided for inclusion in the next release of the documentation. His team will turn it into powerpoint presentations in the same format as the existing documentation, such as: - https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCpTpGjh6phJ9GqTMVC8M6fVBPjG - https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCj3GgV2p3864GhHcQfHgDCGMpJ3 - https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCGgjgfQ64b8C8mQCFj7P2GJ2VgV so that there is consistency in formatting and it is automatically included in the training for all Data & AI practitioners, including CSMs, CE, TEL, and sellers, and, more importantly, is kept up to date as things shift in this turbulent market! I will work with Felix's team to get the content into the final format, but the work from our end is pretty much done now, so this can be moved to watching or waiting for release or whatever is best fit and I'll post an update as soon as the next release comes out with the content. FRANKO: @Mekki-MacAulay please give a green flag when all is ready and some pointers so we can get this communicated to all. Enjoy the weekend and a big thank you! keely: @Mekki-MacAulay Please let us know ETA, we are excited to get this! Mekki-MacAulay: ETA is next release cycle of our enablement material by Felix Lee's team (not taggable). I've pinged him to ask when he expects the next version will be out. FRANKO: Hi @Mekki-MacAulay any news on ETA? Mekki-MacAulay: I spoke with Felix Lee and he told me a full overhaul is in the planning stages with a target of early-mid Q2 including this new section. FRANKO: Thanks @Mekki-MacAulay, naturally eager to get this out asap but understand and appreciate the solid work on this important topic. Thanks keely: @keely to reach out to Felix Lee to get a target date. FRANKO: @thanks @keely - please note this topic is so important that we should also run enablement of the team keely: Update from Felix Lee: We are now working on a refresh of the L2 material. I have had a recent discussion with PM (like a week ago) - and the problem is that the answer from them is pretty much â€œit happens when it happensâ€ :disappointed:. I will try to get them to suggest the best course of action for clients. They are ooo this week but I should get some answer next week. So I still hope to get something into our material and itâ€™s target to be released **mid May**. PM input is vital - I mean I can suggest what â€œIâ€ would do - but we have to line up with what IBM is saying client should do. FRANKO: Any news and timeline? keely: @keely Ask Felix for an update. keely: Update from Felix on May 12: Yeah - I added a single slide on the seller deck for model L2 refresh. This should be coming out in another week. Essentially: if you deploy on-premises, you can keep using it. For SaaS - deprecated just means it is no longer part of the build IBM recommends a replacement whenever there is a deprecation so clients can switch to that. For SaaS, if clients wish to continue to use a deprecated model, they can deploy it on demand or bring it in as a Custom Foundation model. FRANKO: Hi @keely, can we ask Felix to share links or slides that CSMs and others can use in conversations with customers on how to prepare for FM model lifecycles. The key ask is to upfront brief customer on the lifecycles and point to considerations for best practice for model lifecycle management. Hence avoid escalations and last minute issues with customer having this in Prod. keely: @vijesh-bhaktha will add links vijesh-bhaktha: Foundation Model Lifecycle on SaaS : https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/fm-model-lifecycle.html?context=wx&audience=wdp Notes for SaaS: Announcement channels - Its done today via Cloud announcements/in documentation (mentioned above) Frequency of Deprecation - Most of the times a model is hosted for minimum of 6 months. Though we have not got approval from execs to make this a commitment. Removal after announcement - Models are removed only after 3-4 months after deprecation announcement - giving enough room to test and adopt a new version of the model that is made live. Foundation Model Lifecycle on Software: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/w-and-w/2.2.0?topic=model-foundation-lifecycle FRANKO: @vijesh-bhaktha @robert-stanich - Now we seems to have a new situation with Italian customer .  So wonder if we still have some gaps @keely @TALS

Title: VPC to OCP ratio using watsonx.ai on hyperscalers
Comments: kshabalin: Hi, questions about insufficiency of 1 VPC / 1 VPC entitlement of OCP that comes with wx.ai has come up a few times now. Here is info from Andrew Buckler (Program Director, Data Fabric Pricing & Packaging) on this topic: "As part of integrating unrestricted OCP and OSAI into watsonx.ai, we have an "audit alignment" agreement with RH if the only consumer is IBM software. If you're in compliance for watsonx.ai, then RH is in compliance by definition. If they want to install 3rd party components or extend with additional RH software, then they'd need enough OCP to cover BAU licensing." dilang: @Mekki-MacAulay is collecting more information. Mekki-MacAulay: This is the updated licensing information: https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/details/getLicenseDocumentPDF/?path=L-DPUF-VEJ44W/Softcopy/LI_en&docid=dd6f1282b2607b4bee17db5190d51863 My read is that the equivalencies are still the same as before: 1 vCPU or vGPU = 1 VPC. The OpenShift is included. I think the confusion might be the minimum node sizes that Azure offers. We might not be able to create a Sales Configurator "small" size watsonx.ai setup on Azure if they have min vCPUs for their GPU nodes. It's not that licensing fails; it's that the licensing has to be adjusted to Azure's offerings. So in the above example, instead of starting with the "Small" sizing, you treat it as "custom" and just pick the Azure vCPU and vGPU node sizes you want, and then infer watsonx.ai VPCs accordingly. Does that make sense? I can escalate to the licensing team if needed? cir: @Claus-Ramstedt-Petersen Does this provide a response that is acceptable? Claus-Ramstedt-Petersen: Thank you @Mekki-MacAulay @kshabalin and @cir This is as good as it gets for now. And as I understand: if customer do not install third party applications there will not be an extra openshift license "fine" for using GPU. I had a talk with the local RedHat people and they where not clear about the new rules. Only information I have for now is that it has to do with licensing when sharing a gpu. Thank you everyone for your support FRANKO: @cir and @Mekki-MacAulay, I think we should share these findings wider so there is clarity on similar cases. Maybe in the CSM Playbook. But also important RH teams get clarity. Claus-Ramstedt-Petersen: Agree @Frank ***@***.***>. A share will at least help reduce the number of requests in this regard. https://www.redhat.com/en/resources/self-managed-openshift-subscription-guide x86 core or artificial intelligence (AI) accelerator card-based, 2 cores or 4 virtual central processing units (vCPUs), or 2 physical AI accelerators. * When entitling CPU cores, this is based on the aggregate number of physical cores or vCPUs across all OpenShift compute nodes running across all OpenShift clusters. * When entitling accelerators, this is based on any accelerator devices installed on OpenShift compute nodes that are being used by workloads launched from OpenShift. Each subscription covers 2 physical AI accelerator devices, regardless of the number of cores on the cards or whether virtual graphics processing units (GPUs) have been created. * Available with Standard 8x5 or Premium 24x7 support SLA. Claus Ramstedt Petersen Customer Success Manager IBM - Cloud and Data Platforms Mobile: +45 2880 3714 Mobile Email: ***@***.******@***.***> From: Frank ?stergaard ***@***.***> Date: Tuesday, 8 October 2024 at 11.23 To: noreply ***@***.***> Cc: Claus Ramstedt Petersen ***@***.***>, mention ***@***.***> Subject: Re: [customer-success-management/watsonx] VPC to OCP ratio using watsonx.ai on hyperscalers (Issue #234) @cir and @Mekki-MacAulay, I think we should share these findings wider so there is clarity on similar cases. Title: GPU SaaS & IBM TSFM
Comments: FRANKO: Note customer under EU regulation can not use Dallas and London dilang: @Mekki-MacAulay will review offline. thanks! cir: @vijesh-bhaktha to review timeline vijesh-bhaktha: @cir @Flavio-Aicardi - Latest on this - We are targeting to have granite-timeseries-ttm-v1 on SaaS. Timeline -> December 9 SaaS Tech Preview, GA Date TBD Flavio-Aicardi: Hi, @FRANKO it looks that, even if this ticket has been closed, no GPU are available on watson studio notebooks for training models. When we started discussing this ticket, some GPU could be requested as an exception for some clients. Can you provide me some clarification about? FRANKO: Hi @Flavio-Aicardi, the Cloud SRE team is working on GPU setup to improve performance. What is your exact request here ref GPU and which model will be used. Have you provided GPU need via the GPU Board? Please connect with Aldo to submit specific needs. Flavio-Aicardi: @FRANKO I worked together with Aldo and, if I remember correctly, that task was related to the **inference task** (for example, ask an LLM for tokens). Here the task is different: it is **training / tuning** the model (i.e. update model weights). Obviously, in this case, ENEL is not going to use the AI to work with some LLM, but it is going to work with quantitative model for prediction and forecast tasks. To be very clear: no LLMs here. That is why we need GPUs in our training environment Watson Studio also in EU (Frankfurt) and not only in US (dallas). Please see [here](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/notebook-environments.html?context=cpdaas&audience=wdp#default-gpu): "_GPU environments for notebooks are available only in the Dallas IBM Cloud service region_". How to have GPUs as initially prospected? I had been told that GPUs could be provided to specific client, upon request. FRANKO: Hi @Flavio-Aicardi , I recommend we raise a formal ticket for this and maybe also a new fresh Git in this Issue Tracker. When You have submitted ticket can you send me the case and I will raise with Support/SRE team and PM.

Title: General: process for IBMers: to the documentation teams
Comments: paulraffo: on further self investigation - there is a alternative site for the public facing docs here is what I found. when on the public facing docs clicking on the "open doc issue" button at the foot of the page is a github link taking you to public github site; so if you "inject the prefix" **test.** to the URL of the doc you hit an alternative that might have updates already - working assumption is this is pre-published stated internally but not received confirmation. for example say the public doc is at --> `https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/speech-to-text?topic=speech-to-text-gettingStarted` - then updating with the inject mentioned above we go --> `https://test.cloud.ibm.com/docs/speech-to-text?topic=speech-to-text-gettingStarted` now the "open doc issue" button on that bottom of that page takes you to the internal IBM github site if this is the agreed process then this is the process - any other alternative insight or is this method above not the correct way? (have not tested on all public documents so I dont know how robust it is on knowledge centres and all product guides) paulraffo: also found an alternative - so question still stands what is the unified process for IBMers this alternative to one mentioned above (there could be more ! :-) ) go to `https://github.ibm.com/dap/dsx-documentation-source/issues/new/choose` and click get started next to "Customer Feedback" paulraffo: closing, due to documentation process, and the IBMer process published on #cs-at-ibm which is also noted in [#issuecomment-92946093](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/issues/232#issuecomment-92946093) above

There haven't been any updates in the GH issue https://github.ibm.com/NGP-TWC/ml-planning/issues/41914 for a while. Flavio-Aicardi: Hi @keely, as I have read on thread you mentioned and based on tests I performed this week, nothing has changed. From the opportunity side, ENEL still has not made any decision to deploy any component of the watsonx that has in the ELA: this issue can only partially explain it. In the meantime, I am showcasing the wx.gov to other clients with high skills in data science: to overcome this issue, I make up a notebook on another use case, that publish the metrics on AI Factsheet without using AutoAI. With this arrangement, everything works fine. For this reason, it looks surprising to me that the issue might reside in the UI (as reported in your thread). However, it's very hard to convince clients to deploy/buy without demo and products that work properly. :( syellare: Hi @keely Sorry for delay, as we have priority line items we couldn't get time to work on this issue. Will work with [ayohannan@in.ibm.com](mailto:ayohannan@in.ibm.com) to prioritise this work. ayohannan: @snimgaonkar Could you please address this? keely: @syellare Any update? syellare: @snimgaonkar Did you get a chance to look into this issue? snimgaonkar: @syellare @keely I am looking into this. snimgaonkar: The `training data` column on factsheet screen also has some negative values. Should that be also displayed absolute? @keely @Flavio-Aicardi Flavio-Aicardi: Dear @snimgaonkar , those values should be positive too. The reason is the formula behind those values (for example see [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mean_squared_error)). keely: Issue is still open, lower priority keely: @keely to ask Flavio if this has been resolved. Flavio-Aicardi: Hi @keely, since last Thursday I was [facing issues on TZ](https://ibmitaly.slack.com/archives/C03A6R7P3JL/p1757001551369649) and now I have completed the run on an another TZ image (watsonx.ai/.governance w/StudentID, Dallas). Currently, I have to say that it is hard to establish if the issue has been resolved. In fact, as you can see below, AI Factsheet now looks to not show results for the scored model: in fact, the training evalutation section does not show results on the training dataset as in the past... but the link to the training dataset. This does not make sense for me, especially in terms of governance process: the watsonx AI Governance/AI Use Case view should allow other stakeholders to have an official report of the training process, as it was in the past. In other terms, where should a AI Use Case stakeholder see results to approve them? PS.: Of course, model was trained with AutoAI.  keely: Hi @Flavio-Aicardi , that seems very odd. I just ran an eval using an AutoAI model last week and it shows the results (however, it's not showing the actual CSV file used, which is odd. See screenshot below. I'm guessing the issue has not been fixed since there is no update to the product ticket: https://github.ibm.com/NGP-TWC/ml-planning/issues/41914

Title: Need documentation showing the superiority of watsonx.ai when compared to Open AI (especially in code generation) - BRIDGESTONE CORPORATION
Comments: Yuta-Nonaka: [Desired delivery date] September 20th I have received a request from the account team to present it when we call on September 24th, so I would appreciate it if someone could share it with us by September 20th. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Do we have any competitive positioning? @Yuta-Nonaka Here is public information I was able to find: ## Cost-Effectiveness IBM watsonx.ai offers more cost-effective solutions, especially for specific tasks: - It uses smaller, fit-for-purpose models tailored for specific tasks, which can be significantly cheaper to run than large general-purpose models[3]. - For example, summarizing a 30-minute call could be up to 18.3 times less expensive using watsonx.ai compared to OpenAI's GPT-4[3]. ## Governance and Transparency Watsonx.ai provides stronger governance and transparency features: - It offers more transparent governance that mitigates legal risks for organizations[3]. - There is greater clarity on data sources used for training, reducing concerns about potential intellectual property infringement[3]. ## Customization and Flexibility IBM's platform allows for more customization: - Developers can create custom "intents" and structure programs around them, unlike OpenAI which only allows for "fine-tuning"[6]. - It can be tailored for specific industries and use cases, providing domain-specific expertise[7]. ## Enterprise Focus Watsonx.ai is designed specifically for enterprise needs: - It offers features like integration with existing applications and natural language understanding capabilities[2]. - The platform is built to scale up AI use cases as needed, with integrations to other IBM tools for data management and governance[2]. ## Adaptability Watsonx.ai provides flexibility in model selection: - It allows seamless switching between different language models based on the specific task requirements, optimizing performance and efficiency[3]. While OpenAI may have advantages in areas like general-purpose AI and creative tasks, IBM watsonx.ai appears to offer significant benefits for enterprises looking for customizable, cost-effective, and governance-focused AI solutions. Citations: [1] https://www.trustradius.com/compare-products/azure-openai-service-vs-ibm-watsonx-ai [2] https://www.trustradius.com/compare-products/ibm-watsonx-ai-vs-openai-api [3] https://www.crushbank.com/why-crushbank-chose-ibm-watsonx-and-how-it-benefits-our-clients/ [4] https://www.reddit.com/r/IBM/comments/1cj9yc3/thoughts_on_watson_ai/ [5] https://6sense.com/tech/artificial-intelligence/openai-vs-ibmwatsonxai [6] https://www.trmnet.com/2023/04/whats-the-big-difference-in-a-i-ibm-watson-vs-openai-chatgpt/ [7] https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/mostly-unbiased-comparison-openai-chatgpt-google-bard-yerramsetti-v9i9c [8] https://www.gartner.com/reviews/market/cloud-ai-developer-services/compare/ibm-vs-openai vijesh-bhaktha: These content can help here - Granite Models positioning - https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCpH69CQ96FQB84FH9gHCTGBmWhV Competitive (includes comparisons objection handlings against Azure OpenAI) - https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCM9h4qhBCmX2GHWWPVf6DWQj68j vijesh-bhaktha: Mistral enablement - [Link](https://ibm.seismic.com/app?ContentId=7f7b6631-07a7-4349-a07c-ebf8d6e79ab2#/doccenter/861ea1fd-99e0-44d7-9135-85412e5c28d1/doc/%252Fdd3359e5f7-a856-a91b-7688-41024b2ac637%252FdfNTY4NmVhOWItY2RkNS04ZWY3LTZkNzItZTQwZjczMWUyMjk1%252CPT0%253D%252CRGF0YSBhbmQgQUk%253D%252FdfOthers%252FdfOTRiYmU4NTQtNWY4NC03Y2QyLWZjYWUtOGIxYmFmZjkyZThk%252CPT0%253D%252CQW5ub3VuY2VtZW50L05ld3M%253D%252Flffd32557a-40da-4f98-ac89-8e86fba43e72//) cir: Consideration is needed to note that comparing wastsonx.ai and Open AI is not a straight comparison. Benchmarking, code generation comparison - model task validation.. cir: @robert-stanich FYI, any comments on this would be helpful. Possibly to educate client's perspective. Title: Request for clarity in LLM lifecycles and deprecation
Comments: cir: @vijesh-bhaktha FYI vijesh-bhaktha: @cir - Nisarg Patel is looking into this. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Any updates as of yet? cir: Using BYOM, any model deprecated will be moved to model on demand. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/saas?topic=models-foundation-model-lifecycle cir: Team to review Lifecycle and model choice documentation nisarg-patel: Yes, any deprecated model will be going to on demand so it will be available to the customer to use but just in a single-tenant capacity. Right now competitors keep the models on the platform for 6 months to a year (which by default is pretty much what wx.ai has been doing as well). As for deprecations, we have a 90 day and 30 day deprecation policy for ibm and third party models respectively, and we've been trying to alert customers even more ahead of time like we did for Llama 2. cir: @andrea-tonti Okay to close? andrea-tonti: Will be this reflected in the official documentation ( apart from the competitors information? ) If yes, then ok to close. Thanks cir: @andrea-tonti Reference the official doc above. If something is missing let us know. keely: @andrea-tonti Deploy on Demand and BYOM are both options for customers when models get deprecated. And here is documentation about foundation model lifecycles. Can we close this issue?

Title: watsonx.data (SaaS) - Managed Milvus (private endpoints + change management)
Comments: cir: @mogle Can you review this please. 1. Mid 2025 - short term to move to software deployment. 3. Release schedule ? WATMANN: To 1. currently IBM Consulting deployed the open source version of Milvus into a ROKS cluster on IBM Cloud. Deploying a full Cloud Pak for Data Foundation SW deployment "just" for Milvus will be hard to justify as they are using watsonx.ai (Studio + WML -- Llama3) also in a SaaS deployment due to the business case that is just starting out. As SaaS / IBM Cloud alternative ICD Elastic (Enterprise|Platinum) might be the alternative - also used in another division at Mercedes - but would require changes within the existing and tested python code base. But seems like a sensible option right now. WATMANN: @mogle - any additional insights on this? Thanks! cir: @mogle Any thoughts on the above? cir: Note: is this a possible workaround? Rohan-Pednekar: 1. We are targeting context based restrictions feature that around cover this ask. 2. Bring your own encryption key is also on roadmap for h1 2025 3. Milvus upgrades depends on various factors - Open source roadmap In-house feature testing Performance testing Security checks Milvus 2.5 may come up in h1 2025 based on above factors. 4. Yes, what exact features would be good here? Also, meanwhile, Customer can bring their own attu and integrate with .data milvus if needed Rohan-Pednekar: Also please consider opening new ideas in Idea portal as these are feature requests WATMANN: Hello Rohan, 1. Thanks - good to hear that this is addressed. Having Cloud Service Endpoints and also Virtual Private Endpoints to be able to consume the SaaS services securely and easily from a networking perspective is also essential for production deployments on Cloud with confidential data put through the system. The private endpoint request from Simon for watsonx made its way through the Product Scout process -- see https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WTNXDATA-I-82 . 2. Excellent. 3. It would be very helpful to have a versioning policy similar to **https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/cloud-databases?topic=cloud-databases-versioning-policy** and a definition of the responsibility for change management as in **https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/cloud-databases?topic=cloud-databases-responsibilities-cloud-databases#change-management-responsibilities** for e.g. _minor_/major updates. Maybe that's already documented somewhere? Also backup+recovery policies / responsibilities. Personal opinion: We acquired Compose quite a few years ago with their focus on managing open source databases, went through the whole hardening process with ICD. Not everything perfect there, but I think it would be valuable to benefit from the learnings to not re-invent the wheel with regards to the essentials. 4. This is not super-important. But one of the ICD shortcomings from my point of view is that you just get a barebone endpoint, TLS certs, credentials, that's it. Not even an admin console for most of the databases. Wouldn't it be great if you buy a SaaS service to have a pre-installed managed console already in place for you ( e.g. Attu or what https://zilliz.com provides ) ? cir: Dev team call to be discussed for WPP. Ideas to be split out to manage issues. cir: Tentative solution being discussed. Arch meeting to be held to verify. keely: @Mekki-MacAulay will update keely: 3 architecture meetings so far, making progress! Mekki-MacAulay: Private endpoints are progressing and are tracked under https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/issues/199 and future updates for that issue will only be posted there to avoid duplication. Other issues in this request can be tracked here. keely: Still need a status for change management. @mogle will get an answer. See issue #231 , we should probably combine these. @keely will investigate. cir: Progressing and committed for Q125 ck-rao: We can close this one as we are tracking in the other issue#
