Title: EMEA - Cloud Services - Watsonx.data - Unacceptable outage
Comments: cir: @mogle Can you review and comment please? mogle: Please note the PR containing the fix has been merged and will be available in our next release (eo September) The root cause of the issue is in this code: https://github.ibm.com/lakehouse/lakehouse-server/blob/971cedca67b8c0012b1d9de30a381978f05309f9/server/source/apis/utils/Utils.go#L545 for the console-api component. In that code, the Cloud Services self-signed tls certificate, mounted into the pods/containers and found in the path available in the SSL_CUSTOM_CRT environment variable is used for 2 things. Its loaded into an [x509 key pair object](https://github.ibm.com/lakehouse/lakehouse-server/blob/971cedca67b8c0012b1d9de30a381978f05309f9/server/source/apis/utils/Utils.go#L566) and included as a [client side TLS certificate](https://github.ibm.com/lakehouse/lakehouse-server/blob/971cedca67b8c0012b1d9de30a381978f05309f9/server/source/apis/utils/Utils.go#L573) during communication with the nodeclient Its loaded into an [x509 certificate pool](https://github.ibm.com/lakehouse/lakehouse-server/blob/971cedca67b8c0012b1d9de30a381978f05309f9/server/source/apis/utils/Utils.go#L554-L563) and that certificate pool is [included as the RootCA](https://github.ibm.com/lakehouse/lakehouse-server/blob/971cedca67b8c0012b1d9de30a381978f05309f9/server/source/apis/utils/Utils.go#L572) during communication with the nodeclient Number 1 is correct. The certificate found in SSL_CUSTOM_CRT is the current leaf certificate that the server (nodeclient in this case) should be validating. Whether the TLS connection listener in the nodeclient container is actually validating that certificate is something that development will need to confirm. Number 2 is not correct, and needs to be fixed. Using the leaf certificate for validation of the certificate being provided by the server (nodeclient) is too restrictive, and is not typical for TLS flows. The validation should be done using an intermediate or root certificate that was used during the generation of the leaf certificate. Fortunately, an intermediate certificate is already available in the console api container to be used. It is found at /internal-tls/ca.crt which is specified in the INTERNAL_SSL_CERT_FILE environment variable. TALS: @Mekki-MacAulay - can we understand how we prevent it from happening or being alerted, not just how to solve it after? mogle: @TALS @cir I wasn't clear in my earlier comment and I apologize. The fix I noted in the first line of my last comment, once it gets to production, **will prevent that particular certificate issue from happening again.** For reference a short description of the fix implemented for our next release: - Currently, in the console, the api microservice establishes a TLS connection to the nodeclient microservice. - The way the connection is configured is incorrect, because it is validating the nodeclient's TLS certificate using a leaf certificate instead of the intermediate certificate from the certificate chain. - By using the intermediate cert for validation, it will mean that the validation process will allow for flexibility in certificate rotations between the two microservices. (ie. they don't have to both be using the exact same cert at the same time) Does this now answer completely? cir: @simon-kronfeld Can we close this. FRANKO: @cir is this fixed ? simon-kronfeld: @cir @mogle @FRANKO Has the fix now been applied and confirmed that this issue will not occur again? Has a related check been done to look for other instances of certificates which may expire to ensure that this has been addressed across watsonx.data? This check for Certificates which could expire - should be across all watsonx components. If the answer is yes to the above, then this issue can be closed. mogle: the fix is being integrated in this month's release - production deployment is starting today so it should be in prod by eod week - that is the plan. Per my earlier posts - the current fix will prevent that particular certificate issue from happening again. Based on what I am told from Engineering the RCA was done and potential areas of similar potential were reviewed and did not show the same potential issue. simon-kronfeld: @cir Close case based upon last update?

Title: EMEA - Issue? - Watsonx.data (IBM Cloud aaS) provision with private endpoints
Labels: help wanted, question, EMEA, watsonx.data, setup issue, Data products, Product Scout
Comments: simon-kronfeld: Enrico has additional request for assistance about the watsonx.api _Concerning the REST API: I wonder how I can configure the COS bucket using the API. Is this the right one? https://cloud.ibm.com/apidocs/watson-data-api#transactional-post-project If so I do not understand how to configure an existing COS bucket using the storage section. I assume I have to set amazon_s3 as type but there is no option to set the access and secret key values, e.g. So I wonder how the service can be configured then._  simon-kronfeld: @cir Is there someone we can link up with Enrico to discuss the issue? FRANKO: @simon-kronfeld connect with @Frank Ketelaars and/or @Arthur Laimbock mogle: @cir per our discussions on Thursday, if they are trying to provision a wxd with private endpoints on, it will fail because we donâ€™t support it. The Dev team has confirmed that and noted they should be going opening a support ticket (which looks like they have) to get the appropriate support. simon-kronfeld: @cir @mogle @Mekki-MacAulay Please can someone point me to the documentation where we say what is / isn't supported in terms of endpoints for watsonx.data (and wider watsonx family of components) and what will fail due to known issues? I've not seen anywhere this is documented and in my opinion is really important to have, and expect, when connecting .data to an IBM cloud based respository and / or doing automated script based deployments on IBM Cloud. "_provision a wxd with private endpoints on, it will fail because we donâ€™t support it_" - This is a big statement with lots of potential implications. Mekki-MacAulay: @simon-kronfeld : I've been working with the documentation team for the past week on this to make sure that I get you a clear answer. I apologise for the delay. I will follow-up shortly. mogle: @shrinivas-kulkarni can you weigh in on this please and provide some guidance? Mekki-MacAulay: @simon-kronfeld @mogle: I met with @shrinivas-kulkarni and @Hans-Uhlig last week and we went over this. Here is the summary of the outcome: 1. It's important that we distinguish between /outgoing/ and /incoming/ when it comes to (virtual) private endpoints (or VPEs). 2. watsonx.data SaaS on IBM Cloud (and all other IBM Cloud SaaS) offerings DO support OUTGOING VPE connections to other services that support INCOMING VPEs (that is, they expose a VPE for other services to connect to). That's the case with your client with the connection to DB2. This is supported and confirmed. The previous firewall/network cross-connection issues have been resolved and are no longer a factor. 3. I'm working with the documentation team to update the watsonx.data SaaS in IBM Cloud documentation to make it clear that outgoing connections to services that are VPE-enabled is supported. 4. watsonx.data SaaS on IBM Cloud does NOT support /incoming/ VPE, that is, it does not expose a VPE for other services to connect to. There is an out of date list of which services in IBM Cloud are VPE_enabled here: [https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-vpe-supported-services](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-vpe-supported-services) - While it says "updated September 23", that's actually just a wording update based on my conversations with the documentation team and the list of services is a year out of date. We are still working behind the scenes to get a comprehensive list of VPE-enabled services to update on that page. I will let you know when it is up to date. Note that watsonx.data is CORRECTLY not on the current list as it is not supported at this time. Note that DB2 is INCORRECTLY not on the current list as it IS supported (per [this page](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/Db2whc?topic=Db2whc-connect_options)) but the VPE-enabled services documentation page hasn't added it to the list yet. 5. If your client needs watsonx.data SaaS to support incoming VPE (that is, expose a VPE for other services to connect to) that is a new feature request that you could submit and discuss with @mogle . simon-kronfeld: @Mekki-MacAulay Could we catch-up for a chat on the above, please? I'd like to include a colleague from TEL Services as well. For your information we've logged 3 ideas entries around VPEs One for data, one for ai, and a final one for gov. https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WTNXDATA-I-82 https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-166 https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WGOV-I-59 Mekki-MacAulay: @simon-kronfeld Happy to chat. simon-kronfeld: Have spoken with Mekki - Thank you. ATL has set-up a call with key product team leadership to discuss on Friday (27/9) VPEs for SaaS and potential impact to this delivery / customer simon-kronfeld: This is progressing via calls with product management via Account team. Mekki-MacAulay: watsonx.data SaaS private endpoints Git issue has been updated with latest architecture per the architecture team meetings over the past few weeks: https://github.ibm.com/lakehouse/tracker/issues/4269 ck-rao: Per @Mekki-MacAulay, this is an RFE for Product Scout and will be released in Q1. https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WTNXDATA-I-82 = .data => Q1 2025 https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-166 - .ai => Delivered Q4 2024 https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WGOV-I-59 - .gov => TBD keely: @Shyam-Bhaskaran Will you please see when this is planned? Is it still planned for this quarter? FRANKO: @Shyam-Bhaskaran these are very critical for several deployments ongoing ie on WPP. So hope rumour is not mistaken and we soon have this ideally in Q1. @mogle @ck-rao Shyam-Bhaskaran: Hello @keely / @FRANKO - I have raised the question on the timelines and status to Stevan and will get back to you with a response. Thanks. Shyam-Bhaskaran: Hello @keely / @FRANKO - We have got the confirmation from the team that this will be part of the Q1 release. The current GA date is planned for 04/02. Thanks. CC: @mogle. FRANKO: Thanks a lot FYI @simon-kronfeld keely: FYI @paulbirch (since Simon will be on holiday for 2 weeks) simon-kronfeld: Hi @Shyam-Bhaskaran @keely @FRANKO Thanks for the update on 2nd April 25 - is this a confirmed date or targeted date, please? Has it been released? How can we tell if it's been released? We want to make the IBM-C project team and TEL Services are aware of this date, as we'll need to check / configure, and need to ensure they allocate time for when this becomes available. Also, if this is likely to slip, then the project team may start to consider alternative approaches. simon-kronfeld: Just been on a project stand-up and this is now critical path for the WPP project for watsonx.data, so need a committed date for delivery, otherwise the project needs to look at alternatives. @Shyam-Bhaskaran @ck-rao @FRANKO @keely simon-kronfeld: **IMPORTANT** - Further to the updates above, the IBM Project delivery team have confirmed that to meet their June MVP delivery dates, they need to make a decision on watsonx.data this week. This is IBM-C led MVP for actual use by the first WPP end customer (Nespresso) in June / July, with others staggered through-out Q3 / Q4 2025. Therefore, it is urgent we give clear committed dates, or they will need to look at alternatives in order to meet their delivery dates. @keely @Shyam-Bhaskaran @ck-rao @FRANKO @paulbirch keely: @simon-kronfeld See the 2.1.2 release notes, looks like it is available! https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/watsonxdata?topic=watsonxdata-release FRANKO: Excellent news @keely and @ck-rao - would have been great if @Shyam-Bhaskaran or somebody else could have given confirmation of this. But great news we got this fixed in the 11th hour for the project @simon-kronfeld drive. @simon-kronfeld I assume this confirm they will use wx.data as private end-points is now available. THANKS ! simon-kronfeld: @keely @Franko @ck-rao @Shyam-Bhaskaran Thank you for the support, this is promising; however.... We're using Dallas, and when we check our instance which was pre-configured, it still shows as 2.1.1 **ASK: Please can we have confirmation of region roll-out timelines, please - particularly Dallas?**  Background Information: We've looked at the release notes and it mentions that it is being released across regions. https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/watsonxdata?topic=watsonxdata-release "Important: watsonx.data 2.1.2 version is releasing to different geographic regions in stages and is not available in all regions. To know if the 2.1.2 release is available in your region, contact IBM Support. If you are currently using watsonx.data 2.1.1 version, you can refer to the documentation, [watsonx.data 2.1.1](https://ibm.ent.box.com/s/zgw7umzibl9akxgi7vm4yxs4vyp8io6g)." We will be trying later today to setup a new instance in dallas, as well as contacting support, but if you have contacts who can help confirm / expedite that'd be appreciated. simon-kronfeld: @keely @FRANKO cc: @paulbirch @ck-rao To also follow official routes as well as this mechanism, We've now also created a support ticket: CS4276391 FYI, it also looks like we now can't also create new watsonx.data instances for this customer against their IBM Cloud account in Dallas to check whether a new instance of wx.data would be at the old or new version. So again, this is not very useful or robust of updates being applied to an customer facing IBM Cloud aaS capability. Pranavkrishna Muraleedharan from support contacted me on slack, and we've had a teams call. He's also investigating, so wanted you to be aware.. Support Ticket Content: Detailed description - Need wx.data Virtual Private End-point (VPE) functionality 1. We have wx.data setup in us-south dallas and need the new v2.1.2 VPE functionality for wx.data. We understood that the wx.data v2.1.2 was released 4/4/25. Looking at our instance for the WPP ADI POC Development environment it's still showing as v2.1.1 IBM watsonx.data Version: 2.1.1.0.0 Console build: wxd-v2.1.2-2.1.2-20250401164134b4497 Region: us-south Plan type: Enterprise ASK: Please can we have confirmed date where this will be available in US-south Dallas and therefore our WPP IBM Cloud account? This is critical path for some of our deliveries for IBM-C and TEL Services on behalf of our customer. 2. ASK: We also need confirmation of any additional update steps we need to perform once the US south dallas is upgraded; will the VPE options under configuration of the wx.data dashboard; or do we need to create a new instance for the options to become available? 3. As part of our testing we've used another WPP IBM Cloud sub-account to try and create a new instance and get the following error, so we're not sure if there's an issue, the region roll-out is underway, or something else. Service was not created Please contact the Service Provider for this error. [500, Internal Server Error] We were unable to complete your request. Try again later or contact support if the issue persists. As indicated at the start, this is critical path for our delivery for WPP and need it addressing asap, or we need to consider mitigations / alternative approaches. Please feel free to contact me directly on IBM slack simon kronfeld, email or phone simon-kronfeld: @keely @FRANKO @paulbirch New update from Support - watsonx.data Virtual end points. This was GA on IBM cloud 4/4/2025 - but is being rolled out over various regions / clusters over the coming days. I understand the IBM Cloud cluster on which WPP is based is being upgraded tomorrow! I'm pushing for a confirmed schedule and understanding of any impact / outage / etc. Also, could it be pulled forward Still also trying to understand why we can't create new instances of wx.data as that's not good, but is a second issue. FRANKO: @ck-rao see this issue creating new instances with wx.data. Considering the focus we have on getting wx.data used and deployed we really need PM support to make the last mile on above challenges. Thanks @keely FRANKO: @ck-rao do we need to raise also with Cloud SRE team? ck-rao: @mogle will help on this issue. @FRANKO @simon-kronfeld can you send me the correct support case number, please? CS4276391 doesn't seem to be the right number, they usually start with TS....example... TS009950842. or please give me the complete support ticket link. simon-kronfeld: @ck-rao @mogle CS4276391 is the correct support ticket as logged via the IBM Cloud Support - create new case function - watsonx.data is the function. https://cloud.ibm.com/unifiedsupport/cases?accountId=769134360b734fb584beffe55fa9b9dc&number=CS4276391  I don't seem to be able to add yourselves to this ticket, potentially because you're not users authenticated against the customer's cloud account? simon-kronfeld: Checked this morning 8:30 10/4/25 Seems like the versions have already changed: IBM watsonx.data Version: 2.1.2.0.0 Console build: wxd-v2.1.2-2.1.2-20250401164134b4497 Region us-south BUT.... We still don't see the Virtual private endpoints tile as per the documented configuration process... I've added this to the IBM Cloud watsonx.data support case simon-kronfeld: Support has just pointed out that VPE are only available in ca-tor and au-syd. I may have missed this as it's only mentioned in the setup documentation, and not the release notes!! I've said that is not acceptable. I've asked for reasoning / justification and when it will be available in Dallas and Europe as this not only affects WPP, but other customers. We need this to be available in Dallas for WPP, (and europe for others?). We will try spinning up an instance in one of the geos mentioned - This may allow us to move forward (not said this to support), but this is not where the client's data is, or the other WPP instances (all Dallas). It may introduce latency / data sovereignty / architectural decisions issues. So not really suitable to have elsewhere. Please can we escalate? Shyam-Bhaskaran: @keely @ck-rao - @mogle is going to have a conversation with Edward on the prioritization of the other regions. The TOR and SYD are the ones that have been made available with private end points as part of the Q1 release. The other regions are some where around Q3 but will confirm and let you know once the plan is in place. Apologies for the delay as i had some time off last week. As such the current roll-out plan is as shown: ![image](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/data-watsonx/assets/238109/6259f38e-6864-439e-8470-27936447e632) FRANKO: @simon-kronfeld if the roll-out plan stick as-is what is the challenges with WPP implementation? simon-kronfeld: @FRANKO Currently the project team are assessing whether CA-TOR may work for them, as they are now also looking at Streamsets - which will first be available in same data centre in may / june. simon-kronfeld: That said, as the solution is for multiple customers, there maybe a need for other geos down the line, but as yet this need and associated timeline is not confirmed. Title: Confusing, incorrect and outdated watsonx reference architectures
Comments: cir: @avarshn Who can we work with on the reference arch's ? avarshn: @cir I think this would be the Product Managers who own the specific products. Can we get a list of known reference architectures that need to be updated so we can engage the right PMs? @ingeh from a content standpoint, would be able to support this or would it be some else on the content team? Thanks. ingeh: Those web pages are not owned by the docs team. They are owned by ckirby@ca.ibm.com. avarshn: Thanks @ingeh ! @cir - if we can get a list of known outdated architecture pages, it will be easier to then engage Chris and anyone else needed. Thanks. Benedikt-Bothur: first of all: thanks for putting these architectures out there - it is what we've been lacking for years. All hyperscalers have dedicated pages, with ready-to-use reference architectures. Please find an initial list of architecture pages I am referring to: 1. https://www.ibm.com/architectures/hybrid/genai-rag - watsonx.ai on SaaS definitely not an option for highly regulated industries, watsonx.ai can very well be deployed in the same client location - Proposed component for vector db is Elastic (aka watsonx Discovery) - needs to be updated to work with watsonx.data (Milvus) 2. https://www.ibm.com/architectures/hybrid/genai-generative-search - Watson Discovery is not able to provide answers using semantic search (which is one of the reasons we opted for watsonx Discovery / Elastic) - watsonx.ai on SaaS definitely not an option for highly regulated industries, watsonx.ai can very well be deployed in the same client location 3. https://www.ibm.com/architectures/hybrid/genai-augmented-software-development - Simply lists some concepts, but not architectures (although listed under /architectures) - Incredibly high-level for a few personas, simply not useful 4. Document summarization is the same link as RAG cir: @Benedikt-Bothur Can this be closed or do you require more? cir: OIC scope.

Title: watsonx Discovery documentation
Comments: cir: @dilang dilang: Here is the response from PM, It is true that there is no public documentation about watsonx Discovery by IBM. The decision was made to leverage the documentation that Elastic published for their product as this is an OEM. I have guidance in the [FAQ](https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCcqGWJhGT8fjGTP6DTgbb2T7VhP) on page 2 and 3 that for documentation you should go directly to Elastic but to also ensure that you are pulling documentation from the current version. There is guidance on the current version of Elasticsearch that is used for watsonx Discovery on both the [Seismic page for watsonx Discovery](https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCGJXg9XPWF4T8mMfJ8JFj4JhMdP) (under the section "Latest News") as well as the [seller deck](https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCG23TCH7dDVj8HH97WfHBCpjf93) (slide 24). I understand that the name is confusing when we have Watson Discovery and now watsonx Discovery but there is nothing I can do about the naming convention for this OEM partnership (the decision was made from top executives). Benedikt-Bothur: @dilang thanks for reaching out to Andrew. - public documentation: I expect to have a page for watsonx Discovery in our **externally-facing** documentation (https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/w-and-w/2.0.x or https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/latest?topic=overview), with a link to the latest supported Elastic documentation. - version: great to see that this has been added just recently. - naming convention: I understand, I am simply playing back what my clients tell me. cir: Di to schedule a call to discuss Benedikt-Bothur: Synced with Andrew Cabral, who will look to include a page on the CP4D services documentation. cir: @Benedikt-Bothur Okay to close?

Title: Watson Discovery SharePoint Server Connector functionality insufficient and not enterprise-grade
Comments: cir: @dilang Can you take a look at this. dilang: @Benedikt-Bothur Can you share the idea URL and the business impact? Benedikt-Bothur: @dilang https://bigblue.aha.io/ideas/ideas/CPDIDEAS-I-1084 https://bigblue.aha.io/ideas/ideas/WDS-I-303 To give more context: In its current form, the connector only integrates with entire SharePoint servers, lacking the functionality to select specific subsets. This limitation has been highlighted by major clients, including Lockheed Martin and Dataport, as a significant issue hindering the adoption of Watson Discovery in large-scale environments. We could now calculate an artificial business impact, but I rather question whether the product development team has really thought this through, when they released the capability. Benedikt-Bothur: We (@cir @dilang @Benedikt-Bothur) had a sync with Andrew Cabral, who will speak to development (Krysztof) to re-consider the enhancement request for the improved Sharepoint Server connector capability. dilang: PM replied, **The ongoing enhancements for intelligent document processing capabilities are being brought to watsonx Orchestrate so there are no plans for connector enhancements with Watson Discovery**. cir: @Benedikt-Bothur Thoughts? cir: Charles Rankin referred to a dark API - investigating

Comments: simon-kronfeld: @Benedikt-Bothur interesting issue. Is this standalone installs, SaaS on IBM Cloud, or both? FRANKO: [watsonx DACH deployment inhibitors.pdf](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/files/1392655/watsonx.DACH.deployment.inhibitors.pdf) Adding DACH file to the Git - other issues also raised in this Git and as RFE cir: @avarshn This is coming back to the broader ask we had raised earlier. Can we get a focal from Dev to move this forward cir: @avarshn When will the work that Michael is doing be available for the CSMs? cir: @Mekki-MacAulay Mekki-MacAulay: This integration work is an ongoing process that I and others have been involved in for 18+ months. Michael Connor is currently leading. If there are specific integration features that are desired for this client, let me know and I can help prioritize them in the overall integration. Benedikt-Bothur: @Mekki-MacAulay client requested the integration of watsonx platform (ai,data,gov) with Watson Discovery and watsonx Discovery. Mekki-MacAulay: @Benedikt-Bothur : Thanks for the update. I'm sure you understand that "integration" for 1. watsonx.ai + Watson Discovery 2. watsonx.ai + watsonx Discovery 3. watsonx.data + Watson Discovery 4. watsonx.data + watsonx Discovery 5. watsonx.gov + Watson Discovery 6. watsonx.gov + watsonx Discovery is quite a roadmap of integration. All I can update at this time at that high of a level is "it's in progress." If there are specific integrations required for one or more of those 6, I can ask that they be prioritized. FRANKO: @Benedikt-Bothur can we be more concrete on specific cases to get priority ? Benedikt-Bothur: @Mekki-MacAulay fair comment. Integration #2 (watsonx.ai with watsonx Discovery) is likely of greatest priority, as this will drive many deployment use cases in the area of "enterprise search". fyi: I am aware of the Elastic Connector within watsonx.ai and that it can be leveraged to some extent. Generally speaking, the goal should be to have one unified experience across all products that have "watsonx" in its name, with a particular focus on operational topics (multi-tenancy, IAM, backup/restore, roles and permissions). FRANKO: @martin-keller fyi keely: @Benedikt-Bothur Please open an Idea for this in the Ideas portal. Having the idea will help get it prioritized. And please be as specific as possible in the request. keely: @Benedikt-Bothur Did you open an Idea? If so, will you please link it here. keely: @Benedikt-Bothur please provide a status on this issue, and let us know if you opened an Aha Idea. Benedikt-Bothur: @keely fine for now, I am sure there is work underway. Let's close this issue.

OIC formed. cir: @Mekki-MacAulay Can you comment on the OIC ? etc. or anything else that helps addressing this issue? connomon: The enablement session noted above happened on Sep 18th. There are charts and replay available which positioned wx.ai and redhat components RHOAI and RHEL. Included a demo of verious components as well. See link: https://ec.yourlearning.ibm.com/w3/playback/10465889 - with deck and recording available. connomon: Also from a documentation perspective, see: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/5.0.x?topic=software-installing-operators-services-that-require-gpus and https://docs.redhat.com/en/documentation/red_hat_openshift_ai_self-managed/2.8/html/installing_and_uninstalling_openshift_ai_self-managed/preparing-openshift-ai-for-ibm-cpd_prepare-openshift-ai-ibm-cpd.html Mekki-MacAulay: Michael is updating the documentation per his posts. The OIC initiative between IBM and Red Hat just launched and initial planning meetings will be happening the first week of October. I added two of our CSM colleagues at their request. I can share additional GTM material as it is developed in the OIC project. Benedikt-Bothur: Thanks for the links and comments, very helpful (especially different [documentation sections for Red Hat OpenShift AI](https://docs.redhat.com/en/documentation/red_hat_openshift_ai_self-managed/2.8/)) As per my current understanding: Phase 1: I want to experiment, locally on my laptop -> InstructLab Phase 2: I want to train a model: -> RHEL AI Phase 3: I want to deploy a model in a scalable way -> OpenShift AI Phase 4: I want to try out different models, use a Prompt Lab, try out Tuning Studio, want to have an UI and govern my models -> watsonx (.ai + .governance) Phase 3 and Phase 4 does have overlapping capabilities, especially when looking at Day 2 operations like multi-tenancy or backup / restore (as mentioned above) - Red Hat does follow a different path than IBM. I have high hopes the OIC initiative (where I am part of) will result in a clear positioning. keely: Hi @Benedikt-Bothur , Has this issue been resolved? FRANKO: Hi I think this issue is closed too fast and before we have some strong positioning material. We have customers saying no to deploy watsonx as they have Openshift ai. Also the Developer vs LOB doesn't work in the field. This have been discussed with @armand Ruiz also via Frank Ketelaars. Will re-open this case until we have a clear POV and material team can take to customers @keely @TALS fyi FRANKO: This issue is now also raised from France team by Kaldia Douag and Vincent Perrin vijesh-bhaktha: [5 - RedHat and watsonx.pptx](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/data-watsonx/files/1580597/5.-.RedHat.and.watsonx.pptx) FRANKO: Thanks @vijesh-bhaktha, for me this more show the platform as an evolution but not fully crisp view use x for this and use y for this type of use cases. I will circulate deck and collect more responses from markets @Benedikt-Bothur is this material above helping? Benedikt-Bothur: @FRANKO very good observation, thanks for reopening. As OpenShift AI offers the capability to host open-source and multi-modal models, this deck needs to be updated (multi-modal is listed as a clear differentiator for wx.ai). Luckily, for my the clients I mostly work with, we are pushing watsonx as a platform (I am still a CSM), but for a pure model-serving use case, OpenShift AI would tick all the boxes. vijesh-bhaktha: @Benedikt-Bothur - For a pure model serving use cases we should position watsonx.ai Lightweight Engine -which brings you all the capability to host models without installing the full stack watsonx.ai and provides a smooth expansion opportunity to full stack in the future [Documentation](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/software-hub/5.2.x?topic=install-choosing-installation-mode). keely: @Benedikt-Bothur please see update above, does this address your concern? keely: @Benedikt-Bothur please see update above, does this address your concern? keely: Will have more clarity after workshop in Oct. vijesh-bhaktha: Here is another blog that details out the technical positioning for 2025 - https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/academy-assets/blog/8b522a00-6960-11f0-b96c-8d1c8ebf6a96

Malcolm-Singh: Hi Jessie, reviewing your OP, I have a couple questions/comments. 1. Which details are you seeking about the API key. In this interface, there is the option to copy the existing key, which should then be stored and distributed as needed. 2. The functionality to (re)create and revoke/delete APIs is common, which is one of the responsibilities of an administrator. The administrator is responsible for handling the API keys and working with the various teams if there are changes. 3. Has your customer expressed concern how the API keys are maintained? Can you describe how they handle API keys for other applications in their environment. keely: @Jessie-Lan Please see Malcolm's response above. Does this resolve the issue? Jessie-Lan: After receive the feedback from client, we have discovered that the API key can only be copied during its initial creation.If we Subsequently, due to personnel handovers, it becomes impossible to replicate the key again. Additionally, we would like to request the design of an advanced confirmation prompt or a fail-safe mechanism to prevent accidental regeneration of the key. If there's a copy icon that I haven't located, please gently remind me. Title: AI Governance alignment to watsonx.gov entitlements question
Comments: TALS: Please rise the request in the Gainsight Git - https://github.ibm.com/hybrid-cloud/gainsight-support/issues Ryan-Mongenel: @TALS this isn't a gainsight question. I need the OM team to give me details on this offering and their alignment to watsonx.gov. TALS: Product Management to check if those part fall under watsonx.gov or belong to DAI out of watsonx umbrella. @Carlo cir: @Upasana-Bhattacharya1 Can you review the above question on entitlements and part numbers? kshabalin: There are 2 products/bundles with similar naming. - [AI Governance (OpenPages MRG, OpenScale, AI Factsheets) bundle](https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/?id=L-TBFK-37487A&lc=en). It is our older bundled offering for traditional AI governance, not GenAI/watsonx. D0CP9ZX, E0CP8ZX - IBM AI Governance Install License D0CVKZX, E0CVJZX - IBM AI Governance for IBM Z - [AI Governance Express (OpenPages MRG only)](https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/?id=L-CVKA-72QAEX&lc=en) - is a part of OpenPages program, not a bundle. Newer offering, 2023, but still for traditional AI only, not GenAI/watsonx. D0DR0ZX, E0DQZZX IBM AI Governance Express on Premises Install Summary and tradeup options: None of these can be used as watsonx.gov, only for traditional AI. "AI Governance" can be traded up to watsonx.gov (see [watsonx tradeups on Seismic](https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCQqWQFPbPGJ48MQGdcpcGJHj33B)), while the "AI Governance Express" does not have a tradeup path. kshabalin: @carlo-appugliese Ryan-Mongenel: Thanks @kshabalin! This is helpful! Kim Humphrey confirmed that these parts will count towards the watsonx.gov scorecard. So I we are trying to understand how to move forward with. I agree the best route is a trade-up to .gov. cir: @Ryan-Mongenel Do you need this kept open?

Title: wx.gov - Github - wx.gov sample notebooks - detached prompt monitoring template issue
Comments: cir: @Snehal-Gawas Can you review the comments above please? Snehal-Gawas: @arsuryan - Can you please look into this issue related to the detached prompt template notebook and advise on the solution? Adding @thomas-hampp @syellare from the Factsheet team for awareness in case of any dependency. thomas-hampp: As stated above root cause here that the OP sync can't handle the slash / character in `google/flan-t5-base HF` . I think there are two things we need to ensure: 1. ensuring that names with characters like slash can be synced to OP. We can not state, "No special characters are allowed." The slash in (foundation) model names is not special, but omnipresent and even a standard. Our own models have names like `IBM/granite`. The workaround to remove the slash is only acceptable for a very short period. I thought we already had an issue for this but I can only find this older one: https://github.ibm.com/wdp-gov/tracker/issues/170181 2. ensuring we return a more meaningful error message when an OP sync occurs. syellare: We have an issue opened to track this issue https://github.ibm.com/wdp-gov/tracker/issues/183808 cir: @syellare Hello can you provide an update? Most of us cannot see the Issue you reference above. Thank you. syellare: I'll update you with the details in next week. cir: @syellare Any updates on this? dilang: @Mekki-MacAulay Vindya will find out the current status. thanks! syellare: Adding anilkumart@in.ibm.com and ayohannan@in.ibm.com who are QA and Dev managers for this. cir: @syellare Any updates on this? syellare: ayohannan@in.ibm.com and anilkumart@in.ibm.com do we have any update on this issue. keely: @keely Add notebook that Suzanne Golledge is looking up. suzanne-golledge: The github post linked in the original question no longer appears to be available. Here is a link to a blog & notebook for detached template monitoring that was posted in the watsonx-governance-techsales slack channel this week: https://ravi-chamarthy.medium.com/ensuring-responsible-ai-monitoring-azure-databricks-deployments-with-ibm-watsonx-governance-62143e49c732 https://github.com/IBM/watson-openscale-samples/blob/main/WatsonX.Governance/OnPrem/GenAI/2.0/samples/Detached%20Prompt%20Evaluation%20%20HF%20FLAN%20model.ipynb @Dominik-Kreuzberger - does this work any better for you? keely: Thank you @suzanne-golledge. This is the original notebook that @Dominik-Kreuzberger referenced: https://github.com/IBM/watson-openscale-samples/blob/main/WatsonX.Governance/Cloud/GenAI/samples/Detached%20Prompt%20Evaluation%20with%20WatsonXGov.ipynb The notebook you referenced will have the same issue because it includes this line, it contains a forward slash which is causing the issue: name = "External prompt sample (google/flan-t5-base HF) V2.0" suzanne-golledge: @keely - thanks. Got it. So the issue is about the OP sync can't handle the "/" (slash) character in a name (rather than there being an error in the notebook). keely: Well, you could argue that the notebooks do have an error because slashes are not accepted characters. The easiest thing to do would be to fix the notebooks. The ideal solution though is the enhance the product to allow slashes in names. The defect/bug side of it is that the error being thrown, eventually, is misleading. It says the model is already being tracked, when the real issue is that the error is due to wrong naming convention. And that error should be thrown earlier when the prompt is created. suzanne-golledge: That is a good way to lay it out. I know a ticket has been raised (TS016918106). I can't access. Is that for the misleading error message? Is there also an AHA for the enhancement request to allow slashes in names? FRANKO: @suzanne-golledge see aha above - @Dominik-Kreuzberger any further comments to above? keely: @Vindhya-K spoke to @Snehal-Gawas and they are currently working on this. TBD what the resolution will be. Vindhya-K: Dev is working on this. They're figuring out a way to allow slashes in names keely: @Vindhya-K will add target availability once she gets it ayohannan: The fix will be available in CPD 5.1 cir: @Dominik-Kreuzberger Can this be closed? Dominik-Kreuzberger: @cir yes, this issue has been resolved. Thanks!

Title: Common objections to installing watsonx.ai as Software in the A/NZ market
Comments: Achala-Amarasinghe: Hi, We see similar issues with the Japan market too since the initial cost of running a trial/POC on the customer's environment (on-premise) is quite high. This is also exacerbated with the need to have OpenShift as well. While the option to use IBM Cloud is present, they would then be required to upload data / have data accessed via SaaS. One other thing would be to consider 1. providing commercial GPU support by leveraging AMD's open-source Vulkan as opposed to CUDA, since it would allow existing GPUs (AMD, NVIDIA and Intel) to be used. This would not only reduce the cost of adoption, but also reduce the barrier to entry, while also addressing the GPU purchase costs. List of Vulkan driver supported GPUs: > https://vulkan.gpuinfo.org/ 2. If we can combine point 1 with the ability to share memory across multiple GPUs with varying memory capacities, watsonx would be easier to be adopt. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Can you review the questions raised by Felicia? Lightweight should address some concerns, Has there been a thorough analysis of the model required for the task at hand? i.e. smaller models etc. Felicia-Eng1: @cir - part of the issue with deciding which foundation models to install include the following: 1. When in development, a customer may want to test a variety of models. Loading all of the desired models for testing is impractical. 2. Though this can be partially solved by leveraging SaaS, this is not always possible for the level of testing the customer would want to do, e.g. if customer has data sovereignty concerns and want to test with real data, they may not be able to use SaaS. 3. This leaves us open to competition. Customers would solve this issue by doing their development via Notebooks or other open-source tools to run only on-demand on GPUs rather than typing them up 24/7. The customer then questions why they need to pay so much for watsonx licenses and would argue there is no value-add of the platform for their key requirements. 4. Eventually customers would want to leverage the platform for multiple use cases and multiple tenants in order to scale and improve ROI of the platform. The appropriate model for each use case may differ, in which case, multiple models would need to be loaded in and again, the consumption of GPUs 24/7 makes this an impractically large cost for many customers. cir: @sawyerst Can you review Felicia's comments above and how we address? and or provide a better way to test models? cir: @vijesh-bhaktha @avarshn See comments above from Felicia. This is a key POV we should address? Or more importantly what can be said to offset objections? vijesh-bhaktha: @cir - We are reviewing this internally. Few thoughts on the questions raised - **Is there a way to reduce the consumption of GPUs for each foundation model loaded?** **Is there an easier way to stop and start the foundation models rather than installing and uninstalling?** 1. We cannot reduce the consumption of GPUs, for each model we're already running on the smallest GPU possible. For example smaller models we run on L4s. For sharded models we cant reduce num shards. That is correct, if no one uses the model it still consumes GPU. CPU and RAM we can reduce but won't yeild any gains. 2. We can scale down the models, but it takes time to start up. If you thinking of scaling down unused model and scale up upon usage, it will add significant lag for larger models. Could be 30 min to start up the larger ones. 3. We also have Turbonomics in play to rightsize the model based on load. 4. The only small savings we can make is let go of the minimum of two GPUs HA for underused small public models. We already do that for infusion models. This means some potential outage for recovery time in case of a pod failure, but we typically donâ€™t see a lot of those pod failures. For more explanations/deep dive it would be ideal to get into a meeting with >> Paul Van Run, Lior Aronovich and David Tam **When do we expect wx.ai SaaS to be available in A/NZ region?** MCSP in Sydney. Current ETA is Nov 29, but that is subject to change as it is with all future release dates, especially on SaaS **Can more powerful GPUs be made accessible via SaaS?** We do not offer the ability for customers to choose their GPU type or environment on SaaS. But internally we will plan to upgrade type of GPUs based on availability. **Any success stories from other geos that help to address the above points?** Techxchange/Sales would have more stories to share >> Alex Gorman or Luv Aggarwal. **Providing more commercial GPU support** This is in planning. AMD MI210 and AMD MI250. No dates to share at this moment. we also have dependency on RH to fulfil this delivery. **Sharing memory across multple GPUs** Not in roadmap. will evaluate. Felicia-Eng1: Hi @vijesh-bhaktha thanks for your response. Do you have any suggestions on how to address the customer objections below and in the original post? > @cir - part of the issue with deciding which foundation models to install include the following: > > 1. When in development, a customer may want to test a variety of models. Loading all of the desired models for testing is impractical. > > 2. Though this can be partially solved by leveraging SaaS, this is not always possible for the level of testing the customer would want to do, e.g. if customer has data sovereignty concerns and want to test with real data, they may not be able to use SaaS. > > 3. This leaves us open to competition. Customers would solve this issue by doing their development via Notebooks or other open-source tools to run only on-demand on GPUs rather than typing them up 24/7. The customer then questions why they need to pay so much for watsonx licenses and would argue there is no value-add of the platform for their key requirements. > > 4. Eventually customers would want to leverage the platform for multiple use cases and multiple tenants in order to scale and improve ROI of the platform. The appropriate model for each use case may differ, in which case, multiple models would need to be loaded in and again, the consumption of GPUs 24/7 makes this an impractically large cost for many customers. With regards to the choice of GPUs: > Can more powerful GPUs be made accessible via SaaS? > > We do not offer the ability for customers to choose their GPU type or environment on SaaS. But internally we will plan to upgrade type of GPUs based on availability. I understand that the choice of GPUs are hidden for accessing our foundation models, however my question related to choice of environment available via Notebooks (see screenshot below). ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/351684/files/3460801d-eeb2-423e-a50a-756607343e09) At the moment, only a maximum of 2 x V100s are available. This restriction means if customers want to work with Notebooks on SaaS to work with models that are not natively available on watsonx, they are not able to work with models that require GPUs that are more powerful than V100s (which are most models these days that my customers want to work with). I spoke with Suraksha Vidyarthi, Product Manager for IaaS for IBM Cloud previously on this topic. I can't tag her here, but if we can somehow include her in this conversation that would be great, as I know she was surprised by this limitation and was working on getting more powerful GPUs available on SaaS Notebooks. Many thanks for all your help! jbtang: My 2 cents: wx.ai needs to find a way to differentiate us from competitors. Enabling CPU for smaller/quantised model is one way to go and should be easy to implement. There are some use cases that won't care about latency too much, for example, replying to routine emails from knowledge. Also if you check ollama's performance on CPU only environment, it is not too bad. jbtang: Currently, I can install wx.ai on CPU only env, and also loaded model. But just can't deploy to WML because WML only accept GPU env. TALS: @Felicia-Eng1 - Have you open RFE (Aha idea) for that? If not please do jbtang: I have created one related: [Support LLM in CPU only env](https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-160) TALS: @jbtang - Thank you @Felicia-Eng1 - please open one for - wx.ai consumption of GPUs is too costly on hyperscalers (24/7 - Compute consumption) Felicia-Eng1: Created @TALS . 1. Reduce GPU consumption - https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-163 2. More powerful GPUs for Notebooks on SaaS - https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/CPDIDEAS-I-2305 Please spread the word for us. Thank you! cir: @Felicia-Eng1 Promoted to candidate for Product Scout. Felicia-Eng1: @cir @TALS - slightly different IDEA but loosely related. Including here for tracking. This has to do with a request for a dashboard to view and track GPU usage. https://ibm-data-and-ai.ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-119 TALS: H100 was added to MZR - https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/news/october-2024/nvidia-h100-ibmcloud-ga GPU watsonx usage - https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCqJfVRq8VcCTGhQg6C2FQccTGqB TALS: MIG functionality had been added to watsonx in CP4D 5.0.3 - included in watsonx.ai | 9.3.0 - https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/5.0.x?topic=overview-whats-new#whats-new__refresh-3 Felicia-Eng1: > H100 was added to MZR - https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/news/october-2024/nvidia-h100-ibmcloud-ga GPU watsonx usage - https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCqJfVRq8VcCTGhQg6C2FQccTGqB @TALS this is a good start with H100s now available, but this is only on IBM Cloud infrastructure. They are still not available for watsonx SaaS. Customers can consume these directly as IBM Cloud credits, but this will not register as watsonx revenue or deployments. The request for more powerful GPUs than the 2 x V100s to be made available on Notebooks in watsonx SaaS has been marked for "future consideration". https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/CPDIDEAS-I-2305 TALS: As soon as the Sydney watsonx region will be open (In a matter of short weeks) it will be available on the H100 too cir: @Felicia-Eng1 @jbtang There are numerous ideas been added to this one request. Which ones do you need to still get consideration ? and what is the revenue impact and clients impacted? cir: https://ideas.ibm.com/issue-tracker/data-and-ai/wai#WAI-I-160. I under consideration for 1H25 cir: https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-163 We need more revenue or client list of impacted clients etc. cir: https://ideas.ibm.com/issue-tracker/data-and-ai/wai#CPDIDEAS-I-2305 Predicated on GPU support roadmap. Revenue and Client Impact data would help. cir: https://ideas.ibm.com/search?query=WAI-I-119 We need impact data Felicia-Eng1: > @Felicia-Eng1 @jbtang There are numerous ideas been added to this one request. Which ones do you need to still get consideration ? and what is the revenue impact and clients impacted? Thanks for following up @cir . So for enabling SLM in CPU-only environment - https://ideas.ibm.com/issue-tracker/data-and-ai/wai#WAI-I-160, I'll let @jbtang add further comments. But what I know is the following from the federal government space. **ATO:** - ATO are struggling to get enough GPUs, so enabling them to use CPU-only environments for their smaller models or models they can quantize will give them more use cases to justify the use of the platform. - At this stage, ATO are using opensource solutions for their large models that are not native to watsonx that cannot run on Notebooks because they need more than 2 x V100s (https://ideas.ibm.com/issue-tracker/data-and-ai/wai#CPDIDEAS-I-2305) to run the models. - They are also using opensource for their smaller models that do not require GPUs because it is cheaper to run on their existing CPU environments than the CUH cost for running a Notebook GPU environment via watsonx. - ATO have spent approximately $2M AUD over two years on IBM Cloud and watsonx SaaS credits. If they do not find it worthwhile to continue with watsonx because opensource provides them with more flexibility and is more cost effective, then we may lose this business. - Additionally, we are attempting to position watsonx as the primary data science platform at the ATO. Currently it is AWS. The only reason why they reached out to IBM is due to a shortage of GPUs from AWS. So we need to give them a strong and compelling reason to change by supporting all the gaps of their use cases. **For Defence:** - They are looking to deploy wx.ai Perpetual licenses on AWS ROSA. - But the cost of running the GPUs on AWS required to host the number of foundation models for wx.ai is so costly that it is preventative for them to go forward at this stage - https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-163. - Reducing the FM footprint or being able to load and unload easier or allow smaller models to run on CPU would all be possible solutions to make this feasible for Defence. - wx.ai has not been sold yet. The commercials are still being worked out. But this deal has been delayed since Q2 2024 due to the commercials being complex, with one of the reasons being the on-going operating costs. - I don't know the exact revenue implications here, but it is in the order of millions. **ANZ Bank:** - @jbtang please add your comments here, including how much you think this opportunity is worth. - Essentially GPUs are too costly for what ANZ would like to achieve right now, which they can do using small models that can run on CPU. - By not allowing small models to run on CPUs means that ANZ are choosing to go with opensource solutions. - Once embedded, the opensource solutions are difficult to displace. In general, many customers are asking us what our product differentiation is relative to Bedrock, OpenAI and Vertex AI. So far, none of our stated differentiators have been resonating: - Governance - still an afterthought until there is legislation in Australia compelling organisations to comply. - BYOM - not available on SaaS in Australia, too expensive to run as Software on cloud consuming too many GPUs, don't have own GPUs and cannot acquire. - IBM People - CE, CSM, Expert Labs - this is currently our biggest drawcard, but we have to get in the door first to demonstrate our value and expertise. Keeping this as a live document with updates of the above to keep track - https://ibm.box.com/s/7rx2y7j8oitx7zgnsgg6lmhbm0t1y8hb (updated this link as previous version was incorrect as of Dec 5).

Title: JAPAN Question - On-premise Evaluation/Free-Trial Plans
Comments: Wolf-Bocanett: I think there is huge interest also beyond Japan and it would be a great entry point for prospective customers to try out IBM's GenAI. This will also support delivering enablements and training both internally and externally which has been a common pain especially with the resource scarcity of wx (especially wx.orchestrate which is barely available even to sales). In addition, provided that wx.ai, wx.gov and wx.orchestrate can be deployed separately, customers can progressively start evaluating each offering and the scale up and/or combine offerings and paid delivery as needed. Achala-Amarasinghe: Agreed. Just confirmed offline that the watsonx.ai, .data, .orchestrate and .governance solutions are already available in the software evaluation program (https://ibm.biz/software-evaluations), hence the application request can be made based on customer needs. Hence, I'll close this ticket.

Title: watsonx.gov - accessability requirements
Comments: TALS: @avarshn avarshn: @TALS @sakapur please see the last slide in watsonx roadmap summary on Seismic here - https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCMmpHHmJchDq8qW3dM9TX8qjW9d. OpenPages, OpenScale & FactSheets as part of watsonx.governance comply with WCAG 2.0 today. sakapur: Thanks, @avarshn , Can we get it documented in .gov documentation ? avarshn: @sakapur does this help? https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/saas?topic=administration-accessibility. sakapur: @avarshn , As I read this url, it sounds like accessibility for product documentation which is great ! Could we add something similar for product watsonx.gov something like following : "IBM watsonx.gov uses the latest W3C Standard, [WAI-ARIA 1.0](https://www.ibm.com/links?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2FTR%2Fwai-aria%2F) to ensure compliance with the [United States Access Board Section 508 Standards](https://www.ibm.com/links?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.access-board.gov%2Fict%2F), and the[ Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0](https://www.ibm.com/links?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2FTR%2FWCAG20%2F). " I just replaced "IBM watsonx documentation" by "IBM watsonx.gov " , the statement after that can be changed as it is applicable for watsonx.gov product . Thanks avarshn: @sakapur I was really looking at WCAG 2.0 per your original comment. I will need to check with the team if watsonx.gov complies with the other standards mentioned in your last comment and how they overlap with WCAG 2.0. You will notice that in the product documentation link that I shared, it not only mentiones about accessibility for product documentation but also the watsonx user interface and TTY service which are part of WCAG 2.0 checklist. sakapur: @avarshn , Yes, I understand but it doesn't say clearly that watsonx.gov UI follows <> accessibility standards . What will help is if we can update our documentation with watsonx.gov is compliant to following accessibility standards . Typically, the enterprise IT departments doesn't try to interpret the language. They look for standards we are compliant before deploying the product so rather then saying in documentation _"The IBM watsonx web user interfaces rely on cascading stylesheets to render content properly and to provide a usable experience. If you are a low-vision user, you can adjust your operating system display settings, and use settings such as high contrast mode. You can control font size by using the device or web browser settings."_ . We should say what standards our product UI is tested and compliant . The IT departments want to know which accessibility standards are met. The best place is to put it as part of watsonx.gov document. sakapur: @avarshn , Here is the checklist of https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/WD-WCAG20-20060427/appendixB.html (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0 Checklist) . It is not very clear from the url you referred me if all these requirements are met for watsonx.gov . If they are met/ tested, please update in documentation that watsonx.gov is Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0 compliant avarshn: @ingeh @Snehal-Gawas would you be able to take at this request please and comment back on watsonx.gov compliance with WCAG 2.0 (do we fully comply?) and if we can make the documentation clearer to reflect that. Thanks! Snehal-Gawas: @avarshn discussed this with product team (RM-@ervinj, PM-@neil-leblanc1, Dev-@makatari) watsonx.gov product UI doesn't support WCAG 2.0 requirements. These requirements are supported for only .gov product documentation. Here is a link to the ACS record for your reference - https://able.ibm.com/acs/record/984c04ee-0e5a-440f-bf7e-1bf0ad55d294/dashboard Please open a new aha idea for this ask. sakapur: Thanks, @Snehal-Gawas for confirmation. I am glad I did not communicate it to customer based on comments from @avarshn that WCAG 2.0 is supported . This ask is for "watsonx.gov" WCAG 2.0 / 2.1 compliance . I am not sure why another Aha idea is needed . This Aha idea is ask for WCAG 2.0 / 2.1 support on watsonx.gov . Please use this Aha idea . Thanks avarshn: @Snehal-Gawas thanks for replying - then we need to have that clarified in both our documentation page (@ingeh could you help with this please) as well as the roadmap deck (I will connect with Mayank). Neil-Leblanc1: The documentation at this link says watsonx documentation is compliant and only some parts of the UI - https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/saas?topic=administration-accessibility But I agree that the roadmap is misleading  cir: @sakapur Can you reference the existing Aha idea for this please? So we can track here. sakapur: @cir , I didn't realize that we need to have github as well as Aha for any issue. That is bunch of duplicate work . Anyway, I opened the Aha at https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WGOV-I-49 , thanks sakapur: @cir , Not sure why this issue is closed ? Could you please add additional closing comments ? I can see the see is closed because 1) No plans to fix it --> Please add details on why 2) Issue is fixed --> Please add additional details on fixes and where I can find details Thanks sakapur: @cir , Please confirm if the issue is fixed ? thanks

Title: ServiceNow - Guardrail Requirements
Comments: cir: @Snehal-Gawas @vijesh-bhaktha Can you review this please, what are the next steps? ServiceNow and Salesforce are 2 large embed deals in 1Q and 2Q. They do not use watsonx.ai inference stack. However, they think that the AI Guardrails as an independent feature is differentiating for them to integrate into their stack. ServiceNow is experimenting with wx.gov APIs for HAP scores but it is not designed for real-time use in production deployment, though it may be using the same model as in the AI Guardrails in wx.ai. Salesforce specifically identified prompt injection defense (and not just HAP/PII filtering) in pre-sales as the key capability they require. It was demonstrated as something in the works and committed. In fact, API availability for any feature / component in the product was promised to be delivered in a week by sales executives. Both these partners are now in deployment phase and this capability is a key blocker. Here's the suggestion -- (a) Provide Guardrails as it exists now (v1 in wx.ai) as an independent API enabled component so that these partners can start integration design and testing. (b) Provide a pre-GA version of the Guardrails 2.0 with enhanced capabilities as they become stable enough to experiment. In fact, a pre-GA version for the Ecosystem team to internally deploy and test with partner data is a good option before sharing with partner. The time frame is to start something hands-on in matter of days/week and make incremental progress till release date to stay engaged. vijesh-bhaktha: The question is should this be packaged along with .governance APIs. so that a customer would be entitled to use it even without purchasing watsonx.ai in addition to watsonx.governance. Technically the AI guardrails come from the .ai team and with .gov adding some classification requirements on top of it. should ideally be evaluated by .gov PM @Snehal-Gawas. sakapur: We should be looking at right go to market strategy to package it and make exceptions for customers who have already bought .gov in anticipation of this feature. We really need some update on when the product will be available and features so we can keep customer engaged Snehal-Gawas: @Upasana-Bhattacharya1 - can you please add comments on upcoming plans for Guardrail? TALS: @vijesh-bhaktha to check with @Upasana-Bhattacharya1 Upasana-Bhattacharya1: Thank you @Snehal-Gawas was looping me in. The CSMs are already looped in as is Anindya Neogi who submitted Aha ideas for these. We met ServiceNow already and have an agreed upon testing approach in the interim. We have a dependency on IBM Research team and also watsonx.ai to deliver the detectors and have worked with them very closely to get this prioritized. Anindya-Neogi2: @Upasana-Bhattacharya1 we can focus first on the existing guardrail capabilities with the current model and deliver an API. It is Salesforce (not ServiceNow) that needs new capabilities from Guardrails, e.g. prompt injection defense, along with the API to access. That can be the next upgrade which involves Research. eleniaa: This is blocking ServiceNow and will block Salesforce as well (Salesforce has additional requirements above this request). This is about packaging up guardrails functionality that is currently available to be run outside of watsonx. This does not require IBM Research. We expect **product** owns and is driving what is required to deliver this functionality. Without an ETA we are losing ServiceNow's interest in the primary (and possibly only) gap watsonx addresses. @lkscott @mmp @rohernan @sakapur Upasana-Bhattacharya1: > @Upasana-Bhattacharya1 we can focus first on the existing guardrail capabilities with the current model and deliver an API. Hope that does not have a Research dependency on a new model, unless this componentization and API creation task also needs the Research team. It is Salesforce (not ServiceNow) that needs new capabilities from Guardrails, e.g. prompt injection defense, along with the API to access. That can be the next upgrade which involves Research. Anindya - Totally appreciate and share the sense of urgency. Just so everyone is on the same page / has a shared understanding of the dependencies to deliver, sharing some more context at this point in time: The Guardrail framework refers to detector models **and** the back-end orchestrator - **both** are owned by IBM Research. For added clarity, IBM Research doesn't just deliver the Dectectors, they also deliver key parts of the orchestrator i.e. APIs. Today, Guardrails only exists only within watsonx.ai and not as a stand-alone capability. This means in the current Guardrails orchestrator, what is delivered is detector model is **coupled** with the inferencing in watsonx.ai - which makes sense if you're only using LLMs in watsonx.ai but not if you want just detectors on some other platform without watsonx.ai. The ask that was provided recently to watsonx.ai was to provide ServiceNow just the detector models without watsonx.ai or filtering - just detector. For the reason stated above, it **does** require technical changes to existing Guardrails functionality to de-couple detector from inferencing --> this technical work is owned by IBM Research. This applies irrespective of whether its the existing detector models like HAP and PII or additional / different detector models. This is why there is technical work involved in IBM Research - _even with existing detector models like HAP and PII in watsonx.ai_. Contrary to the statement [here](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/issues/168#issuecomment-88027719), at this point in time, **this **isn't** just a packaging or licensing exercise** watsonx.governance has been working closely with IBM Res. Guardrails orchestrator team and they are very well aware of the priority and urgency of - including awareness ServiceNow ask and they are also aware of potential $ value. There is also technical work to decouple _installation_ of Guardrails and watsonx.ai to the extent needed -- _this part is_ owned by product (not Research) and we are working with watsonx.ai team in parallel for this but we can't deliver installation of something that isn't there yet. From the product side, watsonx.governance has and will continue to engage with ServiceNow. We also showed them a high-level roadmap and brought in the IBM Res. team working on the detectors to also supply detailed information. Title: Request for Information: Fine-Tuning, Multi-Modal Support, and SDK Methods in Watsonx.ai
Comments: cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Hello can you research this please. vijesh-bhaktha: 1. Yes, fine-tuned models can be imported via BYOM on-premise. Deployable custom models must meet these requirements: ([Documentation](Deployable custom models must meet these requirements: The file list for the model must contain a config.json file. See [Planning to deploy a custom foundation model](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSQNUZ_5.0.x/wsj/analyze-data/deploy-custom-fm-plan.html) for steps on how to check for the file. The model must be compatible with the Text Generation Inference (TGI) standard and be built with a [supported model architecture type](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSQNUZ_5.0.x/wsj/analyze-data/deploy-custom-fm-specs.html). The model type is listed in the config.json file for the model. The model must be in a safetensors format and include a tokenizer for authentication. If the model is otherwise compatible, a conversion utility provides these requirements as part of the process for [preparing to upload the model](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSQNUZ_5.0.x/wsj/analyze-data/deploy-custom-fm-prepare.html). Note these restrictions for using custom foundation models after they are deployed and registered with watsonx.ai: You cannot tune a custom foundation model. You cannot use watsonx.governance to evaluate or track a prompt template for a custom foundation model.)) The file list for the model must contain a config.json file. See [Planning to deploy a custom foundation model](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSQNUZ_5.0.x/wsj/analyze-data/deploy-custom-fm-plan.html) for steps on how to check for the file. The model must be compatible with the Text Generation Inference (TGI) standard and be built with a [supported model architecture type](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSQNUZ_5.0.x/wsj/analyze-data/deploy-custom-fm-specs.html). The model type is listed in the config.json file for the model. The model must be in a safetensors format and include a tokenizer for authentication. If the model is otherwise compatible, a conversion utility provides these requirements as part of the process for [preparing to upload the model](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSQNUZ_5.0.x/wsj/analyze-data/deploy-custom-fm-prepare.html). Note these restrictions for using custom foundation models after they are deployed and registered with watsonx.ai: You cannot tune a custom foundation model. You cannot use watsonx.governance to evaluate or track a prompt template for a custom foundation model. Hardware Requirements: NVIDIA A100 or H100 GPUs only. [Documentation](The standard supported hardware configuration to deploy custom foundation models in Cloud Pak for Data is Nvidia A100 or Nvidia H100 with 80 GB of GPU memory. If your GPU configuration is different (for example Nvidia H100 with 40 GB of GPU memory), you must create a custom hardware specification. For details, see [Creating custom hardware specifications](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSQNUZ_5.0.x/wsj/analyze-data/deploy-custom-fm-custom-hw.html).) 2. No,Multi-modal is not supported today. We have it in the roadmap for Text to Image - planned for Q3 (at risk now). Gwangsu-Kim: Thanks for reply @vijesh-bhaktha, want to know more detail based on your answer Regarding the statement "You cannot tune a custom foundation model," does this also mean that prompt tuning available in watsonx.ai is not possible for these custom models? It states that only NVIDIA A100 or H100 GPUs are supported. What about L40S GPUs? I have heard through other channels that L40S will be supported for custom models in Watsonx.ai version 2.0.1. Is this correct? I understand that multi-modal support is not available currently. Is it still unlikely to be available by Q3? And even if it is released, will it only support Text to Image and not Image to Text? and please answer me above question #3 as well vijesh-bhaktha: Hi @Gwangsu-Kim - The following are the only models available for prompt tuning from the Tuning Studio in watsonx.ai: flan-t5-xl-3b granite-13b-instruct-v2 llama-2-13b-chat and customer models currently cannot be prompt tuned. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/w-and-w/2.0.x?topic=studio-choosing-model-tune ---- What I mentioned above is the standard specification. For non standard hardware you will have to create custom hardware specifications: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/w-and-w/2.0.x?topic=model-creating-custom-hardware-specifications But let me get back to you specifically on the L40S support for custom models. --- For multimodal, since there are some dependencies from other teams I cannot comment on the exact timeline. Currently it seems to be at risk for Q3. It may slip to Q4 or 2025. --- For qn 3 Full Fine tuning first release will go with CPD 5.0.3. Fine tuning using Tuning Studio (Prompt Tuning) uses the PEFT method. We do not have LoRA or IA3 method in the roadmap now. Gwangsu-Kim: Hi @vijesh-bhaktha, Oh right! I got so caught up with tuning that I forgot for a moment. I would appreciate it if you could let me know about the remaining details as soon as possible. Gwangsu-Kim: Hi @vijesh-bhaktha, To clarify your answer, were below two lines talking about each separately? ``` Full Fine tuning first release will go with CPD 5.0.3 Fine tuning using Tuning Studio (Prompt Tuning) uses the PEFT method. ``` When can we expect CPD 5.0.3 to be released? and which models can be supported for full fine tuning? LoRA or IA3 are commonly used tuning methods, so why are they not included in the roadmap? What methods are being introduced for fine-tuning then? vijesh-bhaktha: 1. Prompt Tuning (current Tuning Studio) uses PEFT method. 2. We will be using SFTTrainer (Supervised Fine Tuning) in RHOAI for fine tuning. 3. CPD 5.0.3 is targeted for 25 Sept 2024. 4. Models to be supported for full fine tuning: I will not be able to comment on this at this moment, as there are multiple POCs being pursued for this. We do have a priority list to tackle which will include granite, mixtral and llama models (base). 5. We have dependency on IBM Research on LoRA and IA3.All we know is that they are working on it and we don't have any timelines as when it will be ready to be productised into watsonx.ai. cir: @Gwangsu-Kim Okay to close this item?

Title: Watsonx.ai - RH OpenShift AI entitlement
Comments: kshabalin: Watsonx.ai includes OpenShift AI starting with version 2.0, the [LI docs](https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/?id=L-NYXD-ABGNBT&lc=en) clearly state that: "Red Hat OpenShift AI (bundled with watsonx.ai programs other than Reserved without Red Hat OpenShift AI) The Program and the above Red Hat Product are part of the Program, as a whole. For purposes of measuring usage of the Program, and determining the number of Red Hat Software Subscription entitlements, each Core of the above Red Hat Product will be equivalent to one VPC of the Program. In clusters running only IBM Programs, IBM's required entitlement terms prevail over any term in the Red Hat Enterprise Agreement for determining the number of units required of Red Hat product." Please note that a client has to install watsonx.ai v2.0 to be entitled to OpenShift AI in a given cluster. A wx.ai 1.0 or 1.1 installation is bound to those versions of LI Terms and is not entitled to OpenShift AI until being upgraded to wx.ai 2.0. I have checked the part numbers you provided above, and these are the correct and most current part numbers for wx.ai. Please reach out if you have additional questions. Thank you. COOPERL: Thanks for clarifying, that's great! LDesrosi: Thanks, @kshabalin. However, looking at the perpetual P/N that Louise listed, they seem to fall under the program [5900-AYS](https://www.ibm.com/about/software-licensing/us-en/product_search?search=5900-AYS&type=ALL). Looking at this [LI document](https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/?id=L-NYXD-ABGNBT&lc=en), it does not seem like program 5900-AYS includes RHOAI. Can you confirm? Am I missing something? cir: @LDesrosi Are you referring to this section: Red Hat OpenShift AI (bundled with watsonx.ai programs other than Reserved without Red Hat OpenShift AI) - The Program and the above Red Hat Product are part of the Program, as a whole. For purposes of measuring usage of the Program, and determining the number of Red Hat Software Subscription entitlements, each Core of the above Red Hat Product will be equivalent to one VPC of the Program. In clusters running only IBM Programs, IBM's required entitlement terms prevail over any term in the Red Hat Enterprise Agreement for determining the number of units required of Red Hat product. No Red Hat Products are provided with watsonx.ai Reserved without Red Hat OpenShift AI. Licensee must acquire sufficient watsonx.ai entitlements to cover each Core of Red Hat OpenShift AI made available to the Program. LDesrosi: @cir Yes it was partly that section but also Louise pointed out that there are additional 5900-AYS entries at the bottom of the list which includes RHOAI. Not sure why, but I had missed those. I'm clear now. Thank you. LDesrosi: One last question, which is related but on a different topic. Reading this post: https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/ibmsaleszone/sales-news/all-sales-blogs/f062a050-0886-11ef-8344-dbc484c79139 I understand that Red Hat sellers will be compensated on sales of watsonx that includes RHOAI. If the client drawdown their ELA, do we know if the Red Hat team will still be compensated? cir: @LDesrosi Yes, the RH team is compensated. LDesrosi: Thank you @cir. That's a really good news. I don't have further questions.
