Title: CPD 5.0 license compliance with mixed workloads without node pinning
Labels: Americas, EMEA, APAC, watsonx.ai, watsonx.data, Pricing/Licensing, watsonx.gov, TEL
Comments: Kathleen-Hosang: +1- with node pinning, the client's option is to potentially overpay in watsonx VPCs (as some CPD workloads will be measured as watsonx workloads without node pinning) or potentially overpay in infra due to node pinning. Node pinning does not support HA and is not an option where that is a requirement. Could a reasonable solution be to simply split the shared watsonx and cpd workloads by the percentage of CPD v watsonx VPCs a client deploys? For example, a client who has deployed 50 VPCs of watsonx (incl .ai) and 450 VPCs of CPD (incl WML, WS) into the same namespace, their WML and WS workloads would be billed at 10% watsonx rate and 90% CPD rate, rather than 100% watsonx rate which is the case without node pinning. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha @mogle @Snehal-Gawas Can you review from the watsonx perspective on Node Pinning? kshabalin: As Sachin explained Node Pinning on one of DAI/watsonx call, the reaction was unanimous that Node Pinning is contrary to OCP principles and compute resources overhead is not reasonable. Sachin then followed to explain that: - Node Pinning is a quickfix for 5.0 - Node Pinning is not required, and clients are 100% free not to use it. - [Applying your entitlements without node pinning](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/5.0.x?topic=entitlements-applying-your-without-node-pinning) should be enough to help with licensing compliance, but even that is not required. - There is a plan to address the issue in later releases and come up with a better solution to licensing compliance. - Our current licensing of CP4D Cartridges and CP4D Base running together have many of the same licensing implications when running in the one namespace, and our current process is to sort things out during audit. If clients use Node Pinning or not, apply entitlements or not, the audit process is still the fallback that is already in place. What steps are being taken: - As part of issue [Co-existance fo watsonx and Cloud Pak for Data in the same OpenShift Project (All Geos) #2](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/issues/2), a Technical Note is going to be created detailing CP4D and watsonx coexistence licensing implications and guidelines. What other steps can be taken to remediate: - PM can detail their recommendation of using Node Pinning to specific use cases or services, not just as an overall recommendation. Or, the recommendation can have a clause to AskIBM, for example: "Before choosing to use Node Pinning, ask your IBM representative if Node Pinning is right for your specific case." - Field can work with PM on a solution to licensing compliance and on a roadmap to remediate. kshabalin: @Kathleen-Hosang please ping me to discuss your split solution and how it can or can't be addressed. Andrew-Buckler: Nobody is forcing clients to implement pinning. It's an optional way to optimize their license counts, with the trade-off of reduced flexibility. Off the top, there are a couple of relevant cases for wx in which customers either frequently want or need to have dedicated nodes: .ai: if you're paying through the nose for NVDA gear, you want to run those chips as hot as possible. Pinning lets you set aside the GPU-enabled nodes solely for GenAI workloads. .data: really doesn't like sharing space with other workloads in production so we recommend dedicated (just like Db2WH). Even then, you're free to leave them collocated if you're OK with the performance downsides and don't care about potentially underutilizing your GPUs. The specific issue that pinning avoids is related to [Container Licensing terms](https://www.ibm.com/software/passportadvantage/containerlicenses.html) being based on cpu.limit settings, and in some cases our cpu.limit settings being very high relative to average usage (CCS in particular has this issue). Container SW's licensing can end up capped by the HW capacity of the cluster, so when you add more HW for other use cases you are required to buy more licenses for the SW currently on the cluster. That might sound abstract, but you can see the effect easily in the Sales Configurator by starting with an IKC instance (small + say medium CCS) and then adding wx.ai Foundation Model Base -- the CP4D EE entitlement requirement will go up when you add FM Base even though IKC doesn't use it. Pinning is an optional way of avoiding that side effect, since if the pods are pinned then their HW cap is calculated based on the nodes on which they're pinned to.

Comments: cir: @Maryam-Ashoori @sawyerst @vijesh-bhaktha @mromila Who can address this? mromila: We need IBM Research to help with this one. [sbagot@ca.ibm.com](mailto:sbagot@ca.ibm.com) Stephanie, can you please help? cir: @mromila Thank you, Stephanie appears to be be out of office today. I have pinged her on slack. mromila: yes, I am trying to find someone in her team. TALS: Have you tried Kate Soule? cir: @siyuan-zhang-ibm With the US Holiday this week we are reaching out to Kate and Stephanie and Monica will update this issue once we get some resources to look at this. ling-wong-ibm: @siyuan-zhang-ibm , the example you gave for Yashushi Mori of Mitsubishi on the spreadsheet, the phone number is for the corporate offices in Japan and the email is for Mitsubishi Investor Relations which are both generally available, were there other items of information that are PII for Mr. Mori that you are seeing? pvanrun: @siyuan-zhang-ibm Was PII filtering turned on in this test? If not, then can you please test with it turned on and let us know if the email and phone number are correctly filtered out from the answer? Gaurav-Kumbhat: Just to confirm, is the PII generated by the model in Japanese or English ? mromila: For English, with HAP/PII on the email is recognized as PII and not displayed: ``` "input": "Please repeat the words in [], do not trim space.\\n[John has the following email john.doe@email.com.]" 2024-07-05 11: 04: 50, 025 [main ] INFO HTTP Response: : status code=200, endpointName=PostGenerationText, Content type=application/json, Response body: { "model_id": "ibm/granite-8b-japanese", "model_version": "1.1.0", "created_at": "2024-07-05T15:04:50.157Z", "results": [ { "generated_text": "\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n", "generated_token_count": 20, "input_token_count": 28, "stop_reason": "max_tokens" } ], "system": { "warnings": [ { "message": "The value of 'parameters.max_new_tokens' for this model was set to value 20", "id": "limit_verification", "additional_properties": { "limit": 0, "parameter": "parameters.max_new_tokens", "value": 0 } } ] } } ``` pvanrun: @siyuan-zhang-ibm Where does the **auto_post_edit** column come from? The spreadsheet looks like a summary from a QA run. Can we get the actual input/output for this test case please? Kate-Soule: Thank you for flagging. From above comments, it does not appear that the model is providing actual PII (which would indeed be a red flag issue). Instead, the model appears to be providing well documented, public contact information (investor relations email address and public phone number) for the general company, which is not personal nor identifiable. So that we can determine if and what remediation is needed, can someone please provide: 1. The exact input/prompt into the model, including parameter settings (e.g. greedy decoding, etc) 2. Clarification on what personal and identifiable information was provided by the model 3. Clarification on whether this pattern has been able to be recreated for any other example / person siyuan-zhang-ibm: @pvanrun Thank you so much for the information. Client did not have PII filtering turned on in this test. I want to recommend clients to turn on this PII filtering, but out client is using litellm as the model library (they want to keep the same codes to call other LLM). Is PII filtering avaible is this case? siyuan-zhang-ibm: Hi, also an urgent report for a bug for granite 8b Japanese Instruct model on [watxonx.ai](http://watxonx.ai/). Starting from 7/5 (FRI), the response of the model has been either empty (as in white space) or random gibberish. Our client also cannot continue their test with Granite-8b-Japanese model. Could you support us ASAP? These were not the case before with the same parameters, prompt, and model and watsonx ai python-sdk. Has there been any changes to this model in particular? https://ibm-cloud.slack.com/archives/C05FWDB9RSA/p1720062003086129 cir: @siyuan-zhang-ibm Please create a sep issue for the above. siyuan-zhang-ibm: Thank you so much. update for this issue: - bug for granite 8b Japanese Instruct model has been fixed yesterday. - I have explained to the clients that the generated response is generally available, not PII information. - As a result, I will close the ticket and continue investigate how to prevent Granite 8B Japanese from generating unwanted information.

Title: Watsonx.ai architecture with NVIDIA Inference Microservices (NIM)
Comments: cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Can you review the above request? Kathleen-Hosang: Since OpenShift AI now integrates with NVIDIA NIM, we're wondering if there is a roadmap item to get this supported on watsonx.ai. And if not, is there some kind of orchestration layer we could add to the cluster to enable NIM integration with watsonx.ai. My understanding is that the inferencing pods cannot currently run on virtualized (software or hardware level) GPUs . Thank you! kshabalin: Ok, this is interesting. NVIDIA Enterprise AI and NIM are competitors to watsonx.ai and partially to OpenShift AI, see [watsonx.ai competitive on Seismic](https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCM9h4qhBCmX2GHWWPVf6DWQj68j). watsonx.ai currently deploys models for inferencing on caikit+TGIS, which are now part of OpenShift AI, see [an architecture diagram here](https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/fine-tuning-and-serving-open-source-foundation-model-red-hat-openshift-ai). KServe inside OpenShift AI could route to caikit+TGIS, NIM (announced, not GA) and other inference frameworks like vLLM. We should ask PM if watsonx.ai is going to support inferencing on NIM (Triton and vLLM microservices wrapper from NVIDIA), vLLM or other inference options of OpenShift AI. Ryan-Mongenel: @kshabalin - I think we should continue to ask about: "We should ask PM if watsonx.ai is going to support inferencing on NIM (Triton and vLLM microservices wrapper from NVIDIA), vLLM or other inference options of OpenShift AI." However, after talking with the ATL on the account, the clients request is to access watsonx.ai via an API interface LIKE NVIDIA NIM offering. They do not want to work within our UI and open up watsonx.ai to their developers via an API interface only. We are investigating this further but I think this would be a different submission for enhancements based on further investigation. kshabalin: @Ryan-Mongenel Thinking of possible scenarios, 1) Do you want to deploy Granite models from watsonx.ai on NIM's internal Triton/vLLM inferencing engine? 2) watsonx.ai has it's own API interface + a LangChain interface. There is no need for developers to use watsonx.ai UI, developers can just use the APIs. In such scenario, only admins would use watsonx.ai to deploy/undeploy models and to handle access rights. 3) Or maybe you want NIM APIs to seamlessly call watsonx.ai API as an overlay? cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Any thoughts on this thread? vijesh-bhaktha: @cir - watsonx.ai does not support NIM right now and is not currently on the roadmap. If we want to support NIM we need to prioritize it on the product roadmap. It has to be investigated, enabled, tested and released just like any other feature. The fact that RHOAI supports it as a runtime will make it easier to adopt. Can you please create an RFE with impact analysis. I will have it evaluated by the right PM. cir: @Ryan-Mongenel I would suggest creating an idea at ideas.ibm.com, please reference it here and we can investigate whether it can be a candidate for the Product Scout program. Ensure to document impact (clients and revenue). Ryan-Mongenel: Hey Team, we are waiting on more information from the client on this. I will circle back once we have some additional details and include the Idea. I believe the ask was to provide a NIM like experience with watsonx.ai. The client basically doesn't want to use our UI and just want to open up watsonx.ai via an API interface to their developers. We are trying to validate if our current API support will meet their demands but they really like the nvidia solution and it's working well for them. cir: @Ryan-Mongenel Any information from the client on this? cir: @Ryan-Mongenel Ryan-Mongenel: We are setting up a call to discuss the Watsonx Lightweight solution that recently came out to see if this hits the mark. Give us a few more weeks on this to confirm requirements. TALS: @Ryan-Mongenel - please open an Aha RFE armand-ruiz: we are working with Nvidia to expose the .ai NIM integration in OpenShift and have a joint GTM Ryan-Mongenel: Thanks @armand-ruiz . As we learn more from the client we will keep you posted. Bank of America seems to be working with this service today extensively but not using our .ai yet. Trent-Gray-Donald: Please let us know ASAP - this ask is now on the "visibility up to the GMs" list - but there's no actual ask here yet, which makes it hard to action. wx.ai and NIM both provide REST APIs - NIM doesn't do routing, but wx.ai does, so there's a bit of a mismatch here. If there's a need for an architect in the product to talk more directly with the customer, please let us know. Ryan-Mongenel: Will do but today it's not a solid requirement from the client since they are not convinced of our .ai platform. We are still too early to role this up as a solid requirement from this client especially since they haven't purchased .ai yet.

Title: watsonx.governance - metrics language support
Comments: cir: @Snehal-Gawas Can you review and provide any perspective to this? Snehal-Gawas: Here are details related to available metrics in watsonx.governance - [Documentation](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/model/wos-monitors-overview.html?context=wx&audience=wdp#configuring-model-evaluations-with-watsonxgovernance) @Siddhi-Gowaikar Can you please comment on the language support for these metrics (language agnostic vs English language only)? Siddhi-Gowaikar: hi team, for LLMs, 'Model Health' and metrics for 'meta data' (eg meta data drift) are language agnostic. Others are specific to each language. Today, only English is supported officially, and we are working on supporting additional languages for some metrics soon. Thanks! Sara-Elo-Dean1: Thank you for the information. And when you do release additional languages please always indicate in release notes/presentations specifically which languages are supported, instead of using "multi-lingual" as that is misleading if only "major" languages are supported. cir: @Snehal-Gawas to follow up with Siddhi Snehal-Gawas: Adding content team in the thread to share this feedback related to documentation on supported languages for OS metrics. FYI - @julianne-forgo @richard-walls cir: @Snehal-Gawas Do we have an update on this? Snehal-Gawas: @cir included content team in this therad to incorporate this feeback in our documentation. Is there any thing else required in terms of updates on this topic? cir: @suzanne-golledge Can this be closed, or what other action do you require? suzanne-golledge: @Snehal-Gawas - could you provide a link to where the supported languages for metrics are documented before we close this item? I couldn't find it in the documentation link previously provided. Richard-Walls: @suzanne-golledge I will update the documentation to indicate which languages are supported for metrics. cir: @Richard-Walls Do have a link we can reference so we can close this out? Richard-Walls: @cir I've added a label to indicate the language support for the metrics: https://ibmdocs-test.dcs.ibm.com/docs/en/SSQNUZ_5.0_test?topic=evaluations-generative-ai-quality suzanne-golledge: Thank you. I'll close this item not. It would be great to understand the roadmap for language support but that is outside the scope of this original request so I will close this one.

Title: Make WatsonX.AI compatible with RAGAS (RAG evaluation framework)
Comments: Jithu-Ram: Support for RAG Evaluation is part of the development roadmap. cir: @Jithu-Ram Do we have a timeline? @daniel-lsainz Can you provide more detail on competitors and what they are doing with the RAG evaluation framework? cir: This is what I found on the subject to help guide the request: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) evaluation focuses on assessing the performance of RAG pipelines, which combine retrieval of relevant information with language model generation. Here are the key aspects of RAG evaluation frameworks: 1. Component-level evaluation: RAG evaluation typically assesses both the retriever and generator components separately[1][3]. This allows for easier debugging and pinpointing issues at the component level. 2. Multiple evaluation metrics: Frameworks like RAGAS propose several metrics to evaluate different aspects of RAG performance[4]: - Context relevancy: Measures how relevant the retrieved context is to the query - Context recall: Assesses if the retrieved context contains the necessary information to answer the query - Faithfulness: Evaluates if the generated answer is consistent with the retrieved context - Answer relevancy: Measures how relevant the generated answer is to the query 3. Reference-free evaluation: Some frameworks like RAGAS leverage LLMs to conduct evaluations without relying heavily on human-annotated ground truth labels[4]. This can make evaluation faster and more cost-effective. 4. Evaluation data: RAG evaluation typically requires the following information[4]: - Question (user query) - Generated answer - Retrieved contexts - Ground truth answer (for some metrics) 5. Hyperparameter optimization: RAG evaluation helps optimize various hyperparameters like embedding model choice, chunk size, number of retrieved documents (top-K), and more[1]. 6. Automated testing: Frameworks like deepeval allow for setting up automated RAG evaluation tests in CI/CD pipelines[1]. 7. Visualization and analysis: Some evaluation platforms provide tools to visualize results and analyze how changes in hyperparameters affect performance[1]. By using these evaluation frameworks, developers can systematically improve their RAG pipelines, ensuring better retrieval accuracy, answer quality, and overall performance. Citations: [1] https://docs.confident-ai.com/docs/guides-rag-evaluation [2] https://github.com/explodinggradients/ragas/actions [3] https://superlinked.com/vectorhub/articles/evaluating-retrieval-augmented-generation-framework [4] https://towardsdatascience.com/evaluating-rag-applications-with-ragas-81d67b0ee31a?gi=e1eae4bc3d6f [5] https://weaviate.io/blog/rag-evaluation cir: @daniel-lsainz Can this be closed? or what action items do you need following up on ? Jithu-Ram: Latest discussion updates: wx.gov already has an evaluation framework which is competitive to RAGAS. The plan is to bring in evaluation capability from wx.gov to wx.ai which will eventually support the various evaluations such as RAG evaluation. daniel-lsainz: Hi, excusese for the delay! No, I donâ€™t think the Watson gov metrics are what we need, but let me talk with Mehdi Charif as you know hes one of the biggest experts on Governance so I want to double check it with him. The intention of all my ideas/requests is to make our platform as open and/or compatible with the most popular APIs out there, I think that in order to succeed we need to become more user friendly and as portable as possible: the APIs they are already using with their current LLMs (and most probably theyâ€™ve learnt to use them with ChatGPT) are also valid and usable in our environment with our models. Regarding RAG, RAG is one of those Golden Use Cases that we can find on almost any customer, so in order to get accuracy/performance metrics: * We become â€˜compatibleâ€™ with the most popular RAG metrics tool, RAGAS * We define at a company level the set of tools to do it IM not sure if Watson governance can do that, but even if it does it (I need to check it with Mehdi), we cant tell the customer to buy Watson governance to track their RAG. Thanks so much for the support ðŸ˜Š, let me talk with Mehdi regarding the Watson governance capabilities. Title: Help Needed / Query - How to disable .gov deployment end points (IBM Cloud SaaS - watsonx.gov)
Comments: cir: @Snehal-Gawas Can you review this one please. Snehal-Gawas: @arsuryan - Can you please advise on this topic? arsuryan: > When we create watsonx.gov deployments it creates both public and private endpoints. @simon-kronfeld - Can you please elaborate a bit more on the above statement? What are the .gov deployments that you are referring to here? simon-kronfeld: @arsuryan If we create a prompt template, then deploy that asset to a deployment in a deployment space, this give the attached screen. As we can see it has public and private endpoints listed. ![Screenshot 2024-06-28 at 13 44 50](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/238109/files/4af1e112-5210-4258-bb4b-950751ef6ffe) We're working with a customer where we'd want to be able to not expose the public endpoints. ![Screenshot 2024-06-28 at 13 44 50](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/238109/files/1d505e10-d549-4a2a-959b-a93ddc1bee48) The only way we can see of doing this at the moment is via VPN / Cloud Internet Services controlled and blocking the network connectivity. otucker: Two thoughts: @svagaral can you follow-up with @siucht on this as well. My **thoughts** is that there was at one point the concept of WML instance with restricted access to only private endpoints. If that's the case, it may be worth understanding if that's applicable in this case. @vijesh-bhaktha @acasaletto can we get this requirement prioritised (it may be both .ia and WML)? siucht: I'm not aware about any restrictions on `WML Instance` cir: @vijesh-bhaktha What is the final output/response on this request? cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Just following up on this one? vijesh-bhaktha: @simon-kronfeld - Please create RFE for this with customer details and impact. ericsaleh: @simon-kronfeld a few questions to clarify requirements: 1. What is the customer? If if it's an opportunity, please provide sizing to assist with prioritization. 2. Do they want this feature to extend to all WML deployments? Or only prompt template deployments. 3. Are they worried about non-admin Space collaborators getting access to the public endpoints? Trying to understand the core concern of the customer. simon-kronfeld: 1. Customer is WPP. Initial use case is for WPP servicing IBM Marketing; however, WPP and IBM are defining a joint route to market for this overall solution to lots of other customers (one currently being talked to, 6 in advanced discussions and maybe up to 25 others), so we need to secure public end-points. The commercial upside is potentiall several hundred $k+ / customer for the SaaS, there maybe on prem opportunities, as well as the associated IBM Consulting and TEL Services. This is being raised internally to IBM as part of the solutions design and environments setup by IBM TEL Services as we want to secure any non-private end points. Responses provided from our IBM TEL Services Cloud architect @Paul birch to the other two questions: 2. It is for any of the projects and deployments that can be exposed from watsonx.ai. Those are the developed outputs. I don't know if watson studio functions are exposed through the same mechanism as the prompt projects/deployments but those will also need to be able to exposed private one too. 3. The main concern is that if we want to force a customer to gain access to these solutions through CIS, a VPN and place a WAF (or nextgen security appliance) we can only do that if we have control of the accessible routes. A public endpoint is accessible by all effectively. And from testing when you have an access token that is not restricted by any ip restrictions you have set. Therefore, we need to make sure we can route requests to meet what the customers security requirements mandate. This could be by having the private, public and private&public options majority of our databases services allow. Or by being able to enforce context based restrictions such that we can restrict to VPC private addressing (both the subnets and the CSE address). This would mean even if someone got to the public endpoint that has to follow a private ip route to actually get a proper response. cir: @ericsaleh Following up on the @simon-kronfeld comments on your questions. simon-kronfeld: Logged as RFE Aha! https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WTNXDATA-I-82 cir: Note: Cloud limitation - may need to revisit. Underlying work scheduled for mid 2025. simon-kronfeld: @cir This has just been discussed on an internal WPP programme review meeting in YR today. Jessica Ridella the new IBM MD for the WPP account has reached out to Remus directly, as without this the programme may well be dead in the water, as this potentially doesn't even meet IBM's own ITS standards for covering the protection of IBM data which will be used for this programme. This is the message from multiple of the IBM team across technology and consulting. @FRANKO simon-kronfeld: @RFE / AHa raised around end-points generically as this areas needs significant IBM development team attention Originally raised against watsonx.data, but requested by martin keller to raise separate ideas against .ai and .gov https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WTNXDATA-I-82 https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-166 https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WGOV-I-59 cir: @Mekki-MacAulay can you confim? wxd Q125 wxai Delivered wxg Q2-Q3 25 This is the [watsonx.ai](http://watsonx.ai/) SaaS Private Endpoints documentation: https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/ml-service-endpoint.html?context=wx&audience=wdp dataplatform.cloud.ibm.comdataplatform.cloud.ibm.com [Managing the watsonx.ai Runtime service endpoint | IBM watsonx](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/ml-service-endpoint.html?context=wx&audience=wdp) You can use IBM Cloud connectivity options for accessing cloud services securely by using service endpoints. When you provision a [watsonx.ai](http://watsonx.ai/) Runtime service instance, you can choose if you want to access your service through the public internet, which is the default setting, or over the IBM Cloud private network. (https://ibm-analytics.slack.com/archives/D050P4K711Q/p1733335716644569) watsonx.data SaaS is committed for Q1 2025 in both IBM and AWS. [watsonx.gov](http://watsonx.gov/) is pending, likely Q2-Q3 2025. Mekki-MacAulay: Correct.

Title: about the LLM parameter LENGTH_PENALTY
Comments: cir: @TALS Can you take a look at this please. cir: @TALS Did we get back to the local team on this one? cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Can you review please? nisarg-patel: The length penalty parameter is exactly as you described. The larger the decay factor above 1, the more emphasis is given on producing shorter length sequences, while the start index is for controlling when the penalty is begun applying. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Any thoughts on the above? cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Any comments on above? vijesh-bhaktha: @cir - The understanding of length penalty is right (see comment from Nisarg). We do not have a documented list of best practices available. Not sure if the team has experimented combining other parameters temperature, min_new_tokens, max_new_tokens etc to see if that helps. cir: @Yusaku-Ono Is the response acceptable? Yusaku-Ono: @cir thank you. I understand. I will experiment by combining several parameters.

FRANKO: Add @a-o-dowd to this case cir: Call with Sachin (platform perspective) then how sep services will adopt work being done at platform level. keely: @Sachin-Prasad1 any update on this one? keely: @cir Can we move this on to the Product Scout column? cir: @Keely ***@***.***>Yes you can Campbell Robertson Worldwide Principal Practice Leader for Data & AI for Customer Success IBM Technology ***@***.******@***.***> M: 613-371-8710 From: Keely Wright ***@***.***> Date: Friday, October 25, 2024 at 1:36 PM To: noreply ***@***.***> Cc: Campbell Robertson ***@***.***>, mention ***@***.***> Subject: Re: [customer-success-management/watsonx] Watson Pipelines does not work once a project uses Git integrated code - better Git integration/support needed (Issue #137) @cir Can we move this on to the Product Scout column? â€” Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub Enterprise, or unsubscribe. You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID: ***@***.***> Dominik-Kreuzberger: Adding here a "user story of a Developer" using watsonx.ai with Git integration. Listing here the basic user story which should be possible when using watsonx.ai with Git: **As a developer, I want to be ableâ€¦.** - to store watsonx-Project (incl. all assets: model, jupyter code, pipeline code, config, etc. ) in a Git-repository - to restore my watsonx-Project (incl. all assets) from a Git branch - to propagate my code to the next development stage (dev â€”> test â€”> prod) - I want to trigger basic git operations incl. CI/CD workflow from watsonx.ai (UI) - Other watsonx.ai instances are able to connect to other watsonx.ai instances git repo - e.g. there needs to be a transparency on code propagation in my watsonx-Project: - e.g. Dropdown with Branch Selection: dev, test, prod - e.g. Dropdown with Action (one-time configuration): Trigger with CI/CD, move branch dev to test - All assets in wx.ai can be triggered in a CI/CD/ArgoCD way e.g. pipeline exec, YAML (model), model deployment (red/GenAI), Notebook exec. @Sachin-Prasad1 , @MICHEL , @keely , @vijesh-bhaktha keely: Thank you for this user story @Dominik-Kreuzberger. Will you please also add that to the IDEA as a comment? Dominik-Kreuzberger: **Critical Alignment Call on 7th November:** - User story of a developer has been shared and discussed - with example "git operations" which should be possible with watsonx.ai (UI). - Detailed Git roadmap, timeline, draft details (early mockups, conception) needed @Malcolm-Singh , @vijesh-bhaktha, @Sachin-Prasad1 please share here in the CSM issue the details. FRANKO: Next meeting scheduled for Nov 25th FRANKO: Meeting recorded today. There is work to do to align on framework. Platform team to define Spec and then we review again vs user stories and customer (VW) use cases. Next meeting booked January 7th 4pm cet - we can reschedule if spec is not ready. Dominik-Kreuzberger: [End to End Git integration for watsonx - 25 Nov 2024.pptx](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/files/1443542/End.to.End.Git.integration.for.watsonx.-.25.Nov.2024.pptx)  FRANKO: 7.1.2025: Meeting rescheduled from today to next week as Malcolm is OoO and back 10.1. We should have next meeting when PM have feedback to the use cases documented in the Git. Meeting moved to 14.1 TALS: @Sachin-Prasad1 - Any progress Here? Dominik-Kreuzberger: @Malcolm-Singh can you please share the latest status? keely: The related issue https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WS-I-275 has outlook planned 2Q25, @Malcolm-Singh please confirm. Dominik-Kreuzberger: @Malcolm-Singh do we have a update on the Git integration part? @FRANKO we just realized that parameter sets are seemingly also not working, once the project is git enabled. jspyker@ca.ibm.com might can comment on that. jspyker: Yes. Parameter sets are not currently supported in Default Git Projects. FRANKO: @Dominik-Kreuzberger what is the impact of Parameter missing? Dominik-Kreuzberger: Hi @FRANKO, i guess the impact of not working "parameter sets" is a further and extended blocker, regarding a not properly working and thought through Git integration. @Benedikt-Bothur might can share details. Benedikt-Bothur: Hi team, client Dataport summarized the Git integration with watsonx today as "unusuable". This ticket has been open for over a year now and I have not seen any improvements so far. When can we expect an improvement? @vijesh-bhaktha As you were in the recent product enhancements call / escalation, with Trent Gray Donald being aware that many clients are requesting improvements, I hope we can make progress asap. Dominik-Kreuzberger: @FRANKO @Malcolm-Singh @keely is there any update on the enhanced git integration? Benedikt-Bothur: Requested a detailed report of the usability issues my client is facing, please see the summary below: -- 1. Git Integration â€“ Functional Limitations & Inconsistencies - Imported files, if deleted in the project, are also deleted in Git upon the next pushâ€”this cannot be undone via the UI. - Files must be re-committed and pushed after import to be recognized as Git assets, which contradicts the deletion behavior. - No error messages or feedback are shown when actions fail (e.g., pushing to protected branches or expired tokens). - Git workflows like creating branches or merge requests are not supported in the watsonx UI. 2. Project Layer â€“ Questionable Value - Some users work entirely in Git and use APIs to deploy assets, leaving the watsonx.ai project empty and unused. - Even Jupyter Notebooks are stored in Git, not in the projectâ€”projects are only used to launch notebooks, which are rarely used seriously. - The team questions whether the project layer is necessary at all. 3. Usability & Transparency Issues - Files pushed from watsonx are stored in a fixed subfolder (assets/data_asset), while Git allows flexible structuresâ€”this causes confusion. - Branches appear twice in the UI, and checking out certain branches (e.g., origin/*) leads to HTTP 500 errors. - Git access tokens cannot be updated or changed after setup. - Uploads fail if system files are present in the local folderâ€”even if the uploaded file itself is valid. 4. UI & Localization Problems - Poor and inconsistent German translations (e.g., â€œcommitâ€ = â€œfestschreibenâ€, â€œpullâ€ = â€œextrahierenâ€) confuse users. - Push and pull share the same icon, making the interface unclear. - Identical files uploaded twice are sometimes recognized as different file types.

Title: Techzone - Help needed - EMEA - Watsonx.gov - governing of API based calls where LLM could change.
Labels: help wanted, EMEA, watsonx.gov, watsonx products
Comments: cir: @Snehal-Gawas to investigate dstauber: Is this onprem or cloud? If onprem which version? We are making improvements in this area for 2.0 release in June (and following on Cloud) so checking to see if the above will still apply with the upgraded approach. simon-kronfeld: This is SaaS on IBM Cloud dstauber: Okay, the SaaS capabilities for connecting 3rd party LLM platforms will be upgraded in July on Cloud. Development is checking on if your above approach will still apply. cir: @simon-kronfeld to re-test after July 19th ravi-chamarthy: Hi @simon-kronfeld as part of watsonx.gov 2.0 release we introduced a concept of Detached Prompt Template Asset, which mirrors the external prompt that customer is creating, and this Detached Prompt Template is where all the monitoring is done. As of today, it is a one time activity to create the Detached Prompt Template using API, and the rest all monitor configuration and monitoring can be done using UI. We can connect over slack DM if you need additional details. cir: @simon-kronfeld Can this be closed? simon-kronfeld: @ravi-chamarthy @cir Can we have a short call to discuss, please? Think my diary is up to date simon-kronfeld: Not seen any call set-up to review with the team dilang: @keely can you contact Simon for the details? thx! keely: @dilang I scheduled a call with Simon next Tue simon-kronfeld: Had a call - @keely reaching out to wider team for advice and ideating approach. SK (CSM) and Paul Birch (TEL Services) happy to support discussions. keely: @keely Add update keely: @simon-kronfeld I just scheduled a call with @ravi-chamarthy for early next week. Hoping we can get to a resolution on this one. keely: @simon-kronfeld will create an Aha Idea and include a link here. And summarize the great call we had with Ravi! :) ravi-chamarthy: Hi @simon-kronfeld please correct me if my understanding of the ask is wrong: * WPP would like to govern an LLM powered application end point, which internally would use a prompt for generation with respective task type. * The suggested approach is to use detached prompt template. * But as per the call, the issues/asks with the detached prompt template is that, the customer themselves has to score (generate) against the end point, configure a detached prompt template in a project with a given task type, log the records and then trigger an evaluation (in case of development and pre-production usages). * And the above involves multiple API calls, and with the customer showing interest towards solutions from Microsoft, OpenAI, and Google, we need to come up with a simplified API call. * And the simplified API call would be: given a set of parameters, it would internally score the endpoint, create the detached prompt template for a given task type, log the records, trigger an evaluation as well. * All through a python SDK. Basically encapsulate the various API calls to single API call as in this notebook - https://github.com/IBM/watson-openscale-samples/blob/main/WatsonX.Governance/Cloud/GenAI/samples/Detached%20Prompt%20Evaluation%20with%20WatsonXGov.ipynb If the above understanding is correct, then I mentioned, I would check with the watsonx.gov PM on the timelines to deliver this single API call. Thanks simon-kronfeld: @ravi-chamarthy Thank you. Yes the main thing is to make it more streamlined mechanism of adopting out technology in a governed manner - especially where the interfencing is done by watsonx.ai (WML) and the governance is watsonx.gov. It shouldn't really be for the customer to have to include code to do all the detached prompt template tasks, unless they choose to do so for some specific reason. Associated with this, is guidance on how / what management processes need to be considered off the back of the use of the new to-be API. I can see this generating a lot of templates / metrics, etc. So how we track / link / show in watsonx.gov will become an additional ask or potential issue. Await your guidance on timelines with interest. We have some targeted delivery plans for year end, so earlier the better for delivery is appreciated so we can include. Please remember this is IBM Cloud SaaS. @keely Thank you for helping put this in place simon-kronfeld: @ravi-chamarthy You mentioned another customer had asked for this. Please can you advise who this is, and the associated CSM? Also is there an existing RFE / Idea already opened for this to ensure it is being tracked formally? ravi-chamarthy: Sure @simon-kronfeld >You mentioned another customer had asked for this. It is our own AskIBM team. You can reach out to Mike Russo from CIO team.

Title: CSMs' laptop are not equipped for instructLab
Comments: kshabalin: As I understand, GPU is not a hard requirement, but with CPU the speed will be abysmal for larger models. There is a [TechZone env](https://techzone.ibm.com/my/reservations/create/665735c8ffa0c9001dd4806d) with CPUs that can be used if a laptop is too old, but it doesn't solve for GPUs. This TechZone image states: "For customer demo/pilot requiring GPU, you can log a support ticket to upgrade the VM for your reservation pending approval and capacity." cir: @ychunhui Has there been any development on this? Is there is specific action we need to request from PM teams? Footprint? cir: @ychunhui I am going to close this unless you think we need PM response? ling-wong-ibm: You can run instructlab on your PC or Mac, it is just a bit pokey without a GPU. I am running it on the Mac Pro with M series processor and it runs well enough to test with, but training a small model with a new taxonomy can take over an hour versus minutes on something like colab or an environment in Techzone. For larger LLMs, you might want to consider the other options. If you do want to use instructlab, just a couple of things to be aware of, it does not support Python 3.12, so make sure you install a supported version like 3.11. Additionally, the documentation about serving a retrained model might be a bit confusing, make sure to use the model path as well as the model name complete with .gguf extension in the command. i.e. "ilab model serve --model-path instructlab-merlinite-7b-lab-trained/instructlab-merlinite-7b-lab-Q4_K_M.gguf" Good luck!

Title: Platform / Project level connection for watsonx.data does not support LDAP Authentication.
Comments: jennifer-wales: Problem statement: In an LDAP integrated CP4D instance, we want to add a data source to the lakehouse, but it is not currently supported by the lakehouse (no connector available for this data source.) e.g. Vertica. Suggestion from Product: Use data virtualization to virtualize the data in the data source, and add data virtualization instance as a database in lakehouse. Issue: Based on the suggestion, user1 adds Vertica connection (via Generic JDBC connector) and virtualizes datasets. User1 adds the data virtualization instance as a database in the lakehouse using the Db2 connector. User1 provides their own credentials to connect to Data Virtualization. User1 provides User2 and User3 to the data virtualization database/catalog in the lakehouse as user2 and user3 need to access this data in the lakehouse. When user2 and user3 try to access the data within the data virtualization catalog/database in the lakehouse, they will be accessing the data using the creds of user1. This will cause security violations because 1 user is accessing using another user's credentials. This issue is a concern for other data sources also - even the ones that can directly be added into WxD - for eg. one of the BofA users added a Teradata connection using LDAP in the lakehouse - but could not give access to other users to use that Teradata database/catalog because the creds of the user that added the connection would be used - and that would be a security violation. The customer's expectation is that there should be seamless IAM integration - such that if a user is trying to access data within such a database/catalog within the lakehouse, their own creds should be used. In the absence of such seamless integration - they would have to create multiple Teradata connections - 1 for each user. jennifer-wales: RFE requested: https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WTNXDATA-I-56 jennifer-wales: Workaround from Jun Liu The IAM admin credentials is not matched CPD local admin user credentials, which causes "/icp4d-api/v1/authorize" endpoint failed to authenticate admin username/password. The current workaround is the set CPD local admin user credentials same as the IAM admin credentials. Then Presto connection is working. The CPD certification missed the CPD hostname in the issuers. When Platform connection calls WxD APIs and it failed due to hostname not verified. The workaround is to use the internal ibm nginx as the hostname since WxD is in the same namespace of CPD. I have open a git issue to improve the authentication flow for the issue #1 - https://github.ibm.com/lakehouse/tracker/issues/11962. In CPD 5.0.2, the connector team will support API key authentication, which can also resolve the issue #1 as well as all LDAP users using platform connection. The issue is tracked - https://github.ibm.com/wdp-gov/tracker/issues/167499 Regarding the issue #2, we may need to use custom TLS certificate in a customer production to replace the self-signed certificate with customer own certificate - https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/4.8.x?topic=platform-using-custom-tls-certificates-connect. cir: @cir follow up on Idea and workaround. cir: Confirmed for 5.0.2 - August GA cir: CPD related delivery - Product Scout link needed. @cir

Title: watsonx.ai - Multi-instance GPU is not supported for watsonx.ai
Comments: kshabalin: MiG support will be great for any PoC/Sandbox environment, especially on prem where one can't easily scale the number of GPU nodes. My client Truist is set to buy a Fusion HCI box with 3 A100 GPUs as a Sandbox, and MiG support will 100% progress us to more deployment in a shorter time period. kshabalin: Notes: - MiG is supported by WML-A - Claus Huempel (claus.huempel@de.ibm.com) and others have done internal testing of MiG support in watsonx.ai. From Claus: "Works great except for flan ul 2". For bigger models (70B) MiG is mostly irrelevant. - If watsonx.ai supports MiG for a subset of smaller models, this would be a good start. Don't have to support all models at once. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Thoughts on the above? vijesh-bhaktha: @cir @kshabalin - Multi-Instance GPU (MIG) is not supported today and has to be disabled before using for FM serving. Currently this is being considered for Q3 2024 but the plans are not solidified yet. cir: @Hasan-Oezdemir Comments on Vijesh's note? Hasan-Oezdemir: @cir @vijesh-bhaktha Thank you for your response. The customer is trying to switch to a passthrough approach right now, but MIG would be better in the long run for many people. cir: @Hasan-Oezdemir Is the Q3 timeline acceptable to client? Hasan-Oezdemir: @cir The customer BAFIN is planning to deploy production by end of Q4. Q3 2024 would be good. FRANKO: This Multi-instance are critical for BAFIN expansion of users to 3000 users (from 400 from first phase) ! cir: @Hasan-Oezdemir Can this be closed? or do you require a follow up? FRANKO: @Benedikt-Bothur @Dominik-Kreuzberger Benedikt-Bothur: Latest status I have from Thomas Schaeck is that Monica (watsonx.ai Dev Director) stated MIG support comes in September. Issue was mentioned as deployment blocker in the watsonx deployment inhibitor DACH slide deck. Benedikt-Bothur: feedback from @vijesh-bhaktha via mail: "Yes, the MIG support is back on track for Q3. I will get you more clarity on this specific requirement. Meanwhile does the customer have any specific/priority Models to be working on MIG ? Want to ensure that any potential limitations that might arise do not block the customer. And if there are any, we would like to identify those in the early days." to which my client answered: "mainly interested in these models and its respective quantized versions (via BYOM): llama3-8b-instruct (preferred llama3-1-8b-instruct once it is available) llama3-70b-instruct (preferred llama3-1-70b-instruct once it is available) mixtral-8x7b-instruct-v01 (and mixtral-8x22B once it is available)" cir: @Benedikt-Bothur There still seems to be a outstanding issue on this correct? or good to close? Benedikt-Bothur: @cir development is still underway, let's keep it open until targeted 5.0.3 release. Benedikt-Bothur: @vijesh-bhaktha I just got off call with Dataport, in which they agreed that their infrastructure is complex (VMWare MIG without passthrough) and difficult to validate and test for the watsonx.ai development team. To help pinpoint the problem, they offered to host a debug session with your development team on their system. This could be a valuable step in resolving this issue. Would you be open to exploring this option? vijesh-bhaktha: @Benedikt-Bothur @cir **Concerns -** Product team needs to run through its test cycle team with the QA team to provide official support. This requires an environment to test this in. Debugging on a customerâ€™s system isnâ€™t sufficient to provide official support. There are dozens of scenarios (and hundreds of test cases) that might unearth inherent unknowns. This is required for the Engineering leadership to sign-off for support. If we do it prematurely and if things fails in 2 months and itâ€™s production down, weâ€™ll be expected to able to repro and fix the issue quickly. **Proposal -** We will try to procure VMware systems ASAP for CPD testing. Once we have that we can see if it can be contained for 5.1.0 And if possible test it out early in the dev cycle so we can give Dataport an unofficial support statement until we reach GA in Dec Benedikt-Bothur: Thanks, @vijesh-bhaktha. Proposal sounds good to me. Thank you again for your great support on this issue! In the meantime, we are using a workaround to only use models that use vLLM runtime as they seem to work with their setup. Looking forward to 5.1. cir: @Benedikt-Bothur okay to close or move to watchlist? Hasan-Oezdemir: Success: The IBM-Idea for the feature â€œSupport Multi Instance GPU for foundation model servingâ€ has the status â€œDeliveredâ€ now. :rocket: https://ibm-data-and-ai.ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-88 TALS: Thank you @Hasan-Oezdemir - do we have any official blog/announcement? vijesh-bhaktha: MIG for models supported out of the box is GAed. Title: Need Operator driven installation support for GitOps deployment of watsonx.ai
Labels: Americas, watsonx.ai, watsonx products, Product Scout
Comments: cir: @vijesh-bhaktha in sync with Alfonso agrau: Additional justification provided by client: At Adobe there is a team that build and maintain a fleet of multi tenant Kubernetes Clusters. This team heavily uses a gitops approach to deploy and configure these clusters at scale using Argo CD with helm, k8s operators and does not do any one off / manual configuration to ensure idempotency. CLI based installation would break the existing configuration management deployment used by the Ethos team and without proper automation they can't ensure system reliability and predictability in production environments. The requested kubernetes native automation will be used for deploying initially in one region on AWS, and depending on the WatsonX adoption we expect to deploy multiple instances of WatsonX in multiple regions where AEP operates The current cli-based installation is not compatible with gitops in general and the only supported installation process is through the cli. This means that they will be unable to deploy watsonx.ai in production environments. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha cir: @dtoczala dtoczala: Ford has a central Kube team that manages everything that gets deployed on Kubernetes. They have stated that all software deployed at Ford MUST be supported by N or N-1 of OpenShift (so 4.14 or 4.15 right now), and they all must be able to be deployed by YAML and operators (a GitHub deployment), with no wildcarding in roles, and with minimal permissions (i.e. no cluster permissions, stay within your own namespace, no cluster wide permissions needed). We have been working with the various Cloud Pak teams for the OpenShift support (with varying degrees of success), and we have YAML deployments for a few of those. The CSM/Account team are supporting this manually right now, until it becomes officially supported thru the product teams. I would want the same kind of thing from the watsonx folks. Without this kind of support from watsonx, watsonx will never be able to be deployed at Ford, and will only be able to be consumed as a SaaS product. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha to reach out to Tox and Adobe item being worked. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha can you follow up on this? vijesh-bhaktha: @cir - Last update I have from Alfonso Grau is that - 1. Platform team is coming up with an API based approach in CPD 5.0 as confirmed by Sachin Prasad. Some level of testing might be involved from watsonx.ai product team. 2. Alfonso has taken this approach to the customer for evaluation. 3. Adobe engineering team is evaluating if this meets their criteria and if they would be able to use it along with gitops. 4. I am yet to hear back from Alfonso on the outcomes from this exercise. cir: This has been re-prioritized. Moving to watchlist agrau: I met with IBM development and OM. Now organizing a meeting with them and adobe platform team. Goal is to make sure what we plan to deliver will align with their requirements. keely: Delivered

Title: Any LLM for describing and inferring from chart/table

Does each use case have one table or multiple tables ? vijesh-bhaktha: @chuchun-kang @cir - Models cannot understand charts (images)/ excel sheet. However they can understand data when converted into JSON, XML, CSV, etc... llama 3, mixtral as well as any InstructLab aligned models are recommended. Title: question about security of watsonx.ai from Mizuho Bank
Comments: cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Can we respond back to this request urgently? vijesh-bhaktha: @cir @hiroki-kitazume - 1. Yes. there are internal databases used by watsonx.ai and Yes, they are encrypted. 2. Customer can also store data in their preferred location and it is supported via various connections. Even in this case there are several encryption mechanisms in place to secure data that is in motion. Hope this is what you meant by encryption at application-level. hiroki-kitazume: Hello @vijesh-bhaktha -san Thank you for your response. It is very helpful. Regarding "application-level encryption," I would like to provide a more detailed explanation as the previous one was insufficient. Application-level encryption refers to the process of encrypting user input data at the application layer when it is received. We can address the customer's question by confirming that the database is encrypted, but if there is any information available about encryption at the application layer, it would be greatly appreciated. Also, we are wondering if the response is coming from the product team. If possible, could you please let us know if you belong to the product team? Regards, Hiroki Kitazume vijesh-bhaktha: @hiroki-kitazume - Yes, I am part of product team - I am a product manager looking after AI Tooling and developer experience for watsonx.ai. My responses here are also reviewed by the product's security and compliance subject matter experts. I will try to get answer for this specific question - Also when you say user input it can be via a GUI or API. It would be great if you can clarify that as well. Thanks. hiroki-kitazume: @vijesh-bhaktha -san, Thank you for the response from the product team. We also greatly appreciate that the information has been reviewed by subject matter experts. If possible, we would be grateful if you could provide information about both the GUI and API. vijesh-bhaktha: @hiroki-kitazume - I have a confirmation from the team that we do not have application level encryption happening today. hiroki-kitazume: @vijesh-bhaktha -sam, We understood. Our question has been clarified. Thank you for you r support.

Title: SKF - Training MLs with SAP documentaion
Comments: cir: @SCHAECK See the question re: SAP data to train an FM in wx.ai? SCHAECK: For our work with SAP, we used watsonx Discovery licensing of Elastic Search Enterprise with ELSER 2 sparse vectors with the English SAP docs indexed this way by the SAP docs team. For retrieval top N results are retrieved and the ones that have a sufficient search score, up to 10. These resulting document fragments - usually up to ten - are then used as context for answering the users question. Fariba-Ameri: Adding Benjamin Janes and Robert @Benjamin-Janes, @robert.quinn@se.ibm.com any comments? Have we tried this for SKF? Benjamin-Janes: Tomorrow I will provision an instance of watsonx.discovery and see what I can do Benjamin-Janes: @SCHAECK What did you do for your query? I am using then elasti search python client but not getting anywhere, gives no response. ``` query = { "text_expansion":{ "ml.inference.text_expanded":{ "model_id":".elser_model_1", "model_text":"What are different sales order types in SKF?" } } } resp=client.search(index="search-skf-sap-header-text", query=query) ``` I have indexed the documents, however am unable to query them. Title: Verizon â€œAskHRâ€ use case limitations with Llama LLM model
Comments: glepore: @kpolleck Thx for logging the issue Ken. Can we get more insight from the team doing the impl'n why they think the issue is happening and how they think it can be resolved once they focus back on AskHR? Also, the recommendation from the internal call yesterday with @TALS and @rohernan was to do an internal review to get CEs perspective on the RAG solution approach that's been implemented. Just capturing the IND CE contact that was recommended here so you have: SUBIL ABRAHAM, smabraha@us.ibm.com. kpolleck: @glepore @cir Should we be putting updates here or in the Gainsight timeline? I don't want to ask Kapil to have to update two places. I assume this location is to log the issue and point to other more detailled sources--Gainsight, Support Tickets, AHA!, etc. ...and also probably to document interaction with Product Management, but, at least for now, I don't believe there is any new requirements to identify to Product Management . The status of this issue will be updated on this Watson Discovery timeline: https://ibm.gainsightcloud.com/v1/ui/Relationship360?rId=1P054AYV1LXVPMXDUYKJL6JH6D9C5VQAQC4B#/62f99559-c8eb-46c4-9e4d-3f4573139a8e GL: thx for the R360 link as we should be keeping the day to day doc'n in GS. Weekly however, in prep for the office hrs call, we'll want to provide a short update here on either the current specific ask, or, if resolution work is in progress what's the exec level status of that work. kpolleck: Subil Abraham pointed us to a different contact in CE, Senthil Govindan. We will discuss with Senthil who handles Verizon and will ask Senthil to involve others as appropriate. Subil said: "Yes Ken. I would definitely include Senthil on these discussions as he is the focal SA for Verizon from a CE standpoint. I will connect with him to get additional context and see if he needs any help with this opportunity." kpolleck: From CSM Kapil Rajyaguru: I contacted Gus and asked him whether he is open to trying other models and working with IBM experts to resolve this issue. In response to this question, he shared the following things with me. He asked Verizon HR to identify keywords and questions that could potentially result in the ERISA issue. â€“ ETA 4/5 The go-forward plan is to provide a generic response and an actual HR policy link for the keywords and questions identified by the HR team. â€“ ETA 4/19 Once the generic response is ready, the app team will complete testing and open it for the HR team to begin the testing â€“ ETA 4/26 HR team expected to complete the testing by 5/17. Gus and his team are currently focused on the Investor Relations chatbot project that is planned to go live on 4/22 and uses the same environment. So, Gus shared that at this point, they don't want to make any changes in the environment as it will block them from working on the Investor Relations Chatbot go-live and building and testing generic responses to ERISA-related keywords. However, If step 2 does not work out as planned, he is open to trying other models and suggestions from IBM. kpolleck: As a result of the feedback from the customer above, we do NOT have a current BLOCKER at Verizon. We do have work to do to help Verizon develop a plan to consider improved models and approaches in the future, but for the short-term Ask HR and Investor Relations chatbots, Verizon and IBM have a planned roadmap to deployments. We are planning weekly checkpoints as Verizon moves toward Deployment.

Title: watsonx Trade-Up Impact to existing clients with CP4D
Comments: TALS: What is the ask here? What are the blockers? Should we loop in Michael Connor from PM? cir: @TALS The question was raised by a few CSMs on the implications to CP4D deployments, According to Michael the CP4D licenses will stay intact except that AI/ML workloads will move to watsonx.ai. All the work that has gone into developing a Data Fabric is the concern for CSMs. "CP4D Continues. CP4D's focus continues to focus on Data including Data Fabric. And as an integrating platform. The Tradeup is only related to AI/ML, unused VPC's, and providing a more cost effective way to get access to [Wx.ai](http://wx.ai/)." Not sure how many unused VPCs there will be. for client with joint CP4D AI/ML workloads currently what does the trade-up imply from a Cost implications on trade up cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Will the trade up to watsonx.ai be a dual entitlement without AI/ML on CP4D? kshabalin: @cir [watsonx.ai Transition Edition LI Terms](https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/?id=L-RJRH-WJ2S49&lc=en) state dual entitlement of the tradeup. Additionally, the [CP4D to watsonx Transition FAQ](https://ibm.seismic.com/app#/doccenter/f6bc8873-d580-4ee8-a903-c4e0d3a7eee9/doc/%252Fdd85c941b1-5f54-2314-ce72-b98c4c0974c2%252FdfOTRiYmU4NTQtNWY4NC03Y2QyLWZjYWUtOGIxYmFmZjkyZThk%252CPT0%253D%252CUXVlc3Rpb24gYW5kIGFuc3dlcg%253D%253D%252Flf1732569a-ac27-4ddf-95c4-40b865e2999e//?mode=view&parentPath=sessionStorage) states "Transition Editions. These are exclusive to trade-up/upgrade/add-on sales and can not be sold net new. They differ from the regular watsonx editions in that the user retains the entitlement they owned before the trade-up. This enables watsonx upsells to provide an indefinitely long migration window off of the prior technologies, similar to the Modernization parts that were used to trade customers from standalone to Cloud Pak." kshabalin: @cir @TALS Cost implications. Lockheed Martin use case of CP4D and watsonx.ai/.gov coexistence. Lockheed uses CP4D as a truly unified data platform - one CP4D cluster with WML, Studio, OpenScale, DataStage, WKC, Db2 WH, Discovery, Assistant, Watson Query. Lockheed wants to keep the platform unified and add watsonx.ai for GenAI capabilities. Lockheed is currently using 250+ VPCs for traditional AI out of 750 VPCs of the full CP4D cluster, with signed growth of 750 VPCs for traditional AI out of 2500 total VPCs over the next 2 years. Lockheed is expecting not to trade up the 250 current VPCs and 750 VPCs in progress of deployment, while being able to add watsonx.ai to the same cluster. The tradeup of 1000 VPCs used for traditional AI without actual benefits, just to be able to add watsonx.ai to the cluster, is prohibitive and a blocker. cir: @cir to engage with Michael Connor to review findings from Konstantin kshabalin: @cir another impact scenarios: 1) Clients who have CP4D EE entitlements bundled, for example in previous traded up part numbers. Examples: IBM Db2 Advanced Edition Modernization [Link to LI](https://www.ibm.com/terms/?pid=5900-ACE) or IBM DataStage Enterprise Modernization [Link to LI](https://www.ibm.com/terms/?pid=5900-ABP). Clients can't trade these up because there is no upgrade path. 2) Clients who want to do trade ups, but neither IBM, nor the client side wants to open the ELA for a small sized tradeup. Possible remedy: allow Subscription watsonx addons on top of perpetual CP4D entitlements. The [addon LI terms](https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/?id=L-FWWA-A38ECT) are aligned well for this scenario, I just checked. cir: Michael Connor to set up additional meeting to investigate cir: @cir to follow up with Michael C. kshabalin: As per our conversation with Andrew Buckler and Michael Connors: for clients who have CP4D EE entitlements bundled in modernization part numbers - there might be a path through unbundling mod parts to Cartridge + CP4D (S&S divided between new parts) as part of the tradeup. The exception process is not streamlined and is not guaranteed - please ask Andrew Buckler for details. This solution would solve the Truist use case (CP4D in Db2 Mod), but not the Lockheed Martin use case (heavy users of ML in CP4D) described above. kshabalin: 05/31/2024 call comments on "CP4D but are superseded/upgraded by watsonx.ai and watsonx.governance respectively if installed in the same namespace.": this is not up for debate or reconsideration in the near future. If a client wishes for one namespace coexistence, they will need to use WML, Studio and other superseded services as watsonx, requiring tradeups for clients currently using AI/ML services on CP4D. On the technical side, WML and Studio don't support multi-tenancy, and only one WML/Studio instance can exist per deployment of CP4D. kshabalin: **Problem statement 1, for ELA clients**: tradeups can only happen at given points in time in the life of an ELA, for many clients only at ELA renewal. That prolongs the availability of watsonx for ELA clients via tradeus to several years. **Possible remedy**: allow Subscription watsonx addons on top of perpetual CP4D entitlements to bridge until ELA renewal. The addon LI terms are aligned well for this scenario. **Problem statement 2**: Clients who have CP4D EE entitlements bundled, for example in previous traded up part numbers. Examples: IBM Db2 Advanced Edition Modernization Link to LI or IBM DataStage Enterprise Modernization Link to LI. Clients can't trade these up because there is no upgrade path. **Possible remedy**: 1) Allow Subscription watsonx addons on top of perpetual CP4D entitlements to bridge until ELA renewal. The addon LI terms are aligned well for this scenario. 2) Allow unbundling mod parts to Cartridge + CP4D (S&S divided between new parts) as part of the tradeup/ELA renewal. As per Andrew Buckler, right now this is a possible scenario that has happened on an exception basis and can possibly be worked through into a normal/regular tradeup path. cir: @Yuankai-Shen Can you review and provide POV for 5.0 kshabalin: Answers from Andrew Buckler on 6/13/2024: - For Problem 1 (mid-term upsells for licenses locked in ELAs), we have looked at this and there are two cases. For licenses deployed from ELA catalogs during the current term, there is no upsell option and that wonâ€™t change. For ROEs, which are normal P*Q S&S that was renewed for the ELA term, we may be able to address with supplementary upsell parts. You would not be able to use the SL Add-on parts in their current form, so we canâ€™t enable this immediately. Iâ€™d like to enable this in 2H, but thatâ€™s assuming we can overcome some pricing obstacles. - For Problem 2 (trading up CP entitlement inside of Modernization bundles), this one is harder but we have had one case of success. Iâ€™m skeptical about the add-on approach for this problem. We have too many Modernization offerings at too many pricepoints. Itâ€™s also a permanent add-on, unlike the ELA case above, which raises questions about long term sustainability. What happens if we have a second tier of wx.ai on-prem? How many add-ons will need to be stacked on top of each other to support our eventual 2035 portfolio? We had one debundling (Mod VPC -> CP4D VPC + OpenPages Cartridge VPC) approved as an exception to support a deal at Credit Mutuel in March. Replicating this would require Accounting to approve the same action as a general program, which could be problematic for them. Weâ€™d also need an airtight governance system to prevent customers from debundling to arbitrage off S&S. This is only viable for IBM if itâ€™s done as part of a committed transaction to trade up the CP entitlement. The odds on this are lower than the previous item. Iâ€™m still planning to attack it in the hopes of unlocking the motion in 4Q. cir: @kshabalin Can this be closed has Andrew covered any open areas of concern? keely: @kshabalin will follow up with Andrew Buckler. keely: @kshabalin to update with resolution, then we can close. kshabalin: We got a resolution for "Problem 2 (trading up CP entitlement inside of Modernization bundles)" From Andrew: we got accounting approval a few days ago to unbundle Modernization offerings to separate CP4D and Cartridge licenses. We have an exception to use IBMâ€™s Unbundling process (process docs attached) and are doing the first few deals now. Disclaimer: "This is a Client-initiated exception process. IBMers MAY NOT proactively offer or otherwise attempt to initiate this process without a specific, auditable, Client request. Special Approval Required. Only possible during ELA renewal." Modernization products that can currently be unbundled: â€¢ Db2 â€¢ Db2 Advanced â€¢ Hybrid Data Management Platform â€¢ Cognos Analytics Advanced â€¢ Cognos Analytics Advanced Limited Use Please contact Andrew Buckler for more details, if needed. Thank you. keely: @cir Can we close this or are we still waiting for resolution to problem 1? keely: @cir Can we close this one? cir: Yes we can close this. ***@***.***>

Title: Cannot setup OIDC SSO using Cloud Pak for Data and watsonx.data documentation
Comments: cir: @Mekki-MacAulay Can you take a look at this? Mekki-MacAulay: @jennifer-wales Could you please provide more details on the part that's failing in the documentation so that I can get our watsonx.data dev/support team looking into it? jennifer-wales: There is no documentation in CPD 4.8 for Configuring single sign-on using OpenID Connect (OIDC) The closest version is 4.5: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/foundational-services/4.5?topic=users-configuring-single-sign-using-openid-connect We were able to get OIDC partially working, but never able to search the OIDC identity provider for users to add to CPD, so had to also configure LDAP authentication to same backend directory in order to get users into the system. This can't be the proper way to configure this.... Mekki-MacAulay: @Hans-Uhlig ^ Is this related to the OIDC challenges that we were facing? Or an oversight? Mekki-MacAulay: Ritesh Gupta in CPD Core is taking a look presently and will follow-up here. ritesh-kumar-gupta-ibm: IBM Cloud Pak Foundational Services (CPFS) 4.5 is correct for CPD 4.8.4 CPFS 4.6 will be available with CPD 4.8.5 and CPFS 4.7 with CPD 5.0 So URL [mentioned here ](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/foundational-services/4.5?topic=users-configuring-single-sign-using-openid-connect) is correct to refer for SSO on CPD 4.8. Can you share what are issues you are facing? jbamfor: The CPD SSO configuration topic [Configuring SSO](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/4.8.x?topic=environment-configuring-sso) includes the following information:  I am updating this note to help users figure out which version of the CPFS documentation they need to review: For information about which version of IBM Cloud Pak foundational services is installed on your cluster, see [Operator and operand versions](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/4.8.x?topic=planning-operator-operand-versions). jennifer-wales: This snipped with links does nothing to help a user figure out how to configure SSO, and referencing versions 4.3, 4.4 and 4.5 are more confusing as the user will not think it's for CPD 4.8. Need more straightforward documentation that walks user through the process of how to do it. jbamfor: @jennifer-wales so the CPFS docs that we link to do not walk the user through the process of how to configure SSO? jennifer-wales: Try them :) jbamfor: If you'd like, I can pass that feedback to the CPFS team. jennifer-wales: Please do. Our docs are a mix of fyi and instructions that send you all over the place until you eventually dead end without completing the task at hand. What's needed is a high level of the process followed by links to the 'how to' so user doesn't get lost. Here is an example of good instructions that I was able to use to configure: https://media.github.ibm.com/user/9134/files/be5524d6-cb8c-4ac7-a18f-6bdd65321715 jbamfor: @jennifer-wales can you confirm that someone from the CPFS team has reached out to you? jennifer-wales: They have, thank you. jbamfor: @jennifer-wales can we close this issue in this repo? Ashraf-L: Hi @jbamfor The query related to CPFS docs are still in progress. There might be some updates required from CPD docs to refer the CPFS doc in the Configuring section. Will keep you posted regarding the updates cir: @Ashraf-L Can this be closed? Ashraf-L: @cir The related changes for CPFS is completed and closed. You can close this issue if CPD docs doesn't require any doc updates.

But note that .ai and .governance do not even show up in a search for documentation, visible here: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/products?filter=watsonx ingeh: We will publish the IBM watsonx.ai and watsonx.governance 1.1.5 doc set on 24 April 2024, to coincide with CPD 4.8.5. We reviewed the proposed doc updates, a lot of which will help as it was missing before, but we still have this essential disconnect between the documentation reflecting internal product implementation dependencies on CP4D versus the loud and persistent GTM messaging that wx platform is completely separate from CP4D. glepore: **Forgot to add Justin Youngblood exec assignment to this issue to the discussion thread last week:** From: JUSTIN YOUNGBLOOD  Sent: Friday, March 29, 2024 7:06:30 PM To: Steven Astorino ; Laura Scott  Cc: Tarun Chopra ; Cameron Art ; Robin Hernandez  Subject: Re: watsonx AM watchlist - weekly update Thanks for adding me â€“ Iâ€™ll drive this with the team and come back Justin Youngblood Vice President, Product Design IBM Software e: [justiny@us.ibm.com](mailto:justiny@us.ibm.com) m: 512-507-1861 From: Steven Astorino  Date: Friday, March 29, 2024 at 6:03 PM To: Laura Scott , JUSTIN YOUNGBLOOD  Cc: Tarun Chopra , Cameron Art , Robin Hernandez  Subject: Re: watsonx AM watchlist - weekly update + Justin for number 2 (documentation disconnect) Steven Astorino General Manager, Product Development, Data, AI & Sustainability; Canada Lab Director Warden Avenue Markham, Ontario Canada L6G 1C7 Tel. Title: Benchmarking of Granite Models against other LLMs (ITZ-Bund)
Comments: Hasan-Oezdemir: - IBM Granite Model own benchmarks can be found here. https://www.ibm.com/downloads/cas/X9W4O6BM - More information on IBM docs https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/4.8.x?topic=models-granite-13b-chat-v2-model-card _â€œIBM has built a comprehensive test framework FM eval that is used through out the modelâ€™s lifecycle. This can be used both to evaluate IBMâ€™s own models and those already trained by third-parties allowing models to be measured against a variety of benchmarks. The evaluation framework runs on a Red Hat OpenShift cluster with GPU support and uses various AI model evaluation frameworks: Eleuther AIâ€™s Language Model Evaluation Harness [lm-eval](https://www.ibm.com/links?url=https%3A%2F%2Fzenodo.org%2Frecord%2F5371629), [Stanford's Holistic Evaluation of Language Models (HELM)](https://www.ibm.com/links?url=https%3A%2F%2Farxiv.org%2Fabs%2F2211.09110), [Beyond the Imitation Game Benchmark (BIG-bench)](https://www.ibm.com/links?url=https%3A%2F%2Farxiv.org%2Fabs%2F2206.04615), as well as IBM-internal datasets.â€_ - Another example: https://www.ibm.com/blog/watsonx-tailored-generative-ai/ _â€œThe [Granite](https://www.ibm.com/blog/building-ai-for-business-ibms-granite-foundation-models/) model series is built on a decoder-only architecture and is suited to generative tasks such as summarization, content generation, retrieval-augmented generation, classification, and extracting insights. All Granite foundation models have been trained on enterprise-focused datasets curated by IBM. To provide even deeper domain expertise, the Granite family of models was trained on enterprise-relevant datasets from five domains: internet, academic, code, legal and finance, all scrutinized to root out objectionable content, and benchmarked against internal and external models. This process is designed to help mitigate risks so that model outputs can be deployed responsibly with the assistance of watsonx.data and watsonx.governance (coming soon).Based on initial [IBM Research evaluations and testing](https://www.ibm.com/downloads/cas/X9W4O6BM), across 11 different financial tasks, ```the results show that by training Granite-13B models with high-quality finance data, they are some of the top performing models on finance tasks, and have the potential to achieve either similar or even better performance than much larger models```. Financial tasks evaluated includes: providing sentiment scores for stock and earnings call transcripts, classifying news headlines, extracting credit risk assessments, summarizing financial long-form text and answering financial or insurance-related questions._ - Hugging Face Open LLM Leaderboard https://huggingface.co/spaces/HuggingFaceH4/open_llm_leaderboard cir: @Hasan-Oezdemir What is the specific task/comeback? So you need additional benchmarking? Hasan-Oezdemir: @cir The LLM Benchmarks seems not to be a real blocker, however I assume we will get confronted with this question more often than not, over time. To my information, up to now there is **_no public LLM-benchmark of IBM GenAI models against other major known LLM models_**. Our Research team has benchmarked IBM Granite against other major GenAI models. They are working to create "ground-truth" benchmarks. cir: How does IBM Granite stack up against other LLMs on German language benchmarking.? FM-EVAL keely: @keely Look into this elke-kunde: aged, client is doing a PoC with IBM and BP SVA - please close
