Title: Assistant+x.ai (Mixtral) Intermittent timeouts on lengthy questions
Comments: TALS: @ychunhui what is the deployment blocker here and what is the ask? Can toy summarize? cir: @ychunhui Has a support case been created? Please add here. ychunhui: Trent Gray-Donald [8:49 AM](https://ibmcase.slack.com/archives/C06QR9QSR0X/p1711543798041699) we will do path 1. we're working the path to success there with Research and the Red Hat team. We have some benches proving that it CAN run fast with different inference sw (vLLM), it's now a matter of pushing that code through the pipelines, which will take a bit of time. aside: do the granite folks see any hope for improvement on the tasks on the granite.13b model, or is it just too small? mixtral is obviously significantly larger (ignoring the MoE aspect for a moment) Andrew Freed [8:54 AM](https://ibmcase.slack.com/archives/C06QR9QSR0X/p1711544047374949) For Entity Extraction I gave them the feedback a month ago, they gave some suggestions (which didn't work), have not heard more on it since. For RAG it just hallucinates too much. They were happy granite-v2 beat Llama in the task (it does) but now the bar is raised. Their POV is probably optimistic but realistically still seems they will be months behind leading models. Trent Gray-Donald ok. there's a LOT of work going on right now to align more strongly on context for RAG. I suggest you re-engage them on that? (the LAB work is pushing hard on forcing RAG to be VERY grounded) - or is this after that? Andrew Freed That is great to hear and I connect fairly regularly with [@kate.soule] and [@Luis].... I can't tell you how many "early release" versions of Granite I have tested. They know I am happy to interim test any model they provide ... it has traveled far. this is ~1 year of RAG experiment history ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/5436/files/c30c3723-2c9f-4be3-9179-8495c61acf70) I have run over 100 experiments to date on RAG-flavored models, all results shared with them... even contributed multiple test sets to their granite evaluation I am quite sure they're being overly optimistic - that's their job :slightly_smiling_face: - key is to keep pushing on realities observed. ychunhui: Trent is working on to make Mixtral faster cir: 1. Resource allocation to D&B one approach ychunhui: Two issues are related Andrew: need to speed it up.... response time aka latency. had a quality problem because after 30s it times out (becoming no response). so the latency becomes a quality issue here is the other gitbub issue Sunil P opened re increasing the 8 inference requests/sec throttle: https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/issues/81 ychunhui: Andrew Freed i'm assuming then the mixtral model will be a sort of dark launch that i can't just select it from prompt lab dropdown. only accessible by API via its id? Trent Gray-Donald it'll be visible for that wml instance in the UX. but not any other wml instances. cir: @ychunhui @glepore Okay to close or do we need to escalate? Title: Gaps between Iceberg & Spark
Comments: cir: @jennifer-wales Has an RFE been created for this? and or support cases? jennifer-wales: Customers: Tractor Supply, Vermont Info Processing (VIP), Bank of America agrankin: @cir We do not necessarily open support cases for every issue we encounter during the pilot. Several reasons for this: - During the pilot, the product is not bought yet and customer does not have a valid entitlement - During the pilot we are usually extremely time constrained and zero focused on making our stuff work. We do not have time to go through a whole support process, waiting for entitlement exception, spending a lot of time on the webexes with support, trying to explain them what is wrong. We look for the way to get around the issue and keep moving forward. The process of reporting and capturing issues should be streamlined and simplified. Right now, I just reach out directly to engineering and get my answers. Support doesn't always have the same sense of urgency we do. I'd be happy to discuss more, if needed. @jennifer-wales - FYI. jennifer-wales: @agrankin is this still an open issue? mogle: @jennifer-wales I've confirmed with the team that some gaps are being addressed with each release. However if there are more specific ones then we can map those to our future plan schedule. Currently in the 2.0.2 release/August, the code was updated so that during a Spark scan (which is when Spark reads data from an Iceberg table), the system now includes NDV statistics in the SparkColumnStatistics class. This means that when Spark queries an Iceberg table, it will have access to the NDV information for each column, which can be used to optimize the query execution process. In the 2.0.3 release/September, various other columnar statistics (max, min, nullCount, etc.) will be supported in the SparkColumnStatistics class jennifer-wales: Thank you Michele. We are good to close for now.

Title: Not able to leverage Data Virtualization capabilities with Presto in watsonx.data
Comments: cir: @Yuankai-Shen Wondering if this needs to be an RFE to be fast tracked? Or do we have roadmap on this already? cir: Presto 2.0 - Not contained with timeline as of yet. @jennifer-wales can you set up the call with Kevin and others to drill down on the use case etc. Yuankai-Shen: @cir @jennifer-wales - I want to understand this a bit more....we are working on enhancing the entire virtualization capability with work that is looking to bring in watson query/data virtualization connectors. Pushdown enhancements for the current Java connectors will be throwaway work. Yuankai-Shen: Chatting with Albert, perhaps a passthrough may solve the issue Hans-Uhlig: We need to examine how best to address this issue as a whole. Given our integration with Optimizer+ and the existing capabilities we have with watson query pushdown optimization. Work needs to be done to port that over both to GFS and to the existing presto connectors. Performance is an ongoing area of analysis. jennifer-wales: Albert's summary from the meeting we had this morning with Hans (PM), Kulki (Engineering), Victor (Support), Jennifer and Albert (Expert Labs). I think we all are on the same page now on Data Virtualization gaps in our Lakehouse platform. Current State: Presto engine shipped with Watsonx.data has very rudimentary Data virtualization capabilities. While it can establish connectivity with number of remote data sources, access/sample their catalogs and tables, it lacks any other vital Data Virtualization capabilities â€“ there is no concept of join or predicate pushdown to the remote source, passthrough support, SQL compatibility, UDF or SP template support etc etc Spark cannot be considered a data virtualization engine. In the current form, we cannot recommend/deploy IBM Watsonx.data alone for architectures that require SQL access to many remote database data sources. This will put us at a competitive disadvantage when compared to other DV solutions. For all use cases that require data virtualization integrated with other lakehouse capabilities, we should offer Watsonx.data and Watson Query bundle as our solution. While WQ and Wxd can integrate, - there are number of integration/compatibility issues between Watson Query and Watsonx.data that need to be addressed as soon as possible. This is critical to our success in any competitive discussions/situations. Future State: Engineering is developing a new Data Virtualization capability to be added to Watsonx.data. This solution is called Global Federation System (GFS), and it will combine functionality from Watson Query with Apache Arrow opensource framework. Engineering team does not have a timeline at this point when this feature will be released. It critical for us to establish this timeline. Near term solution, a â€œstop-gapâ€ I have described below is not easy to implement as it does require design changes. Having said that, - passthrough feature is still very useful and should probably be added to GFS framework as one of the virtualization methods. Future solution should allow for easy conversion/migration of virtualized objects from Watson Query to GFS. Future solution should support join, predicate, row limit pushdown capabilities and provide the same or better integration points with IKC, Watson Studio and other Watsonx platform services. Just want to emphasize this here â€“ Prestissimo (Presto 2.0) will not address these gaps. cir: @Yuankai-Shen @Hans-Uhlig Do we have a roadmap or sense of an approach for this? Are there RFEs that we can reference here? jennifer-wales: Presto Pushdown RFE https://ideas.ibm.com/issue-tracker/data-and-ai/wtnxdata/candidate#WTNXDATA-I-50 cir: Pushdown is option 1, Watson Query tight integration to watsonx.data is needed to address gap of not providing pushdown. Requires client to deploy additional service. GFS is proposed new capability (2025 current window) cir: @mogle To look into this cir: @mogle Any updates on this ? cir: 1. Path to use existing technology WQ (Additional licensing) 2. GFS Longer term. (2025) keely: Closing because this is so old, please open a new issue if needed.

Title: Updating LLMs
Comments: vijesh-bhaktha: @Albert-Diaz @TALS - Prompt engineering/fine tuning is optimized for a specific version of a foundation model. If there is a newer version foundation model or the customer wants to use a different model from the same family or from a new family - the same engineered prompts may not work to the optimum level as delivered in the previous version. We have to take the new version of the model through the same steps and may be even governance, the previous version went through. @Upasana-Bhattacharya1 - Please add more from a x.governance perspective. Upasana-Bhattacharya1: Albert - To make sure I understand - the use case [here](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/issues/63#issue-39031532) where the client has a "local" LLM that they fine-tuned and then a newer version of the LLM is released? wx.governance support for watsonx.ai tuning studio is on the roadmap. @Snehal-Gawas please add. cir: @Albert-Diaz Is the response sufficient? Can this be closed? cir: @cir to follow up. RFE? New roadmap from research? Define the governance process? keely: Closing since no update since March. Open a new one if still an issue.

FRANKO: @TALS Feedback from CSM Fariba Ameri on TechZone: Challenges with TechZone: We had GenAI workshop for 120 people from SKF (the client) followed by Hands-on sessions We divided hands-on in 3 sessions (35 registered). 1 session delivered Friday 23rd of February 2 others on 1st of March Around 30% of registered people in session1, 50% in session2 and 75% in session3 managed to access watsox in IBM Cloud due to the issues We did as follows: The user creates an IBM ID W ereserved a Techzone environment and shared with the attendees The email from techzone was sent to the client Issue: No email from IBM Cloud (to join the itz-watsonx account( was sent =>The attendees couldn't access the environment 10:30 And I had still put many hours (20-30 hours) in advance to test different options cir: FYI: The trial is limited to 30-days for customers who are creating an IBM Cloud account as part of signing up for the trial (lite plan). They will have a trial Cloud account type created for them, and they'll be prompted to enter cc information to upgrade to a Paygo Cloud account after 30 days. If they already have a Paygo or subscription IBM Cloud account type when they sign up for the [x.ai](http://x.ai/) trial, they are not time limited on the lite plan. Regardless of Cloud account type, the lite plan is also limited to 50K tokens and 20 CUH per month. You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID: ***@***.***> TALS: Adding Ben and David from TechZone team. @Ben-Foulkes , @David-Massey - can you please look in to it Ben-Foulkes: The Techzone workshop issue, seems to primarily relate to an IBM Cloud problem of not converting non-IBMID invitations to IBMIDs automatically. We had to ensure the shared users had proper IBMIDs first, and then re-invite them. We have been working with our support team continuously to improve their ability to handle these types of situations resulting from the massive influx of watsonx demand, so the issue with response time, or watsonx problem solving in general, will also have been improved. The approach taken of opening a support ticket, and then escalating in urgent/customer-impacting cases is still the correct one since that is the only scalable process in place. Regardless of this, the mix of services required for a GenAI setup is fairly complex, so going through Techzone may be the only feasible option for users to try it out through scheduled workshops or shared reservations. I'm happy to discuss this as needed. cir: 1. Internal platform for CSM enablement 2. GSI platform sandboxes enablement 3. Customers Try Experience TechZone needs to be enhanced: but need more specifics on ease of use and access. cir: @FRANKO If we can get more specifics on the ask for 1. IBMers 2. GSIs 3. Customers. UI? Onboarding and use? duration of image stand up? Resources needed to "kick" the tires? Specifics are needed for each offering: wx.ai, wx.data, wx. gov ? FRANKO: hi @cir Further input from Italian Market on the missing "try-experience" from GSIs (BlueReply and Accenture). I keep hearing IBM'ers missing this ability to show our watsonx platform to customers via simple url (ibm.com) based on some general domains (demo customer cases) this include .ai but also .gov and assistants. ![image.png](https://zenhub.ibm.com/images/65d603822d52b2c0087cba1a/38124629-3a33-418d-a7cd-7d9b81c86d2b) TALS: The .ai lite environment is almost full one (no prompt tuning) but with limited tokens, if PM will increase the tokens bar will it be enough? Same there are free options for .data and .gov, you can see the different plans here - https://www.ibm.com/watsonx/pricing This is not optimal and we need PM to address a more robust trial environments (especially for SI's) cir: @TALS Start discussion with Armand and PM team to potentially plan on GSI and "Try" experience. GSI Sandbox Larger Try env Governance experience cir: Call with TechZone to discuss issues and use. IBMC "Consulting Advantage"? env? cir: @FRANKO add Blue Reply comments on try experience. FRANKO: Feedback from Blue Reply Good morning Frank, following up on what was discussed last Tuesday, here below you can find a list of the points that, according to our opinion, deserve attention. An important premise: all the points below share a common origin, that is the need for Blue Reply as a partner of yours, to have access to technology in order to be able to study it, both in teory and in practice. For us, mastering your technology is a fundamental step to take before undertaking sales actions towards customers. We would like to have: Focus on Watsonx: according to our experience and compared to the platforms from other vendors, currently some relevant features are missing and during last months this has been preventing us from promoting the product in the market in which we operate: Fine tuning for the models hosted Bring your own model Support for multi-modality Model catalog: compared to other platforms, Watsonxâ€™s catalog seems to lack important entries (i.e. Claude, Stable Diffusion) We will concentrate our efforts on the SaaS version since the on-prem seems to complex to deploy for the IT departments of our customers. We faced in the past 2 years several failure cases in leading Italian financial institutions in deploying Cloud Pak for Data and Cloud Pak for Integration and, at the same time, the cloud approach seems to be nearly customs cleared. Full access to the products, in their complete version (no light accounts/sandboxes/demo envs, no after-3-days-it-expires envs), both for SaaS and on-prem solutions. In the past, we always leveraged the access to the Software Access Catalog reserved to partners for downloading and setting up on our private environments the products (WebSphere AS, WebSphere Portal, BPM, Api Connect, Integration Bus, Tivoli Identity Manager, Tivoli Aaccess Manager, Datastage, ecc ecc). Today, with the advent of the cloud and of new deployment approaches, paradoxically, we find it more difficult than before to access your technology. As an instance, to start studying Watsonx on a dedicated environment with reasonable costs, Gian's intervention (and efforts and precious time) and a few weeks of elapsed were necessary. On AWS, one of my consultants (<1y exp) activated Bedrock in 10 minutes by himself. Another example: IBM Watsonx Code Assistant for Z â€“ still today we are not able to use the product for internal study/evaluations/experiments. Without a proper knowledge on the product, we will not proceed with sales actions Strong certification paths and tech materials for studying. The tech level of â€œbadgesâ€ is not tech/deep enough Thanks for your attention. Best regards, Marco Marco De Luca Partner Blue Reply Via Robert Koch, 1/4 20152 - Milano - ITALY phone: +39 02 535761 mobile: +39 347 5307156 mar.deluca@reply.it www.reply.it signature_1506875499

Comments: TALS: Hardware guidance (including L40S) - watsonx.ai on-prem for foundation models https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/4.8.x?topic=setup-adding-foundation-models Here's the latest on Fusion HCI support for watsonx. https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCdhpT6BDRc6m8FVfXQmfTmCM9MG. In terms of other GPUs support, AMD MI210, MI250 and MI300 as well as Intel Gaudi2 and Gaudi 3 are being looked into for Q2 but no committed yet as part of the roadmap. @vijesh-bhaktha - anything we can add for Azure? TALS: @vijesh-bhaktha ? vijesh-bhaktha: @TALS - Certification of watsonx.ai on-premise on Azure is targeted for Q1 (end of March) - This effort includes testing and validation of the generative AI components with Azure GPU hardware.

Title: Watsonx.ai and other watsonx products installation solution (Tietoevry Experience)
Comments: FRANKO: This go hand in hand with Issue #62 TALS: @David-Massey , @Ben-Foulkes - DO we have solution for it in TechZone, to experiment full installation of watsonx on-prem from scratch? David-Massey: No, this isn't currently available and probably won't be in the near future due to the limited availability and high cost of GPUs. We are looking at expanding our capability to provide watsonx services that require GPUs, but there probably won't be availability for a while for individuals to get them to solely practice installations. Previously I know this has been done in Azure working with the client's cloud account. You can make a custom request for an environment in Techzone using [this link](https://techzone.ibm.com/my/reservations/create/654ea5837958d10017a0bccc). If you think this is an enhancement that should be prioritized then you can make an enhancement request at https://ibm.biz/techzone-enhancements FRANKO: @cir can we get somebody from TechZone leadership onto our COP meetings and explain the options they offer to engage with customers learning about watsonx. This continue to confirm to me that we lack solid response to the "try experience" that competition offer. vijesh-bhaktha: Documentation perspective - there is an effort already planned to separate out watsonx documentation from CPD by end of year. No specific dates available to share. Inge Halilovic is the SPOC. cir: @FRANKO Have a call with Content lead to discuss this week.

To achieve this, we would like to verify the accuracy of our model's tuning within the company before presenting it to the client. 2. We tried several times and I attached error message images. cir: @TALS @vijesh-bhaktha any insight into this? If it is determined that the problems with the product are being caused due to an issue with the way TechZone is setting up the environment, then make a Techzone support case. On Friday afternoon, Daniel provided us with the settings in the parameters and "words" to enter the custom model. Using original Smart Formatter, only for the passport section Barge-in disabled "Words" to train the custom model Note: There are scenarios where the User does not speak and STT interprets text due to some noise, "Yes", "oh", "no" appears in the transcription. So we agreed to do tests with Barge-in disabled until a solution is found. Expert Lab did the configuration and trained the model, friday at the end of the day. Over the weekend some tests were carried out where we found the following: It is still not possible to recognize "W" when indicating "double ve" and "double ve", it only works as "double vee" Recognition of the letter Q has improved, but when there is more than one Q repeated and it is not completed correctly In some cases it interposes letters such as "S", "M" or "H" The numbers are detected very well Daniel requested the Session Id and Logs,which were already delivered Tomorrow we will continue with more tests other passport conbination glepore: **â€‹CSM Updates for wk of Apr 7:** **Apr 11** Laura Scott; Burak AKBULUT; Andres Maldonado; Johann Edison Carrasco; Gayl Lepore; Alexander Antonio Noriega; Djalma Pinto de Britto; Paola Cecilia Sempertegui; Robin Hernandez; Campbell Robertson; Daniel Bolanos â€‹ Hello Team. To report the status of activities. **Issue Passports:** - On Monday the model was adjusted with improvements regarding the letter "W" and "Q", about the weekend tests. - On Tuesday the CSMs Peru/Expert Lab team carried out tests on the Passports case where it was possible to generate 250 validations, from which we found several points of improvement. - 54% of the conversations were successful, considering recognition the second and third attempts to recognize the passport. - Today, the transcripts were analyzed and improvements were identified, which Daniel Daniel adjusted the custom model again **Next Steps:** - Team CSM PerÃº will repeat the passport test with the latest model, we hope for better results - The client has 4 test flows (balance inquiry, payment inquiry, credit capacity inquiry and collections), IBM CSM Peru You will perform tests to ensure that the changes in the model do not affect the post-authentication flows and the other issue is verified regarding the recognition of "Yes", "no" and noises. - The test results after the improvements will be presented to the Client, with which they will make the decision to continue with the move to Production, while working on a definitive solution - To the definitive solution @Daniel Bolanosis coordinating with the Research team to improve Speech Activity Detection, this may take weeks, we need a commitment date that cannot be moved, before returning to the Client Thanks to all the team. Saludos/Regards. Carmen Belito Customer Success Manager Phone: +51 994606973 E-mail: [carmen.belito.subilete@ibm.com](mailto:carmen.belito.subilete@ibm.com) **Apr 7** De: Carmen Belito Subilete  Enviado: domingo, 7 de abril de 2024 22:43 Para: Laura Scott ; Burak AKBULUT ; Andres Maldonado ; Johann Edison Carrasco ; Gayl Lepore ; Alexander Antonio Noriega ; Djalma Pinto de Britto ; Paola Cecilia Sempertegui ; Robin Hernandez ; Campbell Robertson ; Daniel Bolanos  Asunto: RE: [Diners Club Ecuador] Critical Support Cases CS3789206 - CS3815966 Hello Laura and Team. To report the status of activities. On Friday afternoon, Daniel provided us with the settings in the parameters and "words" to enter the custom model. Using original Smart Formatter, only for the passport section Barge-in disabled "Words" to train the custom model Note: There are scenarios where the User does not speak and STT interprets text due to some noise, "Yes", "oh", "no" appears in the transcription. So we agreed to do tests with Barge-in disabled until a solution is found. Expert Lab did the configuration and trained the model, friday at the end of the day. Over the weekend some tests were carried out where we found the following: It is still not possible to recognize "W" when indicating "double ve" and "double ve", it only works as "double vee" Recognition of the letter Q has improved, but when there is more than one Q repeated and it is not completed correctly In some cases it interposes letters such as "S", "M" or "H" The numbers are detected very well Daniel requested the Session Id and Logs,which were already delivered Tomorrow we will continue with more tests other passport conbination Saludos/Regards. Carmen Belito Customer Success Manager Phone: +51 994606973 E-mail: [carmen.belito.subilete@ibm.com](mailto:carmen.belito.subilete@ibm.com) Carmen-Belito-Subilete: Apr 17 Hello Team. To report the status activities completed: First cycle of tests carried out on the case of alphanumeric passports, resulting in 54% success per call. The model was adjusted with improvements regarding the letter "W", "Q" and others, recommendations from Daniel BolaÃ±os Second cycle Tests carried out on passports, with 59% success per call Testing business flows, 86% success, main problems: Issue in reading two-digit or three-digit numbers (Standard User Identification) Ex: 13 38 29 68 Issue in the detection of ambient noises such as words Issue in detecting silence such as â€œohâ€, â€œsÃ­â€, â€œajaâ€ that change or close the conversation flow Product Team proposes as a solution a new base model STT to solve the issues. For this we have recorded 2000 passport readings. Presentation of results to the Client, positive perception for the improvements and the work of the IBM team, but it is not enough. So we hope that the new model improves the detection and % success with respect to the listed issues. Next Steps: The client is doing tests, they finish between Monday/Wednesday of next week, then they will decide if they go to production (white run) enabled only for internal clients Delivery of the new base model (May 13th) by the IBM Research and Products team The client expects the % success to improve above 90% to decide to go into production with attention to all its clients. Thanks to all the team. Saludos/Regards. Carmen Belito Customer Success Manager Phone: +51 994606973 E-mail: [carmen.belito.subilete@ibm.com](mailto:carmen.belito.subilete@ibm.com) cir: Will need 4 more weeks to get above 90% accuracy. Delaying going to production. Focus on new STT model. @dilang dilang: From Dev team, _Retraining a new model with additional data and optimizing it is not a trivial task. Even 4 weeks is an extremely ambitious time frame. Dani and the research team know the importance of this project and are working as fast as possible to improve speech performance._ djalmab: @dilang and @cir and @rohernan - Diners has called and shared they will cancel the project. @lkscott . We will try to make them reconsider but this is the information we have so far ... anoriega: Hello team, @dilang @cir @rohernan @lkscott @djalmab we had an internal call today and immediately after a call with the Innovation Manager at Diners Club (Ecuador). The summary is: - Customer wants to re direct the effort to use an app (chat) to do the client authentication and then go to watsonx services, so that they eliminate any possibility of errors. They currently have a high level of customer satisfaction with their call center and do not want to have claims, affecting that metrics. - This initiative was based on reaching high levels positive cases with watsonx, starting with positive client identification, so that they could replace some human positions in the call center, obtaining a a return, without impacting their current service levels. Through the testing results, the customer see our Spanish (latinamerica) model is not ready enough to launch this. They are expecting at least 80% of positive cases at the beginning with an expected improvement until 95%. Their own internal testing is giving the 40% of positive cases (we challenged that) - Customer said they already have a omnichannel service platform, and they are looking to have a single point of contact through a conversational chat, with watsonx, but they see we are not ready yet to provide the % of success they need. They told us they were aware that our model could present this issue, since they did they own testing to the BRADESCO conversational chat in Portuguese and they saw a higher % or negative than they were willing to accept. - Even though the above, Customer considers the advances have been positive in the sense that this project has allowed then to introduce changes at the application levels, creating microservices and testing the idea of having a single point of contact through a conversational chat with watsonx. They want to continue working with us. - We have proposed to review in further detail their testing results, with their technical team, since their date seem to have very difficult testing scenarios (like calling from a crowded street or event near the airport). Anyway the customer has asked us to review and redirect the project. - We will review in detail Monday and Tuesday and have to return to the customer next Wednesday with a conclusion and agreement. Thank you. Carmen-Belito-Subilete: Hello team, @dilang @djalmab @cir @glepore, here the latest activities of internal team after the client redirect. The client decided the effort to use their Text and Voice Chat Mobile Application (Blue) as a channel, the application would be in charge of authenticating the client and then going to the Watsonx Assistant services and when voice is used, invoking Watson Speech to Text. A proof of concept of the integration of Blue with Watson services is currently being designed and planned with the Client Engineering team, delivery date would be next week. On the other hand, we have proposed to the Client to carry out joint tests, with the new STT base model, however the Client requests a form of remuneration for dedicating time and effort in tests to improve the STT model. cir: Customer satisfaction is red (Risk) no communication Business Architect meeting and review alternate solutions. WA with other STT - suspended. Carmen-Belito-Subilete: Hello @djalmab @cir here the latest update in detail. Track A: The client wants to integrate Watsonx Assistant with their â€œBlueâ€ mobile app The Client Engineering team prepared a demo including capabilities of watsonx.ai that helps control responses that are not in the scope of Assistant, regarding voice-to-text translation, using the capabilities of the mobile device. However, the Sponsor of the project does not show openness for any meeting. Track B: Continue with the original project The client has suspended the project. Yesterday, Daniel BolaÃ±os and the product team deployed an improved version of the model for the IDs case (numeric and alphanumeric), however we cannot test it yet, the Client's test telephone line is disabled. The Business and Innovation Architect (Customer) has given us a space where he proposes using the competition's STT, today afternoon we will have the meeting. later updated the status. Carmen-Belito-Subilete: Hello @djalmab @cir @dilang @rohernan Track A: At the end of the day, the Client was open for a meeting where he could see the Watsonx Assistant/Watsonx.ai demo with their â€œBlueâ€ mobile app, which was positive and the Client agreed to review this alternative with his VP, It has improved our position with the Client. About the meeting Architecture (Client) are evaluating other STTs (Google) to integrate with Watsonx.Assistant, they requested additional costs for Voice Gateway. They are considering it as an alternative for the voice channel. Carmen-Belito-Subilete: Hello @djalmab @cir @dilang @rohernan The status today: Track A: The demonstration (Watsonx Assistant/Watsonx.ai ) was very good then at the beginning of the week, the client confirmed moving forward with the POC, developing a conversational flow (balance inquiry) integrated into their system through APIs. That is ongoing. Track B: Continue with the original project As of yesterday we already have the active test phone line, but we are having errors with STT (vgwPostResponseTimeout), Daniel BolaÃ±os and the team are reviewing. Daniel commented that they are already preparing the deployment of the STT model with improvements with the IDs and the noise problem is reduced, and he also validated that the vgwPostResponseTimeout error should not appear. When the new STT model is in place, we will execute a functional test plan. We cannot even return to the Client without having satisfactory results end to end. I'm on vacation today, any news or questions I'll check tomorrow please. Carmen-Belito-Subilete: Hello @djalmab @cir @dilang @rohernan The status: Track A: The relationship with the Client remains sensitive, for now it has only agreed to work on a POC that consists of a "Balance query" conversational Flow, integrated into its APIs. Last week the accesses were delivered to the POC, the Client is carrying out tests. Track B: Regarding the new STT model, we already have an improved version to detect IDs and it is more robust to noise. I performed a set of tests (44 calls validating the detection of the IDs) where the following result was obtained: 88% success with low or no noise 80% success with high noise I cannot perform end-to-end functional tests because the client APIs are disabled, we are waiting for it to be restored. anoriega: Hello team, we need help in order to execute a POC on the customer account without consuming their credits. For that we ask how may we add free credits? pls. @cir @weeds @djalmab It would be proof of Concept with watsonx, amount $3000 for a period of 5 months, for the Diners Client from Ecuador. As you know, we have had problems with the implementation of the "Cognitive Voice Assistant" project, which had to be in production in February, however, due to problems with our services: SpeechToText and then watsonx assistant, it has not been completed. The main problem is the speech to text detection (SpeechToText), which is being improved from the product side. However, we have lost the Client's trust and credibility. A few weeks ago it was possible to open a space with the client to work on a POC, where the client wishes to use watsonx assistant integrated into their mobile app. This POC would be deployed in the current customer's IBM Cloud Account because it requires using back-end integrations, already configured there. This is possible the last chance we have to recover confidence, as per the customer comment. Please, who may help us with this? Comments: cir: Reaching out to them cir: @ppmuthus you can let them know that WS, WML is HIPAA ready. But until we have a watsonx service (on the catalog) we cannot talk about compliance of watsonx. [2:15](https://ibm-analytics.slack.com/archives/D02AB9QFHUK/p1709234123364299) but until we have a watsonx service (on the catalog) we cannot talk about compliance of watsonx ppmuthus: @cir I don't fully follow... Are we saying we do not recommend this client deploy watsonx.ai SaaS at this time? @glepore fyi ppmuthus: "until we have the watsonx service on the catalog".... It is available for a client to use, so I'm at a loss for how I would communicate this to the client? @ppmuthus this goes back to the issue that wx.ai currently is not a stand-alone service like wx.data and wx.gov are: ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/43705/files/1b7b8199-e71e-41dc-bd35-a41f188d3673) glepore: @cir hi Campbell, can we pls get delivery dates for a) when will wx.ai be available as a separate cloud service in the catalog, b) when will wx.ai, wx.data, wx.gov be hipaa compliant. ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/43705/files/98cbe596-3c24-4f4e-b8f2-c6b2bbc73507) glepore: @ppmuthus Preeth, how many customers in PUB would be affected by lack of wx core platform HIPAA compliance? TALS: @glepore for your question (a): It is written watsonx but the description below is wx.ai, if you click watsonx you get to the next screen of launching each service separately ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/71412/files/0cb12cff-9b49-4f6a-97e1-671de2c94718) Both wx.ai and wx.gov are running from dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com while wx.data runs from cloud.ibm.com/lakehouse ppmuthus: @glepore Right now we have 1 client with this immediate blocker...but over time, this may impact all 32 of our Public clients. ppmuthus: I received another response from product manager that is still not clear to me. Bottom line is, can I make this statement? â€œwatsonx.ai on IBM Cloud is HIPAA enabled.â€ Per Mayank's response, I would think yes? ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/51075/files/18f36c26-35c9-42be-a5a8-14e9018415c3) cir: @ppmuthus The response I got was since watsonx.ai is currently not a sep service it is NOT HIPAA ready. But let me get the roadmap and 100 % on that. Watson Studio and Watson Machine Learning are HIPPA ready. cir: @cir to set up sep call with Mayank and Mehboob Mekki-MacAulay: HIPAA compliance is on the roadmap for Q3 2024 for watsonx.data. cir: @cir To get an RFE to created. cir: @ppmuthus https://ibm.ent.box.com/s/sw6s37wqlitmir754242mb9o31m6m054 cir: @cir to follow up with Mayank on date for completion? when it will be published? cir: June 30th placeholder. cir: @ppmuthus Okay to close this out? ppmuthus: @cir - reading the box attachment, HIPAA readiness will be done in June? cir: @vijesh-bhaktha When can we say externally on the HIPAA compliance? Can you follow up with Mayank? cir: HPO office are asking us to go through a full review - so we are having to replan the whole effort. were leading this from PM. Expecting to hear some updates on this next week. cir: Compliance now live on Seismic https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCMmpHHmJchDq8qW3dM9TX8qjW9d ppmuthus: @cir hi, when you say "live", doesn't it say "under investigation?" ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/51075/files/a1fd2f30-23ff-45c1-a654-6d9acd9a66ff) cir: @ppmuthus So I would say HIPAA would be in 2025. From what I know the HIPAA program office is asking for a complete review. @vijesh-bhaktha @mogle @Snehal-Gawas Can you comment on each product line for HIPAA Ready in 2025? Snehal-Gawas: For watsonx.governance, HIPAA is under consideration for the 2025 roadmap. cir: @cir Work with Carlo on client list. dkhodges: Customer discussions at Duke University Health are indicating this is likely to be a significant concern in progressing opportunity focused on watsonx.governance but may expand to watsonx.ai as well. ISC Opportunity: [Duke AI Health - watsonx.governance](https://ibmsc.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Opportunity/006Ka00000NUFq8IAH/view) ppmuthus: @cir Here are the clients in US Public Market impacted by lack of HIPAA readiness for watsonx.ai. Each "get started" opportunity is $500K, so total is $2.5M across these 5 clients, with more upside if we were able to land + expand. But initial land is limited without HIPAA. - BlueCross Blue Shield of Alabama - We lost a 2Q opportunity (fell out of ELA) due to this issue. - Elevance / Anthem - BlueCross Blue Shield of South Carolina - BlueCross Blue Shield of Massachusetts - Highmark Health TALS: @Carlo ppmuthus: Carlo â€“ we have another Public Market client that is putting all watsonx deployments/pilots on hold until we get HIPAA enabled watsonx.ai on IBM Cloud/SaaS. Blue Cross Blue Shield AL with a $300K ACV deal at risk. ISC record is [here](https://ibmsc.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Opportunity/0063h00000LYaElAAL/view). Devi is the CSM that covers both BCBS SC and AL. We will lose these opportunities to AWS if we donâ€™t move quickly on this. What can we do to get this prioritized into the roadmap? Mayank-Arora: Updated compliance roadmap on slide 11 - https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCMmpHHmJchDq8qW3dM9TX8qjW9d HIPAA is planned for 3Q 2025 for SaaS on IBM Cloud. Meanwhile, the alternative I would suggest is on-prem watsonx.ai which can be operated HIPAA complaint way. We added a HIPAA readiness guidance page in CPD 5.0 documentation - https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/5.0.x?topic=compliance-considerations-hipaa-readiness The on prem (client managed) software can be hosted be in IBM cloud or AWS or Azure but would be managed by the client. Akshay-Khaire: @Mayank-Arora , @cir Team, Just want to bring your attention to one more case, In ISA, We have client in healthcare sector who needs HIPAA compliance services as they deal with US patient health record. But currently, IBM watsonx.ai SaaS is not HIPAA ready which acts as a blocker for the deployment. We also have other watsonx opportunities in progress in healthcare but for those also this HIPAA readiness will acts as blocker and we can loose significant number of deals and revenue and trust. keely: Berkeley Biologics is also blocked from deployment due to lack of HIPAA readiness, see issue #161 cir: 2H25 at this point, we have a watsonx compliance roadmap. keely: Closing since this is now part of Product Scout.

Title: Teaming with CE - DACH CE Leader raised this issue in CE
Comments: rohernan: @FRANKO There is an implementation in ISC today, which the CE team has requested us to use globally. [ISC link](https://ibmsc.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Report/00O3h000004QaoSEAS/view) If there is an alternative proposal, let's discuss what this is, as we need something that works at a WW level consistently. FRANKO: @rohernan yes we are promoting the ISC request process. Only observation I have is teams locally seem to connect without using the formal process. We will continue to promote. Above is more about how CE recognise Deployments in their metrics ref Johanna's point on conversion. rohernan: @FRANKO Conversion is a measurement of closed deals / sales. CE measures conversion as how many closed sales were made. CSM receives the deployment targets based on closed deals. We are talking apples and oranges. It doesn't matter that CE engagements with CSMs do not count as CE conversion metrics. Together, CE and CSM carry a deployment target which is a subset percentage of the closed deals. CE also has a deployment incentive to facilitate this target. There should be no issues working with CE on post-sales deployments. If there is, please reach out to me on a case-by-case basis and I will assist with CE leadership.

Title: ELA Diamond contracts with double entitlements (perpetual and SaaS) - deployment will be SaaS and perpetual stuck in ACEL
Comments: FRANKO: From @Marco Ercolani NatWest has more than 2M ACV allocated to Watsonx core which are perpetual and subscription licenses. I have checked with Kim, and she has told me that if they go for the SaaS deployment option (which they will) we must use the IBM Cloud entitlements, this means we will have to close most of the success plans we have on Watsonx and open new success plans against the IBM Cloud relationships. We see the following problems: My understanding is that IBM Cloud consumption will not drive drawdown from the ELA and will have a big negative impact on our rate and pace target. I will have to close the plans I have for the Watsonx entitlements with a â€œno plans to deployâ€ linking them to the new plans in IBM cloud, I guess this will raise a lot of red flags in our dashboard, having no longer active plans for the core components of Watsonx at NatWest, any advice here? Deploying the SaaS option seems easier and more popular with customers, we will see this more and more in the future, while on the other side sellers are incentivised to sell perpetual and subscription. Any help, advice here is much appreciated. rohernan: @FRANKO I've spoken to the ELA team, and we don't have a resolution for this. It is known to happen in the pre-sales environment . The deployment options as you have outlined are correct.

Title: Competitive Help Needed: Robust Intelligence
Comments: cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Is this competitor on our radar? @Upasana-Bhattacharya1 This seems to be also in the AI Risk space. Do we have any competitive insight into them? cir: Robust Intelligence is a company that provides end-to-end AI risk management to proactively mitigate security, ethical, and operational risks associated with AI models. The company's AI Firewall platform protects models in real time and surfaces risks in models and data throughout the AI lifecycle. It was co-founded by Professor Yaron Singer and Kojin Oshiba in 2019 after years of robust machine learning research at Harvard University. The platform allows users to test and monitor their models for operational, ethical, and security risks by integrating into their AI pipeline. It offers features such as stress testing, continuous testing, and AI compliance management to ensure that AI models are validated across their lifecycle to protect against various risks. Robust Intelligence's platform is used by leading enterprises globally to realize the benefits of AI without the associated risks[1][3]. The company's AI Firewall service is designed to wrap a protective layer around AI models to block malicious inputs and validate model outputs in real time. It covers a wide range of security standards, is model agnostic, and provides visibility across teams. The service allows organizations to deploy AI with confidence by blocking malicious inputs in real time and ensuring that model outputs are validated according to the organization's standards[5]. Citations: [1] https://www.robustintelligence.com/company/about [2] https://www.robustintelligence.com/platform/overview [3] https://docs.robustintelligence.com/en/2.1-stable/documentation_home/robust_intelligence_intro.html [4] https://www.robustintelligence.com/solutions/by-use [5] https://www.robustintelligence.com/platform/ai-firewall Aya-Tokura: @cir Thank you for your comment. This may affect the adoption of KPMG AZSA (watsonx.governance) and TMNF (watsonx.governance). Any good reference or ideas on competitive approaches? FYI: An endorsement and company logo from TMNF is featured on Robust Intelligence Japanese Website. https://www.robustintelligence.com/jp Gainsight - KPMG AZSA LLC (IBM Cloud) https://ibm.gainsightcloud.com/v1/ui/Relationship360?rId=1P054AYV1LXVPMXDUY60SXPMSWEM2LZWLPRS#/cdb6d8eb-39dd-4f9c-895a-7d83742b8608 - TOKIO MARINE & NICHIDO FIRE (watsonx.governance) https://ibm.gainsightcloud.com/v1/ui/Relationship360?rId=1P054AYV1LXVPMXDUY6D7WJIDWF7BI892R2U#/fc089385-a3c2-4ffe-9fa7-6975287d9c75 FYI @Iheji-Hamano1 @Yusaku-Ono vijesh-bhaktha: @cir - 1. We have had requests and efforts are underway to build stronger insights/battle cards on Azure, Google, AWS and Snorkel AI. 2. Team is looking at Robust Intelligence for the first time. 3. Eric Martens have earlier produced all the competitive insights for watsonx.governance - He is looking into this request now. cc: @Upasana-Bhattacharya1 Upasana-Bhattacharya1: @cir @vijesh-bhaktha my colleague Snehal Gawas covers watsonx.governance deployments - please keep her in the loop. (She isn't on this repo as a user as I write this, which is why I'm not able to [at] tag her myself here. vijesh-bhaktha: @Aya-Tokura - Can you let us know if both these customers ELA sales were in Q4 2023 with revenue allocation to watsonx.governance ? Upasana-Bhattacharya1: For context -- these clients didn't show up in our Q4 2023 analysis of sales - hence interested to learn on wx.governance just one of a long list of items in the ELA catalog or whether there was specific revenue associated with watsonx.governance in these deals -- that'll also help clarify what is at risk here. From everything in the earlier thread - this sounds like a general ask so trying to better understand the risk (quantified). Upasana-Bhattacharya1: @Aya-Tokura @vijesh-bhaktha with regards to the ask, I suggest not posting client and revenue information in open git repos - and sharing it directly with us. avarshn: Hi @cir @Aya-Tokura Just following up on the question from @vijesh-bhaktha above. Could you directly share (not via Github) with @Upasana-Bhattacharya1 @vijesh-bhaktha and I the potential watsonx.governance revenue impact if this is truly going to put the adoption at risk for the 2 customers? We want to make sure we're prioritizing this correctly. Thanks. cir: @avarshn @Aya-Tokura what is the status on this item? Aya-Tokura: @avarshn @cir We will send you e-mail with information on revenue impact of this matter. Thanks. Upasana-Bhattacharya1: @avarshn @Aya-Tokura quick clarification here. Vijay covers watsonx.ai so he need not be bombarded with stuff for watsonx.governance The info should be shared with Snehal Gawas and myself in this case. TALS: @Upasana-Bhattacharya1 , @Snehal-Gawas - Any answer/battle-card on this competitor? Snehal-Gawas: @TALS - Eric Martens Will be working on this competitive asset. I am checking with him on the timeline. I will let you know once I have more details. Can you please add Eric Martens (emartens@us.ibm.com) to this repo? TALS: > @TALS - Eric Martens Will be working on this competitive asset. I am checking with him on the timeline. I will let you know once I have more details. Can you please add Eric Martens ([emartens@us.ibm.com](mailto:emartens@us.ibm.com)) to this repo? Done Snehal-Gawas: Thank you @TALS. @emartens - Can you please provide a timeline estimate for this competitive asset? TALS: @emartens , @Snehal-Gawas - Any update?! cir: @emartens @Snehal-Gawas time line on competitve material? emartens: @TALS @cir I will be working on this today (Thursday, March 14) and will update by the end of the day emartens: @TALS @cir I have a few slides, I am sending them to our PM team for a quick review and then I will pass them along to you. Some thoughts: Doing a side-by-side "check the box" comparison with Robust Intelligence will not be as helpful, because they make a lot of the same claims that we do, at least in a broad sense: - Platform-agnostic monitoring - Evaluate predictive and generative AI - Data collected on model cards (factsheets) - HAP, PII, fairness, and drift monitors - Risk assessment The same is going to be true for us vs. a lot of governance-focused startups and smaller companies. Where we're going to differentiate ourselves is tough to put on a snappy Powerpoint chart, though I did try. Basically it's the depth of our solution: - Integration with OpenPages, which is a fully-featured risk management solution with configurable approval workflows. They do not appear to have anything like this, just a dashboard to show various metrics. - More in-depth metrics for predictive models, particularly around quality, explainability, and indirect bias - Differentiation between the phases of the model lifecycle (develop, validate, production) - Support for custom metrics - Experience helping with enterprise-scale AI projects From their website, it looks like they have a more-developed story around protecting from malicious data-poisoning attacks, and more focus on NLP and computer vision monitoring than we do. If the client is very interested in these areas and already has well-defined approval processes, we likely will not compare well unless the client is also interested in a more complete risk management solution (OpenPages). TALS: Thank you @emartens also it is about adoption (if we include AI Governance) - How much market share/clients those startups have? cir: @Aya-Tokura @emartens Has the appropriate competitive information been provided? Aya-Tokura: @cir @TALS Thank you very much for your support. We received the appropriate competitive information. We can close this ticket now.

Title: Bradesco - llama2-13b-chat-portuguese model used in 2 MVPs did not have good results
Labels: Americas, Production Deployment Blocker, watsonx.ai, Latin America Mkt
Comments: cir: @Angela-Jamerson @sawyerst FYI TALS: @clviana Why do we use llama 13b and not 70b? clviana: @TALS Brazil Client Enginering team performed a thoroughly benchmark last year with multiple LLMs and llama2-13b-chat is faster and cheaper than llama2-70b-chat, consistently generating almost the same quality of response. For these reasons, we've chosen llama2-13b-chat as baseline model for our fine-tuned version in Portuguese. clviana: ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/130324/files/cefef8b6-aa2e-4626-adbb-f2ff655cfcba) TALS: Understood, but if the result are not satisfying maybe we need to re think of 70b clviana: In the meeting with Steve Sawyer on 15-Feb, he proposed 3 options to improve results, listed the positive and negative points of each one and the time needed to adopt each of them. Among the options, performing a new fine tuning of the llama-17B-chat-portuguese seems to be the fastest in the case of Bradesco. After the new adjustment, it will be necessary to deploy the model and run the same tests by the Bradesco team to confirm that the results were achieved. Additionally, the Bradesco account team asked Maryam Ashoori for internal help via email. TALS: Can you share the 3 options and timeline for each? What help is being asked from the PM team (Maryam Ashoori)? cir: @vijesh-bhaktha We need to get PM involved. Let me set up a call to discuss. clviana: > Can you share the 3 options and timeline for each? What help is being asked from the PM team (Maryam Ashoori)? Below the options proposed by Steve Sawyer : 1) Switch to Mistral model. It's not a multilingual model and will take a lot of time for fine tuning starting from scratch. 2) Switch to Granite model. In December/23 tests were executed with Granite GA model and the performance was below that of llama2-13B. Look at the comparative table above. 3) Use a new retrain technique with llama2-13B-chat-portuguese and generate a new fine tuning. This option is faster compared to the other 2 options. Joaquim Campos (jfcampos@br.ibm.com) and Bradesco account team (nborges@br.ibm.com) asked Maryam Ashoori for priority to speed up the fine tuning of llama2-13B. We have a deadline of Feb 28 to complete the tests with Bradesco. clviana: > @vijesh-bhaktha We need to get PM involved. Let me set up a call to discuss. OK. I will invite client engineering too. clviana: Maryam recommendation: Test the latest version of **Granite-20B multilingual** and return the results to her. Find Steven Sawyer to get the access to Granite model as soon as possible. She is confident that the results of Granite Multilingual will be better than Llama2. Client Engineering Brazil team will begin internal testing without involving the client. cir: @Maryam-Ashoori @Angela-Jamerson @vijesh-bhaktha We need Carlo and Armand to sign off on getting the Bradesco team access to the Granite multi language model to test plus we need David Cox to be on a call to discuss tuning methods for the llama 13b model. cir: @glepore @TALS Client Engineering Brazil started testing on the Granite-20B model and parllel CE testing the mixtral model. @clviana can you give us a status early next week please? cir: [@jorge.chagas](https://ibm-analytics.slack.com/team/W8QUU100L) tell me the first results of mixtral model was better than llama2-13B-chat-portuguese. cir: @clviana What is he current status and what else is needed at this time? cir: Jorge Chagas has completed the granite tests and should document the results by tomorrow. He commented to me that the granite results were not as good as expected. Tomorrow he should share it with us. clviana: > Jorge Chagas has completed the granite tests and should document the results by tomorrow. He commented to me that the granite results were not as good as expected. Tomorrow he should share it with us. Additionally, the account team has decided that they will only ask the Bradesco to continue testing when the Client Engineering results are satisfactory with the new models to avoid further questioning the quality of the responses. clviana: Client Engineering Brazil team completed tests with the granite and mixtral models. The mixtral model presented better results than the granite and llama2. Model tests with the client will resume on March 5th using the mixtral model. Below is a compilation of the comparative results of the models made by CE Brazil: ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/130324/files/1c873416-2128-44a2-b25f-63afbed0954e) avarshn: @cir per the meeting yesterday, just wanting to confirm that you will be sharing the test results with IBM Research (Kate Soule)? cir: @TALS Can you share the results with Kate Soule ? TALS: > @TALS Can you share the results with Kate Soule ? Done cir: @cir to reach out to Clayton to get CE - to fetch new model to be tested. clviana: Bradesco's business analysts resumed testing on 5-March and the results with the mixtral model were better than the previous llama2. Today they shared the answers with the CE Brazil to resolve some exaggerated responses and address the offense part. Another Bradesco team (data scientist) should start testing on 12-March and take at least 1 week. Bradesco's goal is that the model will answer questions in portuguese about the Bank's internal knowledge base stored in confluence system that does not invent answers or hallucinate. When they feel that the solution is mature, it will be made available to employees. TALS: Kate Soule: "we have a new experimental model, can you give me ibm emails for the team that should test it?" @cir to set a call/email between CE and Kate clviana: > Kate Soule: "we have a new experimental model, can you give me ibm emails for the team that should test it?" @cir to set a call/email between CE and Kate The person who is leading the model tests in CE Brazil is Jorge Chagas (Jorge.Barbosa@ibm.com). Yesterday he talked to Kate Soule and Maryam about the model called **ibm/granite-20b-multilingual-v1-1-rc.** For now, we will finish the tests with the mixtral that we have already started with Bradesco and based on the feedback we will talk about this new model again on March 19th. ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/130324/files/ceb779d9-b408-42b0-ac61-81874bf6e971) clviana: Bradesco team (data scientist) should continue Model testing next week and take at least 1 week. clviana: During testing, the client identified some inconsistencies in the responses when the information is in table format. The answers mixed information from 2 or more columns. The CE team fixed it and asked Bradesco to test it again. clviana: Client gave feedback about the first tests of the E-Agro MVP and the CE Brazil team corrected it and requested new tests. Attached are [22-March week tests](https://ibm.box.com/s/f3662l6ricye09jib1123jaaxtrppthh) (4 correct answers out of 10). Client test results will be reported weekly on Fridays until the model answers the questions satisfactorily. kgajda: Per note from Tarun on 3/26/24, Bradesco was given early access to a new InstructLab multi-lingual granite to provide early feedback for Research. TALS: @clviana - which model and version was used in the test? clviana: > @clviana - which model and version was used in the test? Bradesco MVPs are using mixtral model and neuralseek. In parallel to Bradesco's tests, the CE Brazil team tested with Labradorite released by IBM Research and Mixtral model delivered better results. So we continued with Mixtral. clviana: The client completed the tests of the 2 MVPs (Knowledge Management and E-Agro) and will make the technical presentation of the results on Tuesday 16-April-2024. The preview of the results was not good and the client must explain the evaluation metrics he used. clviana: CE Brazil team replaced the granite/mixtral models with the llama3 model in Banco Bradesco's e-agro project and the tests with llama3 progressed very well with good results. clviana: @cir The issue can be closed because we are no longer using the granite/mixtral model and the project will continue with the llama3 model.

Title: Sirionlabs blocking issues for watsonx usage
Labels: Americas, Production Deployment Blocker, watsonx.ai, watsonx.data
Comments: ssm: These are generally not blocking issues, but are impediments to Sirion's ability to adopt Watson Discovery as a platform: 1. Watson Discovery does not provide notification (e.g., webhook) when documents complete processing; caller must poll. This causes additional overhead and complexity for Sirion. 2. Watson Discovery does not provide x/y coordinates for where text is found on the page; it only provides character positions. This makes it difficult for them to accurately highlight phrases for the users in the source document. 3. Watson Discovery does not process embedded files; this requires additional logic in their application to handle the embedded files. 4. Watson Discovery: Sirion wants to be able to provide multiple tenants within a SaaS instance of Watson Discovery so they can use the same tenant to support multiple Sirion customers. To do this, they require private key encryption for each of their customers within a single tenant of Watson Discovery. **This is a blocking issue.** 5. Note: Sirion.ai will be evaluating Watson Discovery Premium SaaS for data isolation. 6. Watson Discovery: Limitation of 10MB (or even 50MB) per file is too small. This is particularly true when the recommended DPI is 300 for image-based documents and their documents can be 1000 pages. They often deal with 500MB files. **This is a blocking issue â€“ must have 500MB.** 7. Watson Discovery: Sirion needs to see the Watson Discovery roadmap so they can see when their requirements will be addressed, as well as what new features are coming when, including plans to integrate Watson Discovery with watsonx. 8. Watson Discovery: Sirion wants built-in analytics/dashboards showing how well the system is doing on an overall basis. They don't want to have to export the data in a CSV, etc. 9. Watson Discovery: Sirion wants knowledge graphs. Our understanding is that Watson Discovery removed knowledge graphs in the past; would like it brought back. 10. Watson Discovery: Sirion needs a way to expire and update security tokens / access management keys for security compliance. 11. Watson Discovery: Sirion needs the admin API to create projects and collections programmatically with all options that are available in the UI. For example, they cannot find options to select OCR when creating a project/collection. Watson Assistant issues: - Provide a gradient for welcome messages -- more friendly to more enterprise Durga-P-Gudla: **Watsonx.ai Fine-tuning:** Currently SL Fine-tune models using the LoRa adapter and it's targeted for 2H24 roadmap item for x.ai ---- Steve suggested host their model on on-prem (BYOM) and currently SL has SaaS license only **WA/WD:** Currently owns cartridge licenses however they are showing interest towards SaaS offering to avoid management of Infrastructure and reducing the latencies. perepa: Watson Discovery Premium support details to be provided. (Eleni A & Scott Sumner) Chrisphe Guittet , Andrew Cabral discussion Sirion Use Case is that the current document limits on WD Enterprise will not be sufficient to support multiple clients. I'd like them to explore WD Premium to provide Data isolation as well as to support multiple tenants. The other alternative is to instantiate a separate WD for each client. They have strict client data isolation requirements. Data isolation and key separation required perepa: WD File size limitation: Sirion CLM for IBM - the document size 50 mB restriction is becoming an issue. We have contracts that are larger than that. Splitting of these contractual documents is not an option. Pls explore the option to increase the file size. perepa: How does / can we leverage to do the following: 1. Document clustering 2. document similarity -- have we done it with any other clients? Any recommendations to follow? perepa: Provide watsonx.data comparison with comp. perepa: Requirement for Knowledge graphs and document visualization cir: @dilang @Angela-Jamerson dilang: @ssm can you share more details of the following Watson Assistant issues? _Provide a gradient for welcome messages -- more friendly to more enterprise_ Also, forwarded WD issue to Christophe... cir: @eleniaa @Durga-P-Gudla Can we get a consolidated list of items that you need to have addressed? Or are all items being addressed at this time? eleniaa: @cir Please see the updated first comment in this ticket. I will setup a call this coming week to align on this list and how we can best collaborate given the CIO office is client 0. @dilang @ssm @Durga-P-Gudla fyi Mekki-MacAulay: > Provide watsonx.data comparison with comp. Is there a specific comparison requested that isn't already in https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCbbPfP64CX3RG4CJPH7bH8XjGBP ? cir: @eleniaa Okay to move this to Watchlist at this point? Or are there specific items the need action at this time? eleniaa: @cir I am not sure what is meant by watchlist. The list is prioritized with several blockers and critical issues that are all being worked. cir: @eleniaa @dilang We need to quickly come back with the WD roadmap. dilang: Just sent another email to PMs. eleniaa: @cir @dilang I agree - it's been over one month since we've asked for a WD roadmap. Although Sirion has been in business ~12 years, they are operating in a startup mentality with their adoption of Gen AI. They will not wait for IBM. cir: @dilang Has a roadmap been provided? dilang: Suj Perepa shared WD roadmaps with the client 3/22. eleniaa: @dilang Suj spoke generally to WD's roadmap, she did not provide any roadmaps from OM. Furthermore, the excel this github issue refers to tracks several issues which have yet to be addressed. @ssm @cir fyi dilang: Reopened issue and I will check with PM again. ychunhui: Each WD is $5000/instance for premium plan, ideally data isolation works for multi-tenancy on the single instance for SironLab to be cost-saving. Details: 1. Client has one premium plan instance, 2. create different access groups, and 3. validat users who are not assigned to the access group to the instance and should NOT see the project and corresponding data collections in the project. Result: Validate it with Suj and Sunil P on 4/11/2024 on IBM Cloud account and multi-tency works on WD SaaS on IBM Cloud premium based on our test per Suj's question. 4. another new scenario to validate: same single WD instance, two access groups for different projects on the same instance with different data collections Steps: admin give Chunhui a WD HR instance access with a new access group, then Chunhui check if she can see HR_LD project + the corresponding data collection. Expected result should be she doesn't have access the unassigned project and data because she is not invited to the project. But she can see the project she is invited to along with the data collection. kgajda: Update from Scott Sumner-Moore/Eleni for execs. - 4/18/24 - Exec watchlist status = yellow; F2F held with good results: concrete plans begun for true co-creation to select and advance key Sirion use case (either Talk To My Corpus or Auto-Redlining). Follow-up conversations to be scheduled to dig deeper into and define architecture and executable plans for Sirion's embedding of IBM products. cir: Exec watchlist status = yellow; execs to resolve disconnect on partnership approach; co-creation effort beginning tomorrow with Sirion providing an architecture review and their measures of success, followed by identifying next steps. Infrastructure for CIO progressing well -- production is multi-zone and DR is enabled; SSO in progress. kgajda: From Durga on 5/8/24: Exec watchlist status = yellow; Co-creation effort progressing with Sirion, demo of IBM Cloud Security and Compliance Center scheduled for next week. Invoice and credit issue resolved, credits to be burned down against usage. Environment setup in-progress, MVP scope discussion held. Decommissioning of WA/WD self hosted environment has been completed. Next steps: continue co-creation effort, progress infrastructure setup for co-creation, starting of co-creation project activity. Durga-P-Gudla: [Sirion_WA_concerns.xlsx](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/files/1336595/Sirion_WA_concerns.xlsx) update the list of concerns raised by the sirion about the WA. Durga-P-Gudla: [Sirion_WA_concerns.xlsx](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/files/1340669/Sirion_WA_concerns.xlsx) @ychunhui @cir As discussed today, I created separate idea requests for each concern and updated the Excel sheet. Let me know if you need any additional details. dilang: Peter Keller from PM team joined call today (5/28). Scott will reschedule the call to Friday (5/31). 1) Peter to provide info from Tech PM about: History being saved in complex formats Saving sessions â€“ pick up where you left off UI Enhancements â€“ significant no-code improvements wanted 2) Peter to show AskSales demo TALS: @eleniaa - is it still valid? Can we close? dilang: @eleniaa - is it still valid? Can we close? eleniaa: @TALS yes, you can close, this data is stale. @ssm fyi

Title: Responding to Security questions on watsonx and IBM Cloud - where to find and who to contact for responses - CSM Playbook?
Labels: help wanted, EMEA, watsonx.ai, playbook update, watsonx products
Comments: FRANKO: Hi @cir I have agreed with Andrea Tonti he will summarise his findings and gaps when requested to respond to customer security questions on watsonx SaaS and IBM Cloud. In EMEA the IBM Cloud Security focal is Jurgen Lang  cir: @FRANKO Is there a box note or summary? So we can start to build out a security and compliance section for SaaS in the playbooks. FRANKO: Hi @cir I have agreed with Andrea Tonti that when he have all collected he will do a summary and share. The can then serve a basis for sharing and sharing best practice. cir: @cir to follow up with Andrea on findings cir: @FRANKO Any input from Andrea on the requirements and information suggested to add this to playbook? FRANKO: @cir Have tried to add Andrea-tonti to this git but get user is suspended FRANKO: @cir Update: The match with the client on this topic is not over yet; as soon as we close the match Andea Tonti can provide the summary on his findings. FRANKO: Andrea Tonti lessons learned [https://zenhub.ibm.com/files/1571399/a08d5323-a24d-445a-937d-b8b7e1460c7e/download](https://zenhub.ibm.com/files/1571399/a08d5323-a24d-445a-937d-b8b7e1460c7e/download) cir: @FRANKO This is slated to be created in the playbook by end of March 21. cir: @FRANKO PM are still finalizing the watsonx security compliance roadmap. Is this the type of a structure you are looking for? ## Cloud Computing Security Compliance Template ### Introduction To help you get started, I've created a template web page that covers the key cloud computing security compliance requirements. ### Cloud Security Compliance Checklist #### Access Control and Identity Management - Implement strong user authentication (e.g., multi-factor authentication) - Establish role-based access controls to limit user permissions - Regularly review and update user access privileges - Implement secure password management policies #### Data Protection and Encryption - Encrypt data at rest and in transit using industry-standard encryption algorithms - Implement data backup and recovery procedures - Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) #### Network Security - Establish secure network architecture (e.g., firewalls, VPNs, network segmentation) - Monitor and log network traffic for potential threats - Implement DDoS protection and web application firewall (WAF) solutions #### Incident Response and Business Continuity - Develop and regularly test incident response and disaster recovery plans - Establish processes for detecting, reporting, and responding to security incidents - Ensure business continuity in the event of a disruption or outage #### Compliance and Regulatory Requirements - Identify and comply with relevant industry regulations and standards (e.g., NIST, ISO, PCI DSS) - Regularly review and update compliance policies and procedures - Conduct periodic audits and assessments to ensure ongoing compliance cir: https://pages.github.ibm.com/csm-playbook/playbook/common/data-ai/csm-data-ai-wx-saas-security/ cir: Moving this to watchlist keely: Closing per Frank We will be escalating C5 certifications at Exec review with Ritika next week.

Comments: Yumi-Kim1: @cir I will let you know which model need to be focused after discussing with local team (CE). I appreciate for all your help. (https://huggingface.co/mncai/llama2-13b-dpo-v7) But the CE team also wants to try the other LLMs if it is available the next. Thank you. The answer from the Korea CE team. --------------------------------------------- Here is the list of LLMs for the Korean language. Recently, our team members (on the mailing list) conducted LLM tasks (including QnA, summarization) to select the candidates as follows. 1st = https://huggingface.co/mncai/llama2-13b-dpo-v7 2nd = https://huggingface.co/hyeogi/SOLAR-10.7B-dpo-v1 3rd = https://huggingface.co/yanolja/Bookworm-10.7B-v0.4-DPO Note - Based on our experiments, the best option for Korean LLM is llam2-13b-dpo-v7. - But we also want to try the other LLMs if they are available. Moreover, we plan to have a sharing session (for Korea Tech teams) about our experimental results and why we chose the above models. I will update the session after the holiday (i.e., Luna New Yearâ€™s Day). cir: @Yumi-Kim1 Provided to PM Yumi-Kim1: @cir Thank you.
