Title: Global Knowledge Cloud - Performance issue between WA and watsonx ( #CS3788442)
Labels: help wanted, APAC, watsonx.ai, ISA, wx assistant
Comments: cir: May need to reach out to Robert Yates, but will need a PMR # @dilang dilang: @cir Can you share the full name of CSM? kiran-raghupathy: The full name of the CSM is Krishna Balaga  Can you please include him in this thread krbalaga: Hi Team, A Cloud PMR has been raised for the same **#CS3788442**, - The CE team initially involved in the POC demonstrated the capabilities and helped with the architecture of the entire build. But as this is a post-POC stage, they are hesitant to get involved [AML+CMA+IFRS-action.json.zip](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/files/1283549/AML%2BCMA%2BIFRS-action.json.zip) - All three services, Watson Assistant, Watsonx.ai and Watson Discovery have been deployed in the US-South region, while the customers access it from India. - Currently, the customer wants to cut Assistant out of the picture and consume Discovery and WatsonX, but that would impact our expansion into Watsonx Assistant and other cloud services they consume. - So Far, they have been seeing value only in terms of Accessing the LLama2 model, hence they have also started exploring other solutions like arcane cloud as they are not tied to the Eco System, so we might end up losing a customer if we don't deliver value with Discovery and Assistant Ecosystem - I have attached the flows they have used in their assistant environment to this thread. dilang: @krbalaga The support team is waiting for the client response. Support team sent messages to the inbox of 'watsonx@gkcloudsolutions.com' krbalaga: Hi @dilang , the customer point of focal who has access to the mailbox was travelling, I've requested him to extend the access to people working on the field, we shall have the update from them in next one hour, thanks :) krbalaga: Hi Team, Here is the current update and the required assets from GK Attached herewith this mail is the file gk_assests.zip, containing the following: . The actions skill config file (AML+CMA+IFRS.json) of the assistant, Integration file (discovery-watsonx-actions.json) used to build the assistant and the screenshot of the response, post querying the watson.ai LLM models (Llama 13b and Llama 70b). . Time elapsed for inferring Llama 13b model is ~ 12seconds, and the same for Llama 70b is ~ 20 secs for the same input prompt and the input params (response length of about 250 tokens). . The screen shots are the response for the API call to just the LLMs, no other Watson resource is involved. Additionally, The Setup dealing with integration of Watson Discovery, Watson.ai and the streaming param enabled ,we notice the tokens begin streaming post 7secs (Avg latency). [gk_assests.zip](https://github.ibm.com/customer-success-management/watsonx/files/1285761/gk_assests.zip) The latency is consistent for each input query. cir: @dilang Can you set up a call on this one, we need to understand more on the latency front. dilang: @krbalaga The support team requested more information on Feb 13, _You provided 2 action skills which seem to be the same. But they also use an extension. Please provide the extension, or if you are using an existing Discovery service to do the search?_ Let me know if we need to have a quick call. krbalaga: Hi @dilang and @cir the extension being used it attached in the zip, I can check the customer's availability for the call tomorrow, please suggest available slots dilang: @krbalaga Please let the client update the support case and request meeting via support case. I will also talk to support team Monday. krbalaga: @dilang sure, thank you. will update the customer dilang: @krbalaga It looks the support engineer (Ritika.Kumari@ibm.com) is in the same timezone as you. I will connect you and please sync up with her before meeting with the client. krbalaga: sure @dilang will anyone from the product team be joining us? or we can schedule a meeting as per the availability of the support engineer and the client? krbalaga: have updated all the case with requested details, here is a remark from the support teams: "This customer is a basic support tier customer and does not qualify for SLO entitlement. If they want priority support they need to upgrade their support tier to Advanced or Premium." krbalaga: the customer is also trying out streaming through the given API docs but the generate_text_stream method is breaking if there is an emoji or other kind of non-English characters in the response: https://ibm.github.io/watson-machine-learning-sdk/fm_model_inference.html There is an initial delay of 2-5 seconds and then the streaming starts dilang: @krbalaga can you ask the client update the case? Support team still waiting for the information. @cir the client also noticed initial delay of 2-5 seconds of generate_text_stream method (non-English characters). Have you heard it from other client? @vijesh-bhaktha See the latency issue above, any insight from other clients on RAG use cases? _As per on our prior conversation, we lack adequate information to work with the case. As mentioned in our colleague's previous email, we are awaiting the following details.:- ***************************************************************************************************************************************************************************** Are you able to provide a response time if you make the same query directly to Discovery? This request was asked by our colleague Radu back on Feb 5th. "In addition, could you please advise if you have tested directly with your prompts and sample data retrieved from Watson Discovery against watsonx.ai and if so, what response times did you observe ? Also, what watsonx.ai model are you using have you experimented with models with a smaller number of parameters?" You provided 2 action skills which seem to be the same. But they also use an extension. Please provide the extension, or if you are using an existing Discovery service to do the search? ***************************************************************************************************************************************************************************** Can you please provide us with the transaction ID? This will allow us to confirm whether this is expected or not._ krbalaga: Here are the Minutes from yesterday's face-to-face Meet/ Working session at GK Office: Summary:As per the conclusion of discussions with Dinesh, Pavan and the Team yesterday in the second half, the Latency numbers are in green compared to competitorâ€™s offerings and the project requirement. So, we are a go in terms of taking the build to market. The optimal scenario we are taking up right now is:Using Only Watson Discovery and Watsonx.ai With streaming enabled: 2-4 second prefetch delay and wait for Watson Assistant to support text streaming (Most likely early Q2).  Weâ€™ve also discussed on the enterprise scalability and the API Usage of Assistant which is where the true commercial value of the product lies and how it can be harnessed to deliver a HA Conversation gateway as part of our solution. The Ask:The team needs a way to integrate text streaming from watsonx.ai into Watson Assistant. Next Steps:Now we need to work on understanding various accuracy optimizations for discovery/watsonx.airesponses to be more accurate, relevant and coherent with Temporal references.Krishna - to set up a working session next week to work on Accuracy optimizationsKrishna - to check with the product teams on Watsonx.ai text stream integration with Watson Assistant GK Team - To explore the resource shared to work with conversation persistence using the Assistantâ€™s Logging APIs ( https://cloud.ibm.com/apidocs/assistant-v2#listlogs )GK Team - To scope down the Accuracy issues and other inconsistencies they are facing while consuming the services.  We've run a battery of tests that helped us dissect the Latency issue and here are the results:   Streaming | System Instructions | Decoding Method | Response Time (avg. Seconds) -- | -- | -- | -- No | No | Greedy | 10 No | Yes | Greedy | 17 No | Yes | Sample | 20 Yes | No | Greedy | 2 Yes | Yes | Greedy | 4 Yes | Yes | Sample | 5           Before optimisation:API calls Watsonx.Ai+Discovery: Without streaming: 17-20 sec (max_tokens=600, decoding=sampling)With streaming enabled: 2-4 seconds prefetch delay Optimised for the following :We've worked with various context lengths of instructions in sys to understand its impact on the delay.We migrated the current API to use the Greedy Decoding strategy which shaved off up to 2 seconds from the output.We've discussed strategies to alter the max_tokens param based on the intent of the input. Post optimisations:API calls to Watsonx.Ai+Discovery: Without streaming : 8-12 sec (max_tokens=600,decoding=greedy)With streaming enabled: 2-4 second prefetch delay. Including Watson Assistant:If Watson Assistant is included in the loop, there is an Intermittent increase of up to 3-4  seconds on top of non-stream response time.  cir: @dilang @TALS See above. TALS: @krbalaga - Have you tried the new v2.1? - Should have much better latency krbalaga: will check with them on the same @TALS cir: @krbalaga Can this be closed? keely: @krbalaga Can this be closed? keely: Closing due to no response.

Comments: siyuan-zhang-ibm: ### Further information **Model used in watsonx.ai** `model_id = "meta-llama/llama-2-70b-chat" # Token limit of llama-2-70b-chat is 4096` **Tuning parameters applied** ``` params = { "decoding_method": "sample", "max_new_tokens": 1500, "min_new_tokens": 30, "stream": False, "top_k": 10, "top_p": 0.6, "temperature": 0.1, "stop_sequences": ["]"], "truncate_input_tokens": (4095-1500), } ``` **Prompt code** ``` template = """ [INST] > ## INSTRUCTIONS ## * you are a recruiting bot whose goal is to assist companies with screening of incoming job candidates * you are given a Job Requirements which your company needs to fill under ## JOB REQUIREMENTS ## section * job requirements are given as a JSON ARRAY with the following structure * [{{"requirement": REQUIREMENT}}, ... ] * under job requirements you are given a summary of some resume under ## RESUME SUMMARY ## section * you should return a single JSON ARRAY with the following schema: * [{{"requirement": REQUIREMENT, "match_score": MATCH_SCORE, "explanation: EXPLANATION"}}, ... ] * REQUIREMENT is a copy of REQUIREMENT from job requirements * MATCH_SCORE should be an integer from 1 to 10 specifying how well the resume summary fits the REQUIREMENT (10 for ideal match) * EXPLANATION should be 1-2 sentences explaining and justifying MATCH_SCORE * your response should start with '[' and end with ']' > ## JOB REQUIREMENTS ## {jd} ## RESUME SUMMARY ## {cv} [/INST] [""" ``` cir: @Aya-Tokura I am trying to assess the above comments. Do you need a wx.ai SME to review? Title: D&B watsonx & cp4d certification on OCP/GCP
Comments: glepore: **Issue as it stands on Jan 11, 2024.** ----------------------------------------- From: Steven Astorino  Date: Thursday, January 11, 2024 at 6:17 PM To: Monica Romila , Paul van Run , Naren Kulkarni , Kanchana Padmanabhan , Francis Wong , MARYAM ASHOORI , Eric Saleh  Cc: VIKRAM MURALI , Sunil Dube , Denise O'Neil , Ori Sternberg  Subject: Re: watsonx.ai deployment to GCP - possible timeline and preparedness **Ok lets do it, D&B will go somewhere else if we donâ€™t support it. They have been clear on that.** From: Monica Romila  Date: Thursday, January 11, 2024 at 3:12 PM To: Steven Astorino , Paul van Run , Naren Kulkarni , Kanchana Padmanabhan , Francis Wong , MARYAM ASHOORI , Eric Saleh  Cc: VIKRAM MURALI , Sunil Dube , Denise O'Neil , Ori Sternberg  Subject: Re: watsonx.ai deployment to GCP - possible timeline and preparedness Hi Steve **We never tested .ai on GCP. It would be good to install and run some tests.** Thank you, Monica Romila, Ph.D. Director, Data Science Tools and Runtimes, IBM Data and AI Phone: +1-905-413-2427 e-mail: mromila@ca.ibm.com -------------------------------------------------------------------- ### **See below for state of wx.ai readiness to run certified on GCP** From: Paul van Run  Date: Thursday, January 11, 2024 at 2:50 PM To: Naren Kulkarni , Kanchana Padmanabhan , Francis Wong , MARYAM ASHOORI , Monica Romila , Eric Saleh  Cc: Steven Astorino , VIKRAM MURALI , Sunil Dube , Denise O'Neil , Ori Sternberg  **Subject: Re: watsonx.ai deployment to GCP - possible timeline and preparedness** Naren We currently do not list GCP as a certified supported platform for watsonx.ai as we do for AWS. The work to install and test this configuration has not been performed, and we do not have installation instruction like the AWS ones you included. The earlier work we did for AWS will help somewhat, but providing GCP as a supported platform is a new, and not insignificant effort and will require developers, GCP hardware and time. It also means we need to re-test/certify this on every WX-CPD release moving forward. You want a written commitment in 2-3 weeks, but when would D&B actually need to have this delivered? Having a date will help us plan. To my knowledge GCP support currently does not show up as a roadmap item for our Q1 or Q2 releases. If this is an important opportunity, and if GCP support is critical to that opportunity then we need to work with WX product management to get this prioritized among our other deliverables. I would refer to Maryam Ashoori (cc:-ed) and her product management team to assess the priority of this ask compared to other deliverables. Paul van Run STSM watsonx.ai dtoczala: Additional company with this same issue: Ford cir: Ford Action: Full Stack testing or certification. cir: Bank of Nova Scotia a GCP client ANZ GCP client cir: @Sunil-Pothakamuri I am following up with Monica have you received any information? cir: @Sunil-Pothakamuri Engineering has the cluster and will hopefully get GPUs. rohernan: Per Astorino, dev will deliver in 2 weeks. ~March 1. TALS: GCP issue been raised with development (Remus): Currently no solution, they have issues related to OPC on GCP and development are working with RH trying to solve it cir: @Sunil-Pothakamuri I have heard that wasonx has been certified on GCP? are you aware? and if so can this be closed out or do we still need to get the CP4D stack certified? TALS: @vijesh-bhaktha we need official confirmation for the GCP support and guidelines of how to. We heard from development that it has been achieved. cir: #45 comments related to public communication to be provided avarshn: @cir @TALS this is the formal documentation that I have been pointed to by the team. https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/4.8.x?topic=planning-cloud-deployment-environments. Per Monica the issue specific to D&B was for shielded VMs and NVIDIA drivers for GPUs. RH is working with NVIDIA to have them have a fix sometime by June; until then we need to disable the options for the drivers. There is no additional formal documentation planned at this point. glepore: @avarshn @cir @TALS 1. Am confused why are we pointing to CP4D documentation (https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/4.8.x?topic=planning-cloud-deployment-environments) when we're asking for wx.ai/OCP/GCP certification; the CP4D documentation says nothing about supporting watsonx on OCP/GCP. If I'm the customer this documentation doesn't convince me, it confuses me. Not to mention the installation documentation for wx.ai doesn't **1)** say anything about supported cloud deployment environments independent of CP4D, and **2)** starts with the disclaimer that **wx.ai is NOT a CP4D service yet documents the installation of wx.ai nested 4 levels deep under CP4D 4.8.x->Services & Integrations->Services->AI Services->watsonx.ai!** ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/43705/files/1d0aa1ca-c26e-4182-9d60-28e4922d8fff) Truly, is it just me who thinks this is so confusing? Why is it that watsonx doesn't have/can't have it's own separate documentation? 2. _Per Monica the issue specific to D&B was for shielded VMs and NVIDIA drivers for GPUs. RH is working with NVIDIA to have them have a fix sometime by June; until then we need to disable the options for the drivers_ -> **Am checking with the CSM team on whether the Jun fix date/disabling the driver options in the interim impacts the project schedule.** glepore: Team, more info from CSM Naren Kulkarni (naren.kulkarni@ibm.com) regarding dev delivery/testing of wx.ai on GCP: - There is now a test/trial GCP environment being built by SWG team in IBM - funded by a Credit Card provided by @Steve Astorino - We have wx.ai and wx.gov already installed - The wx.ai is with GPU's but the boot up for shielded VM's is disabled due to NVIDIA driver incompatibility with OpenShift (RH waiting for a fix from NVIDIA in Jun) - The environment is on GCP - owned by IBM - No involvement with D&B as of now - The Production deployment will be on GCP infrastructure owned by D&B - The D&B production environment deployment **will be affected by the JUNE 2024 availability** of the NVIDIA drivers/Operator with OpenShift 4.16, as we plan to stand-up the PROD environment by **End-Of-May 2024** TALS: @glepore there is an update to the page - please check the update for GCP self-managed ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/71412/files/6b43319e-b3ec-4926-a667-e3043382a129) ![image](https://media.github.ibm.com/user/71412/files/74ba1c77-43b7-4f08-9d81-2387dd3b0007) As per same namespace this is different topic cir: wx.ai GPU - NVIDIA Operators in OCP (June timeline) Q2 Shielded VM is needed to run CP4D and wx core TEL working on workaround - Sunil to communicate with client on NVIDIA Operators. Dev env planned for April 15th 19th of May is production. cir: @Sunil-Pothakamuri Can we move this to watchlist? Sunil-Pothakamuri: @cir Yes, lets move to watchlist. TALS: @Sunil-Pothakamuri and @cir - can this be closed? dilang: @Mekki-MacAulay is engaging from PM. keely: @Sunil-Pothakamuri Can this be closed now? keely: Closing due to lack of response. Please re-open if need be @Sunil-Pothakamuri

As a Product watsonx.ai requires an INGRESS Interface that allows Natural Language Text -to- SQL Transformer 2. For D&B the Transformer looks like - will be using watsonx Assistant with Extensions - and watsonx Assistant frontend will handle all translation requirements - at least that is the current thought process 3. NO RFE required for D&B But please do not close the issue - it could change at short notice. cir: @naren-kulkarni Any updates on this, i.e. any specific issues needing to be addressed? If not I will move this to client watchlist. naren-kulkarni: This requirement can be closed now There are 2 - 3 options that have come forth 1. watsonx Assistant [NLP capability] with watsonx Discovery for Deep Search 2. watsonx Orchestrate, which will get added to the ELA Catalog - will be a primary upgrade path from watsonx Assistant 3. The AskProcurement Requirement could be separated out from the Internal-D&B UseCases in Legal/HR/ProdOps and Suatainability As a result - this requirement is now redundant and hence can be closed **Thanks Campbell !!** TALS: The new models (Llama 3.1 and Mistral Large) solve it

Title: Co-existance fo watsonx and Cloud Pak for Data in the same OpenShift Project (All Geos)
Labels: Americas, EMEA, APAC, watsonx.ai, watsonx.data, Pricing/Licensing
Comments: cir: Tieto being impacted FRANKO: BAFIN just upgraded to Cp4D v4.8 and want to install watsonx on this platform. cir: Documentation for watsonx.data being updated. cir: @Angela-Jamerson Have we addressed this ? The ability to deploy wastsonx.ai onto the same namespace ? cir: @vijesh-bhaktha rohernan: Links to Product Scout Ideas in Aha: [WTNXDATA-I-27](https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WTNXDATA-I-27) [WAI-I-44](https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-44) Mekki-MacAulay: This is a known issue with watsonx.data (and other watsonx) deployments in the same namespace as Cloud Paks, which is why the same namespace deployment is not recommended and not supported. At present, there is no solution and it needs to be addressed by Cloud Pak Platform, likely in the form of a licensing server that tracks these things, which has been on the roadmap for several years but not delivered. The solution from the watsonx.data side is separate namespaces. avarshn: @cir Here's the latest on this from Edward: For watsonx.ai v2.0 (CP4D v5.0), we plan on updating the installation guidance along these lines: "IBM watsonx.ai and watsonx.governance are not Cloud Pak for Data services but can be installed in the same operators project and operands project (namespace) with Cloud Pak for Data and other watsonx services.â€ Some more prelim details for Q&A: Â· Enables sharing of CCS which will be charged at the (lower) CP4D $/VPC price Â· Enables an â€œintegratedâ€ world (eg: sharing of Catalogs, Projects, Assets, etc) Â· Does not allow for mixing of CP4D and watsonx pods, which enables licensing compliance) Â· watsonx documentation may continue to be blended with CP4D documentation (this is less of an issue now that we have a viable coexistence model) Â· [watsonx.ai](http://watsonx.ai/) may require GPUs to be detected in order to be installed (otherwise whatâ€™s the point?) Â· WS/WML & OpenScale/FactSheets will NOT be deprecated from CP4D but are superseded/upgraded by [watsonx.ai](http://watsonx.ai/) and watsonx.governance respectively if installed in the same namespace cir: Wx 2.0 is June (tentative) and CP4D V5.0 in June. kshabalin: Analysis of licensing of watsonx.data+CP4D in one namespace watsonx.data non-chargeable: - CCS - in CP4D Base - Analytics Engine Powered by Apache Spark - in CP4D Base - EDB PostgreSQL with IBM - EDB PostgreSQL - IBM Data Virtualization Manager for z/OS - IBM Data Virtualization Manager for z/OS - With current LI terms: if only watsonx.data is deployed in a namespace, then the above are free, and if any CP4D services are deployed then: - CP4D Base is required for all cores in the namespace: CCS, Analytics Engine and watsonx.data itself. - EDB PostgreSQL and IBM Data Virtualization Manager for z/OS entitlements will be required if the products are installed. kshabalin: **Lockheed Martin** use case of CP4D and watsonx.ai/.gov coexistence. Lockheed uses CP4D as a truly unified data platform - one CP4D cluster with WML, Studio, OpenScale, DataStage, WKC, Db2 WH, Discovery, Assistant, Watson Query. Lockheed wants to keep the platform unified and add watsonx.ai for GenAI capabilities. Lockheed is currently using 250+ VPCs for traditional AI out of 750 VPCs of the full CP4D cluster, with signed growth of 750 VPCs for traditional AI out of 2500 total VPCs over the next 2 years. Lockheed is expecting not to trade up the 250 current VPCs and 750 VPCs in progress of deployment, while being able to add watsonx.ai to the same cluster. The tradeup of 1000 VPCs used for traditional AI without actual benefits, just to be able to add watsonx.ai to the cluster, is prohibitive and a blocker. **Dominion Energy**: 290 VPCs of CP4D used for Watson Studio and WKC. Want to use watsonx.ai and .data as One platform. cir: To be addressed in CP4D 5.0 - June Requires Dual Entitlement - Trade Up Program Challenges kshabalin: Reviewed docs on coexistence in CP4D 5.0 - Entitlement tool & Node Pinning enhancements: [https://ibm.ent.box.com/s/dlrphk0ccnfkdfa29omdbzrk4iovszbh](https://ibm.ent.box.com/s/dlrphk0ccnfkdfa29omdbzrk4iovszbh) [https://bigblue.aha.io/features/ICPD-1511](https://bigblue.aha.io/features/ICPD-1511) This licensing part of the CP4D/wx coexistence solution is rushed, complex, convoluted, partial and not properly instrumentalized, as far as what is hown in the docs. PM knows that, as Sachin has mentioned: they were forced to do a quickfix instead of really addressing the problem. In my view we would be much better off not introducing coexistence at all until we can make it right. Otherwise, we are setting ourselves up for failure. @cir @TALS please share your thoughts. Mekki-MacAulay: @kshabalin Agreed. The whole point was to "make it right" for CP4D 5.0 / watsonx.x 2.0. Are we not on track to do that? kshabalin: As per the doc [https://ibm.ent.box.com/s/dlrphk0ccnfkdfa29omdbzrk4iovszbh](https://ibm.ent.box.com/s/dlrphk0ccnfkdfa29omdbzrk4iovszbh): 1. watsonx.data can't coexist with CP4D. (or even with .ai and .gov?) 2. All the components of watsonx.ai and watsonx.gov are licensed as watsonx. This requires immense tradeups of CP4D, even where one is not needed: - All AI/ML workloads of CP4D need to be licensed as watsonx (Watson Studio, WML, Decision Optimization, SPSS Modeler, Watson Machine Learning Accelerator, AI Factsheets, OpenScale) - Watson Pipelines need to be licensed as watsonx, even though they are free with DataStage, and are a Base service in CP4D. - Analytics Engine need to be licensed as watsonx, even if just used for IKC or ETL tasks. - Data Refinery, Execution Engine for Hadoop need to be licensed as watsonx. These are not directly part of AI/ML use cases. 3. watsonx.ai contains unrestricted OCP, while CP4D only includes restricted OCP. 4. Node pinning requires massive additional hardware and goes against core k8s principles. Andrew-Buckler: 1. We confirmed w/ .data dev that this would be supported. If that has changed then it should be roadmap and properly documented. 2. The actual LI restriction is that DS/ML components in CP4D aren't allowed to make FM calls to wx.ai. So there is room within that to finesse some of the points you raise. 3. True, but also true of all the Cartridges so we've already lived with this for 4 years. 4. Agree that pinning for the sake of pinning is an anti-pattern, but with respect to wx/CP: - Many customers want to exclusively pin .ai to maximize GPU utilization - Production lakehouses are likely to be on dedicated nodes, just like production warehouses are - CCS can be worth pinning because its limits exceed its average compute by such a large margin - This is optional, to help address isolation/utilization requirements or for people who want to have a simpler way to count/govern license deployment kshabalin: 3. We were given guidance from OCP CoP not to mix restricted and unrestricted OCP in one project/namespace. According to that rule, as CP4D and Cartridges both have restricted OCP - they can be mixed, but not CP4D and watsonx.ai. I will reach out to check if that guidance has changed. Andrew-Buckler: I had this conversation with RH's director of the IBM synergy relationship back in February. Me: "E.g., I have a user agent that needs 1 vCPU total in the cluster. I can cover that usage with a single Core of unrestricted OpenShift. But the FAQ states "You will still need to ensure that your restricted OpenShift Container Platform cores only run IBM Cloud Pak for X workloads". Usually when I think of controlling what workloads run on what cores, I think of taint/toleration -- but that's node level. Is there a compliant way of doing this on a smaller (per Core) scale?" Him: "In this example, you'd just need to add the 1 core of unrestricted OCP to the cluster to run the 3rd party workload. That core [would be stackable](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/1.0?topic=clusters-restricted-openshift-entitlement) with the restricted OCP cores already there. We mainly care that enough unrestricted OCP was added to the cluster to fully run the 3rd party workload. We don't require any fencing of workloads at the core level within the cluster (OCP doesn't make that easy to do either)." Those are cut and paste from my Slack history. kshabalin: - LI Terms for [watsonx.ai 2.0](https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/?id=L-NYXD-ABGNBT&lc=en), [watson.gov 2.0](https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/?id=L-WJUG-D6AWPM&lc=en), [Cloud Pak for Data 5.0](https://www.ibm.com/support/customer/csol/terms/?id=L-USXC-6EV729&lc=en) do not contain any information on coexistence of CP4D and watsonx, and on watsonx components "superseeding" the same ones in CP4D. - Docs for [Cloud Pak for Data 5.0](https://ibmdocs-test.dcs.ibm.com/docs/en/SSQNUZ_5.0_test?topic=planning-multiple-solutions) also shy away from the subject and don't have info on "superseeding" of watsonx components and implications of installing watsonx and CP4D in one namespace. @cir kshabalin: Discussed with Andrew Buckler on 6/21/2024, - Watson Studio and WML being singleton services is a technical design, and the sole reason of "superseeding" of watsonx services over CP4D. It is not a licensing/packaging, but a technical limitation of our platform. - A technical note should be created to explain how "superseeding" of services works with a link from CP4D and watsonx documentations. cir: Thank you , what is the timeline on the tech note? Campbell Robertson Worldwide Principal Practice Leader for Data & AI for Customer Success IBM Technology ***@***.******@***.***> M: 613-371-8710 From: Konstantin Shabalin ***@***.***> Date: Saturday, June 22, 2024 at 3:41 PM To: customer-success-management/watsonx ***@***.***> Cc: Campbell Robertson ***@***.***>, Mention ***@***.***> Subject: Re: [customer-success-management/watsonx] Co-existance fo watsonx and Cloud Pak for Data in the same OpenShift Project (All Geos) (Issue #2) Discussed with Andrew Buckler on 6/21/2024, * Watson Studio and WML being singleton services is a technical design, and the sole reason of "superseeding" of watsonx services over CP4D. It is not a licensing/packaging, but a technical limitation of our platform. * A technical note should be created to explain how "superseeding" of services works with a link from CP4D and watsonx documentations. â€” Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub Enterprise, or unsubscribe. You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID: ***@***.***> cir: TechNote required - @vijesh-bhaktha Who will be providing this guidance jbamfor: Please see the following topics in the 5.0 docs: - [Planning for multiple solutions](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/5.0.x?topic=planning-multiple-solutions) - [Applying your entitlements and pinning pods to nodes](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/5.0.x?topic=entitlements-applying-your-pinning-pods-nodes) kshabalin: Comment from Andrew Buckler on creating a Tech note: likely my team is going to be responsible, coordinating with Michael Connor. Will be back from vacation on July 8, we'll start then.

Title: Multi Language Support (All Geos)
Labels: enhancement, help wanted, Americas, EMEA, APAC, Production Deployment Blocker, No Plans to Deploy Risk
Comments: FRANKO: Input from Italy on Italian language Hi Frank, Iâ€™d like to share my feedback about the need to have the Italian language in all WatsonX projects Let me start with a consideration: nowadays all our customers have experienced OpenAI/MS. It is not only our main competitor but the first object of comparison during the POC we do . OpenAI is born with multi-language support, so one of the first Customer assumptions is that our solution supports Italian too Currently the Granite models cannot be used in Italian (in particular for the generative capabilities) and most pilots we are implementing require to work on Italian data So far, the only available choice is to work with the Meta LLama2 model, the only one able to generate an Italian text with a good/acceptable quality But even about Lama2 in Italian, however, there are many limitations: â€¢ it is not officially "supported" for Italian, its training base is 0.2% in our language â€¢ it is not very reliable and robust when used in Italian, especially for generative functions; it often tends to generate text in English or other languages or generating incomprehensible output simply by mixing random syllables; this behavior penalized the execution of some pilots (for example in one which required the generation of marketing emails in which LLama2 was unable to generate syntactically and linguistically a correct text in Italian) â€¢ requires customers to accept non-IBM Terms & Conditions (specifically Meta's), which may require the customer to pay possible compensation â€¢ it is not possible to use it in some areas, for example in the military one, which is partly blocking us in a pilot with our Military Defense We are waiting for models that will be more robust and reliable, such as Mixtral-8x7B-Instruct-v0.1 on the watsonx.ai prompt lab. We know it is being tested at the moment and the results are encouraging, but I am not sure yet when it will be generally available and if it will be able to solve the aforementioned problems. These are the reasons why I believe it is important to be able to have all the features, even the most advanced ones which support the Italian language. Our customers are increasingly asking for the possibility of making â€œtuning" (prompt tuning, fine tuning, PEFT, etc.) of the models on their data and this could be an opportunity to do so. Â­ As you know we have the RFE too but currently no roadmap for Italian as documented in [watsonx_model roadmap](https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCVfj4mQD7jGT8qTC7gW3qJHWmHP) How can we help to give this issue the right priority? Cordiali Saluti/Regards Marica --------------------------------------------- MariaCarmela (aka Marica) Alesina FRANKO: Hi Campbell, Martin We know a couple of open source LLMs that seem to work well in Italian LLamantino https://huggingface.co/swap-uniba/LLaMAntino-2-7b-hf-ITA and the Mixtral-8x7B-Instruct-v0.1 (waiting for GA) but these are open source so available to other competitors too The best should be having a proprietary one to make the difference and, that could empower our solution Cordiali Saluti/Regards Marica --------------------------------------------- MariaCarmela (aka Marica) Alesina cir: @sawyerst @Angela-Jamerson Do we have a roadmap we can link to on the language support on models? We have a request for Italian. And were are we on the Korean language support? rohernan: Links to Product Scout Ideas in Aha: [WAI-I-20](https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-20) [WAI-I-26](https://ideas.ibm.com/ideas/WAI-I-26) avarshn: @cir @rohernan below is the product documentation page that is the source of truth on which wx.ai models support which languages. This will get updated as we make progress. Also, the wx.ai roadmap is in Seismic that provides visibility into what's coming from a model/language capability standpoint. I have included the link below. https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/fm-model-choose.html?context=wx&audience=wdp. https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCVfj4mQD7jGT8qTC7gW3qJHWmHP FRANKO: Hi @avarshn Seismic link give service unavailable avarshn: Hi @FRANKO might be a Seismic issue...it opened fine at my end just now. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha To comeback with POV. cir: @vijesh-bhaktha Did we ever compile a POV on Mulit - Language support? vijesh-bhaktha: @cir - The strategy we will have for multi-lingual support will be the following - 1. Open Source Models (Partner models - Dependency from partners, we cannot influence their roadmap) - We now have Llama 3.1 and Mixtral Large that now supports a lot more local languages **Llama3.1 officially supported:** English, German, French, Italian, Portuguese, Hindi, Spanish, and Thai. **Mistal-Large officially supported (not limited to)**: English, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Dutch, Polish, Arabic, and Hindi we will continue to integrate partner models on the same day it is released. 3. BYOM (On-Prem and SaaS) - Limited to the list of architectures we support. On a demand basis we can evaluate new architectures. 4. Deploy Model on Demand - providing a set of Curated Models which a user can select from our catalog and deploy as needed. (its targeted for Q3/Q4 2024) (Again this is dependent on BYOM supported architectures) 5. New models from IBM Research that supports new languages (like how Japanese was introduced) - Dependency from Research.
